loans.name: Saimurod

texts.ru: Саймурод трудолюбивый человек, который имеет большую семью. На воспитании имеет девятерых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Дети взрослые также помогают в содержании семьи. Более 26 лет Саймурод занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. В бизнесе помогают сыновья. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений, ядохимикатов и горюче-смазочных материалов. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Saimurod is a hardworking man who has a big family.  He is raising nine children.  His wife takes care of the house and the adult children help support the family.  Saimurod has been farming for over 26 years.  His sons help him with the business.

He would like to take out a loan to buy seed, mineral fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel and lubricants.  He is relying on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris
2012-35
1000000

	Damaris tiene 45 años de edad y vive con su esposo y 2 hijos en la ciudad de San Pedro de Poas, provincia de Alajuela, en las faldas del Volcán Poas. Ella tiene  un servicio de comidas y atención de eventos desde hace 10 años, con esfuerzo y dedicación ha comprado equipos y trabaja con los electrodomésticos de su casa, algunos los tiene que alquilar para brindar el servicio;  dado los costos que esto le implica realiza la cotización y se acerca en el mes de Enero a la Oficina del Banco Nacional en Poas, no obtuvo buena respuesta de esta gestión por lo que siguió sin comprar sus equipos. 
	Fundación Mujer participa en una feria desarrollada en el parque de la comunidad en el mes de Febrero del 2012 y Doña Damaris  quien es acompañada a la feria por la Oficina de la Mujer de esta municipalidad, se le brinda la información de crédito de acceso a los a un préstamo por medio de Kiva.  El crédito se utilizará para la compra de equipo (bandejas un porta bandejas) además un congelador. 
	Ella realiza de 2 a 3 eventos por semana, principalmente los fines de semana, en la mañana se organiza para comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos, depende del tamaño del pedido la hace en la tarde para un evento en la noche y se es más grande se organiza con un día de anticipación. Sus metas destacan equipar mejor su negocio, sentirse desarrollada completamente, como una mujer empresaria y que su aporte mejore las condiciones de su hogar. 

       Su principal limitante es la falta de equipo y transporte, pero espera con esta oportunidad de acceso a crédito y superando estos obstáculos, mejorar cada día más su actividad.
texts.en:
Damaris is 45, and lives with her husband and two children in the town of San Pedro de Poas, in Alajuela province, on the slopes of the Poas Volcano. She has a catering business, and has been serving at events for ten years.  

With effort and dedication she has bought equipment, and works with the electrical appliances in her home. She has to rent some, in order to provide her service, given the cost this involves. She did the costing, and in January approached the National Bank branch in Poas; she didn't get a good response from this action, so she still didn't buy her equipment. 

In February 2012, Fundación Mujer participated in a fair that took place in the community's park, and Damaris, accompanied to the fair by the Women's Office of this municipality, was given information about accessing loans through Kiva. 

The loan will be used to buy equipment (trays and a tray holder) and also a freezer. 

She does two to three events a week, mainly on weekends. In the morning, she arranges to buy ingredients for making the food. Depending  on the size of the order, she does this in the afternoon for an event in the evening. If it is larger she makes the arrangements a day in advance. 

The goals that stand out for her are to equip her business better, and to feel completed developed as a businesswoman--and that her contribution is improving her household circumstances.

Her main limitation is the lack of equipment and transport. But she hopes that with this opportunity to access credit, and by overcoming these obstacles, she will improve her business each day.

loans.use: To buy equipment and a freezer for her food catering business.

loans.name: Yony Luzmila

texts.es:
Yony nació en la ciudad de Cusco y tiene 40 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació pero en épocas de cosecha vive en la ciudad de Lamay, ella se dedica a la cosecha de café. 

Yony en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar a los peones que recolectaran el café. 
Yony pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Yony agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Yony was born in the city of Cusco 40 years ago. She lives in the city of her birth, but at harvest time she lives in the city of Lamay. Her work involves the coffee harvest.

At this time Yony needs a loan to pay workers to collect the coffee beans. She belongs to the “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” Communal Bank of the Asociación Arariwa in Calca Province in Cusco Department, Perú.

Yony is grateful for and appreciates the loan and is committed to making her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to pay workers to collect coffee beans.

loans.name: Ahlidin

texts.ru: Более 15 лет Ахлидин занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов и хлопка. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и его трудолюбие помогло ему достичь успеха. Ахлидин имеет хорошую и дружную семью, у него четверо детей. В бизнесе помогают сыновья и супруга. Ахлидин запрашивает займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений, ядохимикатов и горюче- смазочных материалов. А также остальную сумму хочет использовать для услуг трактора. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Ahlidin has been raising food crops and cotton for more than 15 years.  He is a very hardworking man and his diligence has helped him to attain success.  Ahlidin has a fine and tight-knit family with four children.  His spouse and sons help him with the business.  

Ahlidin is requesting a loan to buy seed, mineral fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel and lubricants.  With the remaining money, he wants to hire a tractor.  He is relying on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seed, mineral fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Toirzhon

texts.ru: Тоиржон женат и на воспитании имеет шестерых детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек, который более 10 лет занимается купле  продажей крупного рогатого скота. Начинал данный бизнес с 2-х голов коров с целью  их  дальнейшего разведения. А сейчас успешно продолжает разведение и продажу скота. В бизнесе помогают жена и сын. Тоиржон запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота и корма для них.
texts.en:
Toirzhon is married and is raising six children.  He is a very hardworking and goal-oriented man, who has been breeding cattle for more than 10 years.  He started his business with two head of cattle with the goal of breeding them.  Now, he continues to breed and sell cattle.  His wife and son help him with the business.  

Toirzhon is requesting a loan to buy cattle and feed.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 29 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y donde vende productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Clorinda en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería pero por campaña escolar comprará útiles escolares como cuadernos y otras cosas más. 

Clorinda pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Clorinda agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Clorinda is 29, and was born in the town of Lamay. She lives in the town where she was born, and where she carries on her livelihood.  She has a small grocery store in her home, where she sells basic household necessities such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil and other products.

On this occasion, Clorinda needs the loan to buy merchandise. But for the back-to-school season, she will buy school supplies such as notebooks and other items.

Clorinda  belongs to the “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa in Calca province, Cusco department, Peru. 

Clorinda appreciates and is grateful for the loan, and promises to pay her monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy school supplies such as notebooks, and other items for the back-to-school season.

loans.name: Sharafidin

texts.ru: Шарафидин разведен, на воспитании имеет семерых детей. Он сам обеспечивает своих детей, из них трое несовершеннолетние. Более 18 лет он занимается купле- продажей ядохимикатов. Данный бизнес является прибыльным, особенно в летний период. Сын помогает в торговле.  Шарафидин запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки ядохимикатов. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Sharafidin is divorced and is raising seven children.  He himself provides for the children, three of whom are minors.  He has been selling pesticides for more than 18 years.  This is a profitable business, especially in Summer.   One son helps with selling.  

Sharafidin is requesting a loan of $1,000 (USD) to buy pesticides.  He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Luz de 49 años de edad,  es casada su esposo se dedica a trabajar en las playas, tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales tres de ellos dependen de sus ingresos, uno va al colegio, ella tiene su casa ubicada en el sur de  San Lorenzo.
Doña Luz se dedica al negocio de venta de carne de cerdo, ropa interior, y cosméticos como colonias, cremas, desodorantes, etc.
Doña Luz solicita el préstamo para compra de 4 cerdos para destazarlos y luego vender la carne en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo.
Con las utilidades de la venta de este producto mandara a su hijo al colegio y comprara mas mercadería para seguir atendiendo a sus clientes, su venta es ambulante ya que ella visita varias comunidades cercanas.
El sueño de Doña Luz es mejorar la casa donde ella vive y esto lo lograra gracias al esfuerzo que día a día realiza con sus ventas.
.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Luz, 49, is married and her husband works on the beaches.  She has 4 children, 3 of whom are dependent upon her income.  One of her children is in school.  Her house is located to the south of San Lorenzo.

Luz has a business selling pork meat, underwear and cosmetics, such as colognes, creams and deodorants.

Luz is requesting a loan to buy 4 pigs, so that she can slaughter them and later sell the meat in the neighborhoods of San Lorenzo.

With the profits from the sale of this product, she will send her son to school, and will buy more merchandise so that she can continue to provide service to her customers.  She sells from place to place, visiting the nearby communities.

Luz's dream is to improve the house that she lives in.  She will achieve this, thanks to the effort that she puts in each day to her businesses.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy pigs and personal products for her businesses

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Luciana nació en la ciudad de Taray y tiene 35 años de edad pero vive en la ciudad Lamay y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de dulces de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Lamay. Luciana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas dulces. Su sueño de Luciana es abrir una tienda de abarrotes. 

Luciana pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Luciana agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Luciana was born in the city of Taray and is 35 years old, but she lives in the city of Lamay where she carries out her economic activities.  She works selling sweets on foot in the city of Lamay.  Now Luciana needs the loan to buy more sweets.  Her dream is to open a grocery store.

Luciana belongs to the Virgencita de Fátima de Lamay communal bank of Asociación Arariwa in the province of Calca, department of Cusco, Peru.

Luciana is grateful for and values the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more sweets.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan es padre soltero y tiene una hija bajo su responsabilidad que actual mente esta estudiando la secundaria. Actualmente el señor Juan trabaja como cocinero en un restaurante ya tiene 14 años trabajando en esa empresa. 
Solicita el préstamo ya que necesita mejorar su patrimonio le están haciendo faltas los acabados del interior y poner el vitropiso  en la casa no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar  el proyecto, es por eso que solicita un crédito y comprar el material que es cemento, pintura y el vitropiso ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejorar en horario adicional a su empleo.
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija y brindarle un mejor patrimonio.
texts.en:
Juan is a single father, and has a daughter he is responsible for, who currently goes to high school. At the present time, Juan is working as cook in a restaurant, and has already been working 14 years at that company. 

He is applying for the loan, because he needs to improve his property, which needs interior finishing work and the installation of ceramic floor tiles. He does not have the money necessary to carry out the project, and that is why he is applying for the loan, in order to buy material such as cement, paint, and ceramic floor tile.  This is because he will be responsible for carrying out the improvements, in his spare hours away from his job.

He wishes to improve his daughter's quality of life and offer her a better legacy.

loans.use: To install ceramic floor tiles, and do interior finishing on his house.

loans.name: Clisanta

texts.es:
La señora Clisanta, de 63 años de edad es madre soltera con 8 hijos  tres de ellos dependen de ella, Doña Clisanta vive en San Lorenzo, Valle, en donde vende la mercadería con la ayuda de una de sus hija.
El negocio de Doña Clisanta es la venta de ropa usada clasificada para uso de niños y adultos, también sale a vender ambulante a varios lugares de San Lorenzo
Esta solicitando 15,000.00 lempiras para la compra de 5 paquetes de ropa americana y artículos plásticos,  ya que desea hacer más grande su negocio y de esa manera  tener mas ganancias y así seguir apoyando a su hija que también es madre soltera con tres hijos, Doña Clisanta desea apoyar  a sus  hijos para construir la casa en donde pueda crecer a sus tres hijos y nietos.
Doña Clisanta es una persona muy luchadora y con su esfuerzo a podido salir adelante sola y mantener a sus hijos, es un gran ejemplo para muchas personas que le admiran.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Clisanta, 63, is a single mother with eight children, three of them dependent on her.  Clisanta lives in San Lorenzo, Valle, where she sells merchandise with the help of one of her daughters.

Clisanta's business is selling used clothing for children and adults.  She also goes out on foot to various places in San Lorenzo to sell.

She is requesting 15,000 lempiras (HNL) to buy five bundles of clothing from the United States and plastic goods, because she wants to make her business bigger and in this way have more profits to continue supporting her daughter, who also is a single mother with three children.  Clisanta wants to support her children to build the house where her children and grandchildren can grow up.

Clisanta is very much a fighter, and with her effort she has been able to get ahead alone and support her children.  She is a great example for many people who admire her.

San Lorenzo, Honduras--March 2012

loans.use: to buy five bundles of clothing from the United States and plastic goods for her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 50 years,married to Lucy and they are blessed with children. He does welding in the Githurai area where he has been in this business for the last 12 years and gets an income of KES.13,600 per month.

Samuel is applying for his first loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to buy welding materials and also pay workers. He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees and grow his business.

He hopes to grow his business to be big and educate his children and build more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy welding metals and pay workers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 62-year-old lady from Migori County. She is married to Joash and they have four children all of whom they have educated through this business.

Joyce operates a business of selling fresh milk and has done it for the last 10 years making a monthly income of KES. 7,000. She is now taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to add stock of milk for sale. She will use her profits to repay the loan.

Her dream is to build a family house.

loans.use: To add stock of milk for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar for sale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 42-year-old lady from Bungoma town. She is married to Richard and they have five children aged between 10 and 20 years.

Rosemary operates a bricks making business, a business she has been doing for the last 12 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy raw materials for brick-making like firewood. Her profits will be used to expand her business.

Her dream is to be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for brickmaking like firewood

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: El sr José tiene 30 años y es casado con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 3, 7 y 4 años, dos ya se encuentran en edad escolar, el Sr. José se dedica  al servicio de chapa y pintura tiene su taller que se encuentran en su mismo domicilio,  este es el primer préstamo que tiene dentro de la institución,  José utilizara este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción  para refacciones de ambientes en su terreno que tiene en la localidad de Vinto, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de efectivo, José  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia de talleres mas grandes y  utilizara los beneficios en la  compra de herramientas mas especializadas, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Jose is 30, married with three children ages 3, 7 and 4, two are in school, Jose works doing bodywork and painting of cars in his shop located at his home address, this is the first loan for him with the institution, Jose will use the loan to buy spare parts and tools for his shop located in Vinto, the reason he requests the loan is because he is in need of cash, Jose faces challenges in his business such as competition from bigger shops and he will benefit by buying more specialized tools, he is a hardworking person and feels happy, thankful with the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 48 años de edad y  vive en la ciudad Lamay y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, él es albañil y realiza enchapados, revestimiento y también trabaja para una empresa privada. Alejandro en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para la educación de sus hijos. Su sueño de Alejandro es abrir un restaurante turístico.  

Alejandro pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Alejandro agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Alejandro was born in the city of Lamay and is 48 years old.  He lives in the city of Lamay where he carries out his economic activities.  He is a builder and makes veneering and flooring, and also works for a private company.  Now Alejandro needs the loan for his children's education.  His dream is to open a restaurant for tourists.

Alejandro belongs to the Virgencita de Fátima de Lamay communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa in the province of Calca in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Alejandro is grateful for and values the loan, and promises to make his monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 43-year-old married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has owned a produce store for the last six years. He started with capital of 1,500,000 shilling but now has 4,000,000 shillings. However, his challenges are price fluctuations and inflation and the fact that he deals in agricultural products which are seasonal. His dream is to educate his children and to expand his business into a renowned produce store in Kamwenge. Thomas needs this loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 35 years old, married with one child. She does dairy farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for 7 years and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a dairy cow and feeds.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and feeds

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed is a married man. He has 4 children and 3 are enrolled in school. Mohamed operates a carpentry business and sells his goods from home. He has  worked in this business for 10 years and was previously employed as a farmer. Mohamed's other source of income includes cash products. He describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mohamed will use the Kes 25,000 loan to purchase timber and nails for his carpentry business. Mohamed aspires to become a supplier of timber production in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber and nails for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Purevkhuu

texts.en:
Borrower Purevkhuu is a-33-year-old married lady who has two daughters and lives with her family in the outer ger (nomadic tent) district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia which lacks basic infrastructure. Her older daughter attends primary school while her husband works as a driver at a local company. 

She has been supporting her family by operating a computer service business for a few years. Her business can attract more customers but she doesn’t have a color printer which most of her customers need. Thus, she is requesting 2.000.000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase a color printer and other necessary facilities.

loans.use: to buy a color printer

loans.name: Washington

texts.en:
Washington is 29 years old and married with one child. He sells chips and mangoes to earn a living. He describes his customers as low-income earners because they live in slums. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 25,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes for making chips and mangoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for making chips and mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Aty está situado en la ciudad de Curuguaty tiene la cantidad de 11 mujeres en donde todas son vecinas y amigas como también están las que son parientes. Este grupo es reconocido en el barrio por la unión con que trabajan y por también por su trabajo en equipo.
Porfiria es una de las miembros del grupo, y ella nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña despensa bien abastecida, con la cual surte a las personas de su barrio. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Su meta es podre seguir creciendo y algún día poder tener un mini súper.
Ella solicita la ayuda de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás artículos, que son los que más salida tienen, y por ello quiere surtir su local.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty communal bank is located in the city of Curuguaty.  There are 11 women, all of whom are neighbors and friends, and some are also relatives.  This group is known in the neighborhood for the closeness with which they work as well as for their teamwork.

Porfiria is one of the members of the group, and she tells us that she has a small, well-stocked pantry with which she supplies people in her neighborhood.  She describes herself as a very hardworking person and a fighter who always makes the maximum effort to be able to help her family by means of her job.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing and some day be able to have a convenience store.

She is requesting the help of Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to buy food, beverages, dairy products, and other items, which are what sells best, so she wants to supply her store.

loans.use: to buy household necessities to supply the pantry.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is a 50-year-old farmer from a small village of the Terjola District. He lives alone in the village. Agriculture is the only source of income for Ramin. He has three milk cows. Ramin produces cheese and sells it locally to dairy-products retailers. Also, Ramin has a vineyard with 2,000 vine trees. He produces wine and sells it from the house. His total average monthly income is 450 Laris. 

Ramin decided to grow potatoes on a family-owned plot of the land. He has experience in potato-growing. With the requested credit, Ramin will purchase potatoes for sowing, as well as medicines, to treat them later from parasites. Ramin will sell harvested potatoes on the local market to greengrocery retailers. His income will increase and Ramin will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing and medicines against parasites.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 44 años de edad y vive en la ciudad Lamay y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, ella también se dedica a la venta de cuy al horno en su pequeño restaurante, ella también se dedica a la venta de maíz para elaborar jora. Aurelia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Su sueño Aurelia sacar profesional a sus hijos. 

Aurelia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Aurelia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Aurelia was born in the city of Lamay, she is 44 years olds and still resides in Lamay where she also works.  She raises small animals like guinea pigs and hens but also sells oven-baked guinea pigs at her little restaurant as well as selling corn to make jora.  Aurelia is requesting this loan to purchase small animals like hens and guinea pigs.  Aurelia's dream is to see her children become professionals.  She is part of the communal bank, " Virgencita De Fatima De Lamay', part of the Arariwa association and province of Calca, a department of Cusco, Peru.  Aurelia is thankful and treasures the loan; she commits to timely monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase small animals like guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 years old. She is married to Alfred and blessed with four children. She sells fish as well as tomatoes and onions to her customers, a business that she started six years ago. She earns a monthly income of 9,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase fish, three crates of tomatoes and two sacks of onion. The anticipated profit will help her buy a cow and educate her children. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land in Eldoret. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase fish, three crates of tomatoes and two sacks of onion.

loans.name: Penda

texts.en:
Penda lives in Yei. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 45 years old, married and has seven children; four of the children are still in school. 

Penda heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 400 Sudan pounds in order to purchase cassava flour and maize. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and maize for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has six children, and four of them are enrolled in school. Her husband is employed. Agnes operates a grocery business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are from the community around her. 

Agnes' other sources of income include farming and her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be price fluctuations, and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Agnes will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and onions for her grocery business. Agnes aspires to expand the business in the future. She joined Yehu because of the flexibility of the repayment period.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and onions for her grocery business.

loans.name: Moyo Safi Group

texts.en:
Kisse, who is in her late 20s, is married.  She has had a business of selling second hand radios and TVs and has a hall where she has been showing football matches for four years.  She works from 8.00 am to 8.00 pm on the days when there is no match but when there is a match her work hours can go until the match ends. 

This will be her 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a Big-Screen TV set, build a hall and started showing football matches, paid for DSTV station fee (DSTV is one of the stations which shows food matches to who-ever pays their fee, bought second had radios to sell and has repaid all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more second hand radios and TV sets to sell.  Her dream is to open another hall and pay for DSTV station fee to be able to and start showing England's matches.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Moyo Safi" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more second hand radios  and TV  sets.

loans.name: Survey Group

texts.en:
Christina, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who are still going to school.  She has been running a grocery business and she sells video players, rice cookers and kettles which she sells door to door. She has been in this business for three years now.  She works from 8.00 am to 4.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans for household expenses, restocked the missing items in her grocery store, bought more kettles,rice cookers and has paid back her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase on the grocery store stock, buy more rice cookers and kettles to sell.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house because she has land already.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Survey" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of groceries and buy more  rice cookers and kettles to sell.

loans.name: Sadick

texts.en:
Sadick is a married man. Sadick operates a goat business and sells his goods at the market. He's worked in this business for six years and was previously employed in farming. His primary customers buy for slaughter, keeping and upgrading. Sadick's other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge to be animals dying or getting lost, and his highest monthly expense is entertainment. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Sadick will use the 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more goats. Sadick aspires to own a ranch in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Mwero Jawa

texts.en:
Mwero is a married man. Mwero operates a shop and sells his goods retail. He's worked in this business for five years. His primary customers are community members. Mwero's other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge to be selling goods that are perishable, and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwero will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour and beans. Mwero aspires to expand the business to a wholesale one in the future. He joined Yehu because its flexible.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Ezdehar

texts.en:
Ezdehar is a 45-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Ezdehar is selling clothes and working from her home. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothing for trading purposes.

Ezdehar is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 35-year-old married woman. She has five children and four of them are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Hassan and he works as a businessman. Khadija operates a poultry business and sells her goods. She has worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are neighbors and restaurant operators. She describes her greatest business challenges to be seasonality and disease outbreak and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Khadija will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase chicks and chicken feed. Khadija aspires to establish a meat business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Ange

texts.en: Ange wants to continue to invest in his business and increase his capacity. The loan he received before allowed him to buy sewing materials in bulk at a discounted price. He will use this loan to make improvements to his workspace as well as buy more needed sewing materials including lining, zippers, and thread. Ange hopes to open additional tailor shops in other areas in Brazzaville as his business expands due to the loans. He also dreams of one day opening a school to teach sewing skills to aspiring tailors. Ange has a great repayment record with Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo.

loans.use: to pay for improvements on his work space and to buy sewing thread, lining, and zippers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 34 years old and married with three children. She sells chips to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. She describes her customers as low-income because the majority of them live in the slums. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes and cooking oil for making chips.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cooking oil for making chips

loans.name: Nadya

texts.en:
Nadya is a 23-year-old single lady from Madab, Jordan.

Nadya has a home-based project in which she sells home products and provides her family with an additional source of income. Because Nadya is under 30 years old her loan considered as a youth loan.

Nadya is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase more home products for trading purposes.

loans.use: to purchase home products for trading purposes.

loans.name: Ghayda'a

texts.en:
Ghayda'a is a 19-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan, and mother of two children.

Ghayda'a is looking to improve her family life conditions. Thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to do maintenance on her home. Because Ghyda'a is under 30 years old her loan considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her home.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a 40-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan, and the mother of six children.

Amenh is looking to improve her family's life conditions, so she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to do maintenance for her home with an aspiration of purchasing a larger home for the family.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan.

Mohammad is a vehicle electrician. He has a workshop and is requesting a loan of 2,000 JD to purchase equipment and materials needed for his shop.

Becuase Mohammad is under 30 years old his loan considered a a youth loan.

Mohammad is looking to expand his business scope to include the center lock, sound system and computers screens.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and materials needed for his shop

loans.name: Thekryat

texts.en:
Thekryat is a 21-year-old single lady from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan.

Thekryat sells clothes from her home, thus helping her family and providing an additional source of funds to improve the family living conditions.

Thekryat is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Because Thekryat is under 30 years old her loan considered as a youth loan.

An aspiration of Thekryat's is to help in the education of her brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 24-year-old ambitious lady from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Sawsan is studying at the university and is requesting a loan of 600 JD to cover her education expenses.
because sawsan is under 30 years old, her loan considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: To cover her unversity expenses

loans.name: Shatha

texts.en: Shatha is a conservative person who is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet so the woman in the photo is her sister, Shorouq. Shatha is a 27-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child. Shatha is looking to improve her family's living conditions so he is requesting a loan of 300 JD to do maintenance on her home. Because Shatha is under 30 years old her loan considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her home

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her son-in-law, Layth.

 Nawal is a 36-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of three children. Nawal has  a home-based business in which she sells different goods such as accessories, cosmetics and clothes.

Nawal is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase more quantities of cosmetics for business purposes.

Nawal is looking to expand her range of goods so as to meet the demand in her area with an aspiration of providing her family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase goods like cosmetics for business purposes

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 42-year-old married man from Irbid, Jordan.

Khaled has a bakery and he is requesting a loan of 2000 JD to purchase equipment and materials needed for his bakery.

Khaled is looking to expand his business and establish other branches of his bakery.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and materials needed for his bakery

loans.name: Safeyeh

texts.en:
Safeyeh is a 35-year-old widow from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Safeyeh sells scrap metal and she is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase a new stock of scraps made of aluminium and copper.

Safeyeh is  looking to provide a stable source of income to insure her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase scraps made of aluminium and copper for business purposes

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is a 26-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Maram does hand-made crafts such as dolls and she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase raw materials needed such as beads, thread and fabrics. Because she is under 30 years old, her loan will be considered as a youth loan.

Maram is looking to expand her business thus enlarging her customer base and increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed such as beads, thread and fabrics

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a conservative person and is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Hanan is a 28-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan, and a mother of four children.

Hanan is looking to improve her family's life conditions, so she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to do maintenance for her home. 

Because Hanan is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home.

loans.name: Doa'a

texts.en:
Doa'a is a 22-year-old married woman from Ashrafieh, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of two children.

Doa'a sells clothes from her home and is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more quantities for trading purposes. 

Bcause she is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Doa'a is looking to establish her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 27-year-old single man from Madaba, Jordan.

Ashraf has a shop for selling shehsha and related items. Shesha is a traditional water pipe used for smoking.
 
Ashraf is requesting a loan of 1,700 JD to purchase more goods for his store. 

Because Ashraf is under 30 years old, his loan considered a youth loan.

Ashraf is looking to expand his business by increasing the goods available at his store.

loans.use: to purchase goods for his shop.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Badenya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché. 
Elles font le petit commerce de sacs à main, de pagnes wax et de jus locaux. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont adhéré au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 11ème prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou, debout au milieu, a une grande réputation dans la vente des pagnes wax dans le quartier et au marché. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50 pièces de pagne wax. Elle se ravitaille en marchandises en gros à Ségou et parfois à Bamako. La vente se fait à crédit et en espèce à une cliente composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments et soins de santé des enfants. Madame Kadiatou a pour ambition l’achat d’un lot à usage d’habitation dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women in the Badenya group are mostly married in monogamous families. Their average age is 40 and they have an average of four children each. They all live in the Darsalam neighbourhood in Ségou (the 4th largest administrative region of Mali) and know each other as neighbours, relatives and through their activities at the market in Ségou. 

The women all work in small-scale commerce, selling handbags, wax pagnes (traditional printed cloth) and juice made locally. In order to replenish their supply of ready funds, they have signed up to the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme and this is their 11th solidarity loan. 

Kadiatou, standing in the middle, has a good reputation selling wax pagnes in Darsalam and at the market. She will use her loan to buy 50 lengths of wax pagne. She restocks at the Ségou grand market and sometimes in Bamako. She sells her goods on credit and her customers are mainly women. She hopes to make 80 000 CFA francs on average per month, which will be reinvested in her business, and used to buy household supplies and healthcare items for the children. Kadiatou's ambition for her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso is to buy a plot for housing.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional printed cloth)

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim is a 54-year-old man and is married with four children. 

He sells seasonal fruits and vegetables, such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates, bananas, onion, potatoes and cabbages. Rasim has seven years of experience in this field and has gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for his business. 

Fruit is very popular among the Azerbaijan people and in high demand during the year. People like to eat it fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. His shop is located in the central bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruit. His monthly income from this business is 300 AZN.  Rasim`s wife helps him to sell fruit.

Rasim wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover, as well as improve the life of his family. 

For this purpose, he applied for a 1500 AZN loan. This will be his third loan and Rasim has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 58-year-old woman and is married with three children. She is a very kind and responsible woman. 

She is a market vendor and has eight years of experience in this field. She decided to open her own shop and will rent a new place for the shop in the central bazaar and purchase new stock for it.  

She usually sells food stuffs, such as macaroni, rice, beverages, canned food, sugar and salt. She says they are the most popular products and in very high demand, because people use them in everyday life. Khalida`s monthly profit is 350 AZN.

She has savings to start her own business and her loan of 1000 AZN will make a great contribution towards the continuing success of her business.

loans.use: purchase and diversify her range of products

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 34 años de edad y vive en la ciudad Lamay y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. Maruja en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimentos balanceados y para comprar cuyes. 

Maruja pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Maruja agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Maruja was born in the city of Lamay and is 34 years old. She lives in the city of Lamay, where she works as a breeder of small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. Maruja requires the loan now in order to buy balanced feed and to buy guinea pigs. 

Maruja is part of the "Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay" communal bank, of the Arariwa Association from the Calca province, department of Cusco in Peru. 

Maruja is grateful and appreciates the loan; she commits to fulfill the payment of her monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 41-year-old man from Migori, is married to Rosemary and they have three children aged 12,15 and 18 years old.

Charles operates a retail shop business. He has been doing this for the last 11 years and makes a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy retail stock, such as sugar, milk and bread. His profits will be used to feed his family.

His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of sugar, milk and bread for sale.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws). 

She has a retail shop and a poultry retail business. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week. 

Nula has requested a loan of 1,400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, rice, cooking oil and poultry feed. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. 

Nulu’s goals and aspirations are to see her business grow into a wholesale shop. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, rice, cooking oil and poultry feed

loans.name: Xudakarim

texts.en:
Xudakarim is a 53-year-old man and is married with two children. 

Xudakarim has bred calves and cows for the last 10 years. His pension was too small to cover the needs of his family and he decided to start his own business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.

Xudakarim usually buys small calves and raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 230 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in his family. 

Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Xudakarim also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

He wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase two calves, one milking cow and fodder. This will be his third loan from AqroInvest CU and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two calves, one milking cow and fodder

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Rachael is a 22-year-old married woman. 

She operates a tailoring business and sells her goods at the market. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbors and her highest monthly expense is food and school fees. 

She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Rachael will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes, needles and thread. 

Rachael aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes, needles and thread.

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
Shukufa is a 57-year-old married woman with five children.  

Shukufa has bred cattle and cows for the last 15 years. She and her husband live on a pension, which is too small. While they had jobs, they had enough salary and breeding cows was not the primary source of income. However, after retirement living got harder and now breeding cattle and cows has become the primary source of income in her family. 

Shukufa usually buys small calves and raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 250 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in her family. 

Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Shukufa also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 2,000 AZN loan to purchase three cattle, two milking cows and fodder. This will be her third loan and AqroInvest trust her.

loans.use: to buy three cattle, two milking cows and fodder

loans.name: Aliko

texts.en:
Aliko is 27 years old and lives in a small village in the Khoni district. He is married and lives with his wife, Lamara, and grandparents (retired). 

The only source of income for the family is agriculture. They have a milk cow. Aliko and Lamara produce cheese and sell on average 20 kg of it in the village. The family also has a small poultry farm – they raise chickens and sell hens on the local open market. 

As well as this, Aliko and Lamara are busy with a greenhouse with a total area of 600 sq meters. They grow tomatoes in the greenhouse and sell on average 1 ton of this product to local greengrocery retailers. 

The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris, including the pensions of Aliko’s grandparents. 

Aliko requested credit to purchase feed for chickens. He will feed the chickens for 2-3 months and sell them in the summer. Aliko plans to use the additional income to purchase much needed household goods, in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for chickens

loans.name: Mrvat

texts.en:
Mrvat is a 42-year-old divorced woman who has adult daughters. She lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She completed her secondary school education then, due to family issues, she pledged to move ahead in life and improve her quality of life. To be able to generate the earnings that she needs, she decided to make incense at home to sell as a street vendor. She currently spends about five hours a day walking around under the intense sun in the city in order to sell incense. She is able to make a profit. She is always thinking about being able to increase her customers and for a long time has been offering them friendly service so that they will buy from her again.

Mrvat has requested a loan of 80,000 Yemeni rials from AMB in order to expand her business by buying perfumes and cooking tools for incense which will increase her profit. In the future, Mrvat hopes to have a cosmetic shop in addition to this business.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying perfumes and cooking tools for incense which will increase her profit.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 25-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. His educational background is a bachelor's from university. He has been operating a sewing business for six years. He was provided with a small amount of capital by his father and during this period has successfully managed it sewing pants and shirts for men. 

Now, Walid faces problems with financial investment due to the bad situation in Yemen. Therefore, he took out a youth loan of 100,000 Yemeni rials to purchase necessary materials for sewing such as fabrics and textiles. Walid hopes to continue to have a good number of orders and continue to generate income for his home. He hopes to provide better opportunities for his family in the future and ensure a prosperous future for himself.

loans.use: to purchase materials for sewing such as fabrics and textiles for his business.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Kuña Guapa, se conformo en el año 2009, gracias a una de las miembros quien ya formó parte de otro grupo que se desintegró y luego invito a otras vecinas para conformar un nuevo grupo y  logro juntas a 18 mujeres, que se encuentran trabajando ya  en el 8º ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Francisca, quien tiene un copetín donde vende todo tipo de artículos, como ser comestibles, gaseosa, dulces y demás. Debido a que está en una zona bien ubicada, tiene muy buenas ventas, lo que la ayuda a tener muy buenos ingresos.  Ella sueña con poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia con un poco mas de ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, verduras, panificados, golosinas y demás, con lo cual podrá surtir su copetín y de esa forma seguir trabajando. Ella está contenta por la ayuda que está recibiendo por parte de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Guapa" women's committee was established in 2009, thanks to one of the members, which was part of another group that dissolved. She then invited other neighbors to form a new group and managed to bring together 18 women, who are working now on their eighth loan cycle. They work together, supporting each other within the program. 

One of the members is Francisca, who owns a convenience store where she sells all kinds of goods such as groceries, sodas, sweets and the like. As the store is well-situated, she has very good sales, which helps her have a very good income. She dreams about being able to continue working and as such be able to help her family with a little more income. 

She requests the loan to buy drinks, vegetables, bakery goods, sweets and the like, in order to supply her convenience store and in this way continue working. She is happy with the help she receives from Kiva and the Paraguayan Foundation.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the convenience store.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 42 years old, a married man, and has three adult children. His educational background is secondary school and he lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is hard-working and determined and does not fear challenges. He has been operating a spice store. He began this business more than six years ago, using some of his own capital.

Mohammed feels that his business is reasonably profitable because of the earnings that it gives him since he generally sells everything that he has to offer. Currently, his store has a small quantity of products on the shelves, but he does not have sufficient money to purchase more items from his suppliers. 

He took out a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB that will enable him to buy basic household goods such as sauces, beans, spices, seasoning, rice, cooking oil, and sugar and stock his business. He hopes that with the purchase of these products his store will have a larger quantity of items to offer and in this way he will be able to meet his customers’ demand. In the future, Mohammed dreams that his family will have a better quality of life and in addition, he will be able to expand his business which will qualify him to get more profit.

loans.use: to buy basic household goods such as sauces, beans, spices, seasoning, rice, cooking oil, and sugar for his business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James still operates his carpentry work shop. With a loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD, he plans to restock his business with well seasoned timber for his growing clientele. 

His profits will be used to boost his business. His future plan is to have a stable business and finances.

loans.use: to buy timber and velvet materials for making chair cushions

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a businessman. 

Agnes operates a fruit selling business and sells her goods at the market. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbors. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expense is school fees. 

She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Agnes will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of fruit for resale. Agnes aspires to expand to meet her customers' demands in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit for resale.

loans.name: Bonnaventure

texts.en:
Bonnaventure is married with two children aged between 3 and 6. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 1 year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and labor cost support.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila nació en el departamento de Apurímac pero vive en la ciudad Lamay, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y lleva sus productos a vender a diferentes mercados de la ciudad del Cusco. Teofila en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras. 

Teofila pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Teofila agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Teofila was born in the department of Apurímac, but she now lives in the city of Lamay. She sells vegetables for a living and brings her goods to sell at various markets in the city of Cusco. Toefila requests the loan now to buy vegetables. 

Teofila is a member of the "Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay" communal bank, of the Arariwa Association from the Calca province, department of Cusco in Peru.

Teofila is grateful and appreciates the loan; she commits to fulfill the payment of her monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mnaya Group

texts.en:
This group, called MNAYA, consists of four members who are all females: Mona, Myrft, Mnaya and Azhar who is the group leader. They are from Aden, Yemen and they know each other very well as they have lived in the same neighborhood for long time.   All their projects are home-based; however, they have many clients, mostly women. All the group members are considered hardworking people who very much want to get ahead.This group took a loan of 120,000 YER.

Azhar is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Aden.  she’s affectionately a part of this group (she is the woman who is sitting down, located on the right) and she says that she’s very happy because her business has improved little by little. She has been distributing mobile recharge cards and perfumes. She started the business because she wanted to help her family with their children’s expenses and to have her own capital to cover any unexpected costs. She distributes her mobile recharge cards to call centers and she distributes her perfumes to cosmetic shops in order to get more profit.  She loves her work and aspires to continue.

For this reason, she’s asking for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to continue buying mobile recharge cards and perfumes that will help her to get more profit from her business. 

Azhar dreams of sending her children to private schools for higher education.

loans.use: to continue buying mobile recharge cards and perfumes that will help her to get more profit from her business.

loans.name: Datuna Shilakadze

texts.en:
Datuna is 39 years old. He lives in a village in the Samtredia District, West Georgia. Datuna is married and lives with his family: wife, Irma, 18-year-old daughter, seven-year-old son and parents. The children go to school. 

The only source of income for the family is agriculture. They have a dairy farm with five milk cows. Datuna’s mother and Irma produce cheese and sell on average 100 kg of this product on the local market. The family also owns two hectares of land, where maize is grown. They harvest on average eight tons of maize, which is sold on the local market as well. The family's total average monthly income is 700 Laris, including the pensions of Datuna’s parents.

Datuna requested credit to start up a small poultry farm. He will purchase chickens and raise them for a couple of months. In late spring, Datuna will sell hens on the local open market. The new business initiative will give additional income to the family. Datuna hopes that he will be able to make some savings to renovate the house, which is already old and uncomfortable.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells cloth and fabrics at Jukwa, near Abura. She has done this for 11 years now. She is married and has two children. 

Elizabeth uses her income to support her husband in paying their accomodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase cloth and fabric for sale. 

With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and fabric for sale

loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He is a retail shop owner; a business, which has been running for the last two years. He is married and has one child. 

He sold one of his cattle and added the funds to his savings and this formed the first capital for the business.

Baya learnt of Milango from his friends and joined the group to access more capital. He is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase new stocks of retail materials, such as sugar, tea leaves and cereals.

The challenges facing his business are the seasonal business climate and inflation. His ambition is to open a larger retail store and Baya believes the additional income from this loan will help him pay for his child’s school fees and also enable them to have access to better health care.

loans.use: To purchase new stocks of retail materials, such as sugar, tea leaves and cereals

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 47 years old, married and blessed with four children between the ages of 11 and 18 years respectively. His wife is a teacher and brings in an additional income. He practices farming and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 50,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer in preparation for the planting season. The anticipated profit will be used to expand his farming practice. 

His hopes and dreams are to construct rental houses as well as to educate his children. This is his third loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer in preparation for the planting season.

loans.name: Bagrat

texts.en:
Bagrat is engaged in trading cement and crack filler. He has been running his own business for more than 10 years and it enables him to support his family. He was also able to repair his house, buy furniture for his house and buy a track for his business. 

Bagrat buys cement and crack filler from Hrazdan city and resells them in his own small shop in Ijevan City. Bagrat always has many customers, so he must have a large lot of merchandise in stock.  

Bagrat lives in Ijevan. He is married and has two school-aged children: a daughter and a son. Bagrat’s wife works at college as a biology teacher. 

Bagrat is asking for a 550.000 AMD loan to buy wholesale cement and crack filler to resell.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cement and crack filler to resell

loans.name: Jimnah

texts.en:
Jimnah is 48 years old and married to Jane. They are blessed with two children.

He is a carpenter in Githurai, Nairobi. He has been in this business for the last 22 years and gets an income of KES 16,100 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to buy carpentry varnish for sale. He will use the extra profit to educate his children and boost the business. 

He hopes to expand the business and educate his children through to college.

loans.use: To buy carpentry varnish.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 34 years old, married and blessed with four children aged between one to eight years respectively. 

He practices farming, a business he started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 100,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer in preparation for the planting season; the anticipated profit will help him improve his farming. 

He dreams of constructing rental houses, as well as educating his children. This is his third loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer in preparation for the planting season.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Menuna. She is married and has two children aged 12 and 18 years old. She has one additional dependent living with her because of her schooling.  

In 1997, Menuna established her foodstuff business, such as beans, millet, and tola. She began her business in order to generate a source of income to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about LE 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of LE 3,000,000, which will enable her to buy more items, as this will increase her profit to approximately LE 200,000 per month. 

In the future, Menuna plans to get another store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Elguja Darsavelidze

texts.en:
Elguja is 67 years old. He lives in the village of Didi Jikhaishi, West Georgia with his family: wife, Lili, a 31-year-old son, a daughter in law and two grandchildren (three and four years old). Elguja and Lili head the family agricultural business. Their son works for the Georgian Railway Company. 

Elguja and Lili run a dairy farm with two milk cows. They produce on average 40 kg of cheese and sell to local dairy product retailers. The family also owns 1.5 hectare land, where maize, cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. Elguja sells the harvested products on the local market to greengrocery retailers. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Laris.

Elguja requested credit to finance seasonal agricultural activities. In particular, he will rent a tractor to till the land. Afterwards Elguja will sow maize. The family members will work hard during spring and summer and get the harvest in late summer. 

After selling the harvested maize, the family will get an additional income, which will be used for financing ongoing agricultural works, as well as for the family's consumer purposes.

loans.use: to rent a tractor to till the land

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a welder living in Changamwe, Kenya. The business has been running for nineteen years and he started it off from his savings. 

Charles learnt of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase materials, such as a welding rod and a grinding machine.

Charles believes this business will help him achieve his goal of building a house to live in. Before then, he needs to ensure his clients pay on time, as this has been the challenge in the industry.

The additional income from the loan will also assist him in providing the other family needs, such as school fees and medication.

loans.use: To purchase materials, such as a welding rod and a grinding machine.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is 29 years old and married to George. They are blessed with two children. 

Consolata runs a mini supermarket in the Lucky Summer area. She has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES 10,000 per month.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy stock, such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour and all types of soap.

She will use the extra profit to expand the business and educate her children. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy stock, such as sugar, cooking oil, salt, flour and soap for sale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 36 years old and married to Joseph. She is blessed with four children aged between four to 14 years respectively. 

She is in the business of selling fruit; a business she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She has requested KES 30,000 to buy more fruit for sale. Her profit will help her boost her business. 

Her dream is to build rental houses in her plot, which she has already bought. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fruit for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 years old, married to Elizabeth.  The couple has been blessed with four children.  James has been running a hotel in Narok county for the last 13 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

With his fourth loan facility of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD, he intends to refurbish his cafeteria and expand the facility.

The anticipated profits will be used to support his expansion plans. His plan is to improve his business and be financially stable in future.

loans.use: To refurbish the cafe

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is from a village of Abasha District, West Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband Raul and two adult children (23 and 21 years old). All family members are involved in family agriculture, which is the only source of income for them.

The family has 5 milk cows and 4 calves. Irma produces cheese and sells it at the local market. Along with the dairy farm the family owns 2.5 hectare land, where maize and nut trees are grown. Irma sells on average 1 tone of maize and 400 kg of nuts per year. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris.

Irma has requested the loan to finance some seasonal agricultural projects. In particular, the family will rent a tractor for tilling the land. Afterwards they will sow maize. The family members will work hard during spring and summer months and enjoy the harvest in late summer. After selling the harvested maize the family will use the expected income to finance ongoing agricultural needs, as well as improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: to rent a tractor

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Trabajadoras “iniciando el primer  Ciclo con 14  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsable entre ellas. Todas ellas se dedican a diferentes actividades, las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores para recaudar fondos para la comunidad.
Manuela es la presidenta del grupo, y nos comenta que está muy contenta con el grupo que ha formado, pues la ha ayudado a poder salir adelante y a mejorarse. Ella se dedica a la lavandería y nos cuenta que gracias a su arduo trabajo ha logrado salir adelante e ir progresando con su negocio. Ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre acude a solicitarle sus servicios.
Ella acude a la fundación paraguaya y a kiva para solicitar un préstamo, el cual quiere utilizar en la compra de insumos para su lavandería, como ser jabones para la lavar, de todo tipo, suavizantes, enjuagues, y demás.
texts.en:
This group, called "Mujeres Trabajadoras" [Hardworking women], are starting the first loan cycle with 14 members. This group stands out in the neighbourhood for being very united and supportive. They all make a living in different activities. They have a great enterprising spirit and they carry out work to raise funds for the community.

Manuela is the president of the group. She tells us that she is very happy with the group they have formed as it has helped her get ahead and improve. She makes a living in the laundry service and she tells us that thanks to her hard work she has managed to get ahead and progress with her business. She now has a good clientèle who always come to her for her services.

She has come to the Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva to request a loan which she wants to use to buy supplies for her laundry, such as all types of washing soaps, conditioners, rinses and other items.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the laundry service.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has six, school going children. He owns a pest control and fumigation business. The business has been in operation for ten years. The family also operates a food café which is under the care of the wife.

Philip is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase pesticides. He was introduced to Milango by his friends. The challenge in the business is the high cost of pesticides. Despite that, he is determined to see the business grow and become a large scale supplier of pesticides. He believes, the increased sale from the business, will help him provide for other family needs.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides.

loans.name: Matanat

texts.ru:
Matanat 50 let. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Matanat jivet v Fizuli regione, ona yavlayyetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda. Matanat uje 11 let kak imeyet magazin dlya prodaji pisheviz produktov. Ranshe matanat rabotala prodovshiccey v drugix magazinax no seychas ona imeyet svoy magazin. Matanat seychas nujdayetsya v 2350 AZN chtobi kupit pisheviye produkti dlya pereprodaji. Ona xochet razvit svoy bizness.
Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
Matanat is 50 years old. She is not married and does not have children. Matanat lives in the Fuzuli region and is an IDP person, that is a migrant from Fuzuli city. Matanat has been an owner of a food store for 11 years. She earlier worked as a seller in other stores, but now has a store of her own. Matanat currently needs AZN 2,350 to purchase foodstuffs for resale. She would like to develop her business
An Internally Displaced Person (IDP) is a person who was forced to flee from his/her home because of an armed conflict, violence, human rights violation, natural disasters or other catastrophes; however, as compared to a refugee, IDP remains within his/her country's borders (source: the UN's Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Tunashukuru Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ziada, leader du groupe d’affaire «Tunashukuru », est  jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans, mariée, mère de 5 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un Directeur d’une école primaire musulmane. Elle est vendeuse d’objet précieux (bijoux, bagues, gourmette, médailles, etc.). Elle expose des articles dans un petit coffre à son domicile ou auprès de sa clientèle la plus proche. Il y a  3 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  10eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  des bijoux, médailles, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise en valeur.
