La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The customer, Ziada, who is leader of the Tunashukuru business group, is a young entrepreneur and she is 30 years old, married and mother to five young children who all go to school. Her husband is the director of a Muslim primary school. She sells precious objects (jewels, rings, identity bracelets, medals etc.). She displays the objects in a small chest either in her home or at her closest customers' homes. She has been carrying out small income-generating activities of this kind for the past three years. Meanwhile, she has just been granted her tenth loan from Hekima. This new loan will be used to get fresh supplies of jewelry, medals, etc. Moreover she wants to see her children grow up in comfort and also increase the value of her business. The customer is grateful to Hekima for its actions in favour of poor women who do not have access to classic banks.

loans.use: to pay for jewelry, medals, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene nació en el departamento de Cusco y tiene 47 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad Lamay y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como por ejemplo aretes, perfumes, collares, pulseras y otras cosas más. Marlene en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cosmeticos. 

Marlene pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Marlene agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Marlene was born in the department of Cusco and is 47 years old. She lives in the city of Lamay, where she carries out her business activities. She makes a living selling beauty products such as earrings, perfumes, necklaces, bracelets and many other items. Marlene, on this occasion, requires a loan to buy cosmetics.

Marlene belongs to the communal bank “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” of the Asociación Arariwa, in the province of Calca, department of Cusco, Peru.

Marlene is grateful and values this loan. She is committed to paying her monthly quotas punctually.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 1 Group

texts.en:
Modesta is one of the members of the Fuente Group for Development 1. They are micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, artisanal crafts, etc. They are in the city of Samana, a tourist town in development, bordered by the Atlantic coast and rich in natural resources. Modesta is associated with Esperanza because she needed to work to get ahead.

Modesta is very excited to be receiving her 12th loan in Esperanza International. She has sucessfully paid off her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She started her business 6 years ago with a loan from Esperanza International. Modesta will invest her new loan in purchasing rice, cooking oil, beans, meat, seasoning, disposable containers, and other goods to prepare meals for lunch. She has a little restaurant, named Comedor in the Dominican Republic. She will use her earnings to re-invest in the business, while she saves to rebuild her house. Her biggest dream is to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, beans, meat, seasoning, disposable containers, etc.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda is 59 years old.  She lives in a small village of West Georgia with her family; husband – Elguja, 23 years old daughter and a son in law.  Elguja works as a watchman on a village farm.  Their son in law has a tractor which he uses to provide agricultural services to neighborhood farmers, and earns on average 300 Laris per month. Izolda leads the agricultural business of the family. Her daughter helps her. 

They have 4 milk cows. Izolda produces and sells on average 80 kg cheese on local open market. Also the family owns 1.25 hectare land, where maize is grown. Izolda sells on average 2 tones of maize per year. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Izolda has requested credit to repair the son in law's tractor.  At the moment it is out of order and can’t bring income to the family. Izolda’s son in law will repair the tractor and get ready for tilling season, which starts in March and ends in mid-April. He will use the income for financing the family's needs.

loans.use: to repair the tractor

loans.name: Ñepyytyvora 2 Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Indígenas se identifico con el nombre de Ñepytyvora 2 y están empezando este primer ciclo un total de 14 mujeres, en las cuales están las que son parientes, amigas pero todas son vecinas del mismo barrio. Como son mujeres indígenas no todas tenían acceso al crédito tampoco a conformar un grupo con otras instituciones así como les dio la oportunidad la Fundación Paraguaya, es por ello que ellas están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que han recibido.
Bonifacia es una de las miembro del grupo, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser chanchos, gallinas, patos y demás. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y comenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, y termina ya muy tarde. Ella se sacrifica todos los días por darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y creciendo. Está muy agradecida por la ayuda que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This communal bank of indigenous women identify themselves with the name Ñeptyvora 2 and they are starting their first loan cycle with 14 members. Some of them are relatives or friends but all are neighbours from the same neighbourhood. As they are indigenous women they didn't all have access to loans or to forming part of a group in other institutions. However, Fundación Paraguaya has given them this opportunity, for which they are very grateful.

Bonifacia is one of the members of the group. She tells us that she makes a living raising and selling animals, such as pigs, chicken, ducks and others. She is a hard working woman and she mentions that she works every day from the very early hours of the morning until very late. She sacrifices herself every day in order to give her family all they need for their day to day living.

She is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed for her animals, with which she will be able to continue working and growing. She is very grateful for the help she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Lavrenti Tkeshelashvili

texts.en:
Lavrenti is 54 years old. He lives in a small village of Samtredia District with his family, wife – Neli and a 20 year old daughter. Agriculture is the only source of the income for the family. They have a small dairy farm with 4 milk cows and 3 calves. Neli produces cheese and sells on average 80 kg of this product per month on local open market. Along with the dairy farm the family has a greenhouse with the area of 230 sq meters, where tomatoes and greens are grown. Lavrenti sells about 800 kg greens and 1.5 tones of tomatoes per year. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Lavrenti has requested credit for purchasing construction materials for greenhouse construction. He will use the greenhouse for the same purpose – growing more greens and tomatoes. The family will sell more green grocery products and their income will increase. Lavrenti hopes that the increased income will be enough to make some savings for purchasing furniture, in order to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Cynthia's Group

texts.en: Mary is a 49year old married woman who lives in Takoradi with her husband and 3 children.  She sells beads, a business she has been running for the past 30 years.  She has inadequate working capital to run the business and therefore her business is not growing.  Mary believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and large quantity and variety of beads to increase her stock.  She is with the “Charisma” Trust Bank group. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral, to access the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more beads for sale.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana lives in a small village of West Georgia. She is 38 years old and lives with her family, husband – Nodar, two sons (18 and 13 years old) and parents in law. Children go to school. Nana is a teacher. She works At the village school. Nodar owns a tractor and provides agricultural services to the neighborhood farmers and sells 300 Laris per month at tilling/moving season. 

Nana runs the family's dairy farm.  They have 2 milk cows and 3 buffaloes.  Nana produces on average 90 kg of cheese per month. She sells it at the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris, including pensions of Nana’s parents in law. 

Nana has requested credit for purchasing 1 hectare land. The family will use it for maize growing and get additional income through selling harvested maize.  Also part of the credit will be used for repairing the tractor, in order to meet high demand on tilling service in spring season.  As a result of the above mentioned investment, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 1 hectare agricultural land and repair the tractor

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame sells gari and maize at Jukwa near Abura. Maame has been selling gari and maize for 15 years now. She lives with her husband and her 7 dependants. Her husband operate a grocery shop.

Maame uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Maame will use her loan to purchase bags of gari and maize for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy bags of gari and maize for sale

loans.name: Stella's Group

texts.en:
Ivy is 35 years old and is divorced with four children. For the past three years, she has been selling men's and women's clothing at Takoradi. Ivy belongs to a community group called Moonlight Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee each other's social collateral and support one another to repay their loan.  

Ivy is requesting a loan to buy more stock to increase her inventory. She hopes to expand her business and improve her sales to save more for her children’s education and to build a bigger boutique.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is married to a driver and has two children. For the past 12 years, she has been selling maize porridge at Nyame Bekyere near Abura. Salamatu uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  

Salamatu is requesting a loan to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge for sale. With the profit from her loan, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize to prepare porridge to sell

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara Araba Tawiah is divorced and has five children. For the past 15  years, she has cooked and sold kenkey (fermented dough) at Elmina.  Hajara uses her income to pay her utility and accommodation bills.  

Hajara is requesting a loan to purchase bags of maize to prepare her kenkey. She hopes to use the new profit from her loan to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase maize to prepare kenkey to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married with three children. Her husband is a mason. Abena works cooking banku (fermented dough) to sell at Jukwa near Abura. She serves her banku with fried fish and vegetable sauce. Abena uses her income to assist her husband with the general upkeep of their home.

Abena is requesting a loan to purchase maize, fish, and vegetables to prepare her banku and sauce. She will use the profit from her loan to obtain a stall to sell her banku.

loans.use: to purchase maize, fish, and vegetables to prepare banku and sauce

loans.name: Juiliana

texts.en:
Julian is a hairdresser. She has operated a beauty salon for the past two years. She lives in Jukwa, near Abura, with her husband and two children. Her husband is a farmer. Julian uses her income to assist her husband in supporting the family. 

Julian will use her loan to purchase hair extensions, wigs, and hair cream for her business. 

With the new profits generated from this loan, she intends to expand her beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions, wigs, and hair cream for her business

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza 1 Group

texts.en:
Gricelda is one of the members of a group called Luz y Esperanza 1, comprised of five micro-businesspeople who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, and other items. They are located in the city of Samana, a developing tourist town that lies on the Atlantic coast and is rich in natural resources. Gricelda is a single mother with two children. 

Gricelda started her association with Esperanza because she needed to reinvest in her business. She runs a comedor, which is a little restaurant located in her neighborhood that serves lunch. Gricelda has operated her business for around seven years now and began it with savings she had. She is very excited to be receiving her sixth Esperanza Internacional loan. Gricelda has successfully repaid her previous loans and has taken steps to expand her business.

Gricelda is requesting a loan to purchase chicken, rice, vegetables, beans, other meats and cooking oil. She will use the profit from her loan to reinvest in her business as she needs to buy plates, chairs, tables, and other items. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, vegetables, beans, other meats, and cooking oil

loans.name: Dzifa Group

texts.en:
Dzifa is single and lives in a rented home in Adekopea a suburb of Takoradi. She has one child who is currently in school. Dzifa has been a seamstress for the past 17 years, but she does not have adequate working capital to support her business. She belongs to a community group called “Dzifa Trust Group.”  Group members assist one another to provide support to handle repayment.

Dzifa is requesting a loan to purchase more materials and expand her business by acquiring a shop. She hopes to use part of her income to finance her child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase material and aquire a shop

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar works as a nurse and has dabbled in event-planning for several years. Hagar studied at Tadmor to professionalize her event-planning skills and increase her connections. After organizing large events at a variety of venues, Hagar has decided to focus on lifecycle events, specifically Bar and Bat Mitzvahs. She has opened Hagar Events which has gained popularity and initial clients. Clientele feedback is excellent but in order to propel her business forward, Hagar needs to invest in marketing and ensure initial funds for event planning.

Hagar needed this loan for multi-month marketing, website development and cash flow for initial events over the next several months.

Hagar is already improving her business and while she still works as a nurse to ensure her base monthly income, she dreams of one day running a multi-staffed event company specializing in lifecycle events.

loans.use: To pay for for multi-month marketing, website development, and cash flow for initial events over the next several months.

loans.name: Obed Group

texts.en: Matilda   is a thirty-one-year-old single, hardworking woman. She is a petty trader and sells maize and groundnuts and also sews. She wants to use the loan opportunity to buy more bags of groundnuts and maize to increase her stock of goods for sale and she hopes to raise good income to enable her to open a bigger shop. She is a member of the trust group called Obed. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a widow with seven dependents. For the past seven years, she has cooked banku, fanti, and kenkey (types of fermented dough) to sell. She serves her products with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce at Nyame Bekyere near Abura. As a single parent, Efua uses her income for the general upkeep of her children.  

Efua is requesting a loan to purchase bags of maize and fish to use to prepare banku and kenkey. She hopes to use the profit from her loan to expand her business and acquire a stall to sell her banku and kenkey.

loans.use: to purchase maize and fish to prepare banku and kenkey

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama  sells scarves and hair extensions which she has done for 2 years now. Ama lives together with her husband and her three children at Nkramofokrom. Her husband is a mason. Ama uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. 

Ama will use her loan to purchase more scarves and hair extensions for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ama wishes to acquire a better place to sell her goods.

loans.use: purchase more scarves and hair extensions for sale.

loans.name: Cristo Redentor 3 Group

texts.en:
Elsa is one of the members of the group called Cristo Redentor 3. They are five micro-business women from San Pedro de Macoris, from a batey (a company town) surrounded by sugarcane fields where they live and work for their families. They are selling clothes, miscellaneous products, shoes, groceries,  food, etc. She lives in a simple home with her family, which is comprised of five members: her children, her long-term partner, and herself. 

Elsa is associated with Esperanza and started with us because she needed capital to start a business. She is very excited to be receiving her 10th loan from Esperanza Internacional after having sucessfully paid off her previous loans, and having taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for around five years. 

Elsa is planning to invest her new loan in purchasing rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, and others goods for daily meals. She is running a small food store, called a colmado, where neighbors can buy their goods in their own neighborhood. She said her most difficult challenge has been to start her business. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, and other goods

loans.name: Papaye Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 44-year-old trader who is married with four children. She lives in Aboadzi, a suburb of Takoradi. For the past five years, she has been trading firewood and she provides many resources for her family. Elizabeth believes that hard work and dedication are the primary solutions for minimizing poverty and she is very serious about her business. 

Elizabeth will use her loan to buy firewood to serve her customers throughout the season. She is a member of a loan group called Papaye. Group members guarantee each other as social collateral and provide support for loan repayment.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Janice has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 12,000 Philippine pesos to stock canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Janice has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Janice hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata nació en el valle de La Convención y tiene 48 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad Lamay y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo tejidos y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 

Fortunata en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería chompas, guantes, chalinas y otras cosas más. Fortunata pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Fortunata agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Fortunata was born in the valley of La Convención and is 48 years old. She lives in the city of Lamay, where she carries out her economic activities. She sells woven handcrafted items and raises small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. 

At this time, Fortunata needs a loan to buy merchandise, sweaters, gloves, scarves, and other things. Fortunata belongs to the communal bank “Virgencita De Fátima DeLamay” of the Asociación Arariwa of the province of Calca in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

Fortunata is grateful for and values the loan. She promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, sweaters, gloves, scarves, and other things.

loans.name: Tonita

texts.en: Tonita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Tonita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos to stock canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Tonita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Tonita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Emie

texts.en: Emie is a married woman. Emie is 25 years old and resides in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Emie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,000 Philippine pesos doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 4,000 to purchase items such as shampoo and milk to sell. In 2010, Emie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Emie wants to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo and milk to sell

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Emelia has a shop that makes and sells coconut wines in liters and gallons. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy ingredients for making coconut wines.

Emelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Emelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making coconut wines.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Unidas “surgió mediante la promoción hecha a la señora Teresa quien anteriormente ya ha participado en comité, decidió buscar para sus socias, haciendo promoción a sus amigas y vecinas, y es de allí que surge el grupo. El comité está integrado por 12  mujeres muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo y familiarmente. Mencionaron que se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres.
Ramona es miembro de este grupo, y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, como ser empanadas, hamburguesas, sándwich de milanesas y demás tipo, gracias a lo cual tiene el suficiente dinero para poder mantener a su familia, y darles lo que necesitan para que de esa forma no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Ella comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, debido a que sus comidas son muy aceptadas por sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, panificados, aderezos y demás insumos necesarios para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Unidas [United] Women's Committee came about though the efforts of Teresa; she had previously participated in a committee and decided to advance the idea to her friends and neighbors and so they started the group.  The committee comprises twelve women who are very united, responsible, and close-knit.  They have a great desire for both the group and their families to succeed. They said that in the Women's Committee they're at ease working together as a team, with lots of hard work and care. 

Ramona, a member of the group, tells us that she sells all types of food, like empanadas, hamburgers, and chicken milanese sandwiches, thanks to which she has enough money to support her family and give them what they need. Now they don't have to lack for any necessities.  She says her food is well-received by her customers so she has a great clientele.  

Ramona is seeking a loan to buy meat, condiments, bread, dressings, and all the other ingredients she needs to keep making the food she sells.  She is very grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for the opportunity she's been given.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Mujeres Benditas Group

texts.en:
Maria Eulalia is the founder and current President of the Mujeres Benditas (Blessed Women) Trust Bank, which is comprised of nine women who are determined to develop successful businesses with their loans. The Trust Bank is located in a small town called San Jose Xepatan, Patzun, Chimaltenango, Guatemala, which is a very agricultural area. The majority of the inhabitants grow vegetables like green beans and broccoli. Within the Mujeres Benditas Trust Bank, five of the women are engaged in agriculture, another woman sells fruit, two ladies have convenience stores and one member operates a tortilla-making shop. All of them are also weavers. 

Maria is on her fifth loan with Friendship Bridge. The 54-year-old has never attended school and is divorced. She has six children, and four of them are still at home. Maria is an entrepreneur and works hard every day to support her children. She buys and sells vegetables and fruit, traveling to the market, which is located 20 minutes from her home, to sell her products on Tuesdays and Fridays from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. During the rest of the week, Maria and her family work in the field growing green beans and broccoli. Maria only started selling fruit five years ago, but her business is growing, which allows her to dedicate more money to raising crops. 

Maria’s dream is to expand her businesses so that she has a larger variety of products to sell. She wants to use her income to help her younger children continue in school; most of her older children only have a sixth-grade education. With her new loan, she will be purchasing seeds for planting more green beans and broccoli, as well as purchasing fruits and vegetables for resale.

Like Maria, the other eight women in the Mujeres Benditas Trust Bank are so thankful to have the support of KIVA investors. The women realize that KIVA investors work hard like they do and appreciate that others are willing to share their earnings with women in Guatemala so that they can create better opportunities for their children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for planting green beans and broccoli, and to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Violeta has a food shop or carinderia that sells food dishes like adobo, afritada and bulalo meat dishes. She has had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan for 18,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Violeta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Violeta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making food dishes.

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en:
Lotis is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Lotis provides motorcycle services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy tools and gasoline for her motorcycle services business.

Lotis has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for her motorcycle services business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married and has two children. Maricel is 25 years old and resides at Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. 

Maricel has owned and operated a gardening business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In 2010, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Maricel wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has seven children. 

Larry has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for six years. He has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Larry has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Larry hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is from Tru-Cut Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Elsa is married and has six children. 

To make a living, Elsa sells bananas in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns 2,500 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elsa is requesting a loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Laura Ines

texts.es:
Laura nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 50 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad Lamay y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche y otras cosas más. Laura en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gaseosas. Laura pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Laura agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Laura, 50, was born in city of Lamay, where she lives and earns a living.  She sells basic necessities like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, etc.  She currently needs a loan to buy soft-drinks.  Laura belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Virgencita de Fátima de Lamay"  [Our Lady of Fátima of Lamay] communal bank in the province of Calca, department of Cusco, Peru.  

Laura appreciates and values the loan and promises to make  all of her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Sonia has a shop that buys and sells bananas per kilogram. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of yellow and green bananas.

Sonia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Sonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of yellow and green bananas.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has one child.
 
Cheryl has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 53 years old and married with four children.

Chona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

Chona has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Chona aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Angeles has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from offering manicure and pedicure services.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 52 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Haide is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Haide has been farming rice for 20 years. She also earns additional income from photography.

Haide is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Felicidad has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

Felicidad has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona is 49 years old and widowed. She has four children.

Leona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Leona has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for two years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Leona aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, a 43-year-old married mother of eight children, has been earning a living as a rice farmer in the Philippines for seven years, and makes additional income from vulcanizing and gasoline retailing. Working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving money to expand her business, Helen is requesting a loan of PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: El Hadji Birane

texts.fr: Birane est un jeune, célibataire, sans enfants. Il tient depuis 2 ans  un magasin de vente de produits agricoles comme le mil, la paille d'arachide et des aliments concentrés de bétail.Malgré son jeune âge, il a en charge ses deux parents ainsi que ses frères et sœurs qu'il entretient avec les revenus tirés de son commerce.Il a déjà obtenu et remboursé 3 prêts de l'UIMCEC : 300000 et deux fois 500000f. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un autre prêt de 500000f pour acheter 300 sacs de paille d'arachide, 10 sacs de mil et 25 sacs d'aliments de bétail. Birane ambitionne de renforcer ses activités et d'élargir son magasin.
texts.en:
Birane is a young, single man with no children. For two years now, he has been running a store where he sells agricultural products such as millet, peanut straw, and feed concentrates for cattle. Despite his young age, he supports his two parents as well as his brothers and sisters, who he provides for with the income from his business.

Already, he has been granted and has paid back three loans through UIMCEC : one that amounted to 300,0000f, and two that amounted to 500,000f. In order to strengthen his business, he is seeking another 500,000f loan to buy 300 bags of peanut straw, 10 bags of millet, and 25 bags of cattle feed. Birane is striving to strengthen his business and enlarge his store.

loans.use: to buy 300 bags of peanut straw, 10 bags of millet, and 25 bags of cattle feed

loans.name: Esperanza Para Vivir 1 Group

texts.en:
Mayra is the coordinator of her group Esperanza para Vivir 1 (Hope to live). The group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, known for its tobacco and beef production. The group members are dedicated to selling clothes, food, shoes and jewelry.

Mayra, who lives in a simple structure with her parents' family, is a single woman without kids. She is a dedicated woman, working hard and helping her parents, saving money for her future and increasing her business. Mayra started taking loans with Esperanza International because her business needed capital to increase her sales and inventory. Her business has been running for around 4 years and she is excited to be taking her third loan from Esperanza International to buy various products like cosmetics, clothes, shoes and others.

Mayra will reinvest her profits in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (cosmetics, shoes, clothes)

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a single woman with a child. She is 26 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Mercedita owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns PHP 4,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Mercedita been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since this year. In the future, Mercedita's plan is to save her revenue in order to renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Srey Roth

texts.en:
Srey Roth, 30, is married and resides with her husband and her parents in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been working in a garment factory for over seven years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs a tuk-tuk motorcycle transportation service and earns about USD 5 per day. 

Srey Roth wants to rebuild her present house. With this aim in mind, Srey Roth is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase construction materials for her house construction. This loan would provide convenient living conditions for her family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business by purchasing a car for his transportation service.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her house construction.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Maria has a flower garden and she sells flowers during harvest time. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for the flower garden.

Maria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the flower garden.

loans.name: Trinitas

texts.en:
Trinitas is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has seven children.
 
Trinitas has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy stocks of bananas for resale.

Trinitas has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Trinitas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Crecelgie

texts.en:
Crecelgie is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.

Crecelgie has a shop that sells ice cubes and ice bars. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to pay for the electricity for making ice cubes and ice bars.

Crecelgie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Crecelgie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity for making ice cubes and ice bars.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal, age 42, earns a living by cultivating crops on her existing farm. She has been engaged in this business for fourteen years and earns additional income from raising livestock, like poultry and pigs. She, together with her husband, has four children.  One is married and the other three are single.

She is borrowing USD 1,100 through HKL to renovate a poultry coop and to buy some piglets for raising. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to renovate a poultry coop and to buy some piglets to raise.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 52 years old and married with four children. Marlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000-Philippine-peso loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marlyn has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Marlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Levy has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Levy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Levy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Vorin

texts.en:
Vorin, 58, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a teacher since 1980, earning approximately USD 3 per day. His wife is involved in growing vegetables and fattening up cattle and earns approximately USD 2 per day. Two of his children are employed. One is garment factory worker and the other one is a teacher. They earn approximately USD 5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Vorin is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable him to use the money saved on transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, he would like to expand his wife's agricultural business and help his youngest son get a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, he hopes to build a concrete house in order to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 49, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agriculture for over 20 years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns approximately USD 3 per day. Two of her children are construction workers as well. They earns about USD 6 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Mao is requesting for a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved money on transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business of breeding pigs and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a wooden house to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her furniture-making business. She has been in this business for 4 years. Marivic earns additional income from raising pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her furniture-making

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 52 years old and married. She has 4 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  Lorna is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.
 
Lorna has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending and a restaurant.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Madame Astou est une femme âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 03/06/1997 où elle occupe le poste de secrétaire dans le comité de gestion dudit Banc Villageois. Elle appartient au groupe de solidarité Takou Liguey.

Astou  s'active dans le commerce d'arachide et de haricot au niveau de son village. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis bientôt 20 ans.

Son nouveau crédit de 500.000 francs CFA lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité plus importante en marchandises (arachides et haricots) pour mieux développer son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle 

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge son enfant et de renforcer ses 

épargnes au niveau du BV.
texts.en:
Madame Astou is a woman of 58. She is married with one child. She has been a member of her "banc villageois" since June 3, 1977  and she is the secretary of the Board of this organization. She belongs to the solidarity group called Takou Liguey.

Astou works selling peanuts and dried beans in her village. She has a lot of experience in this business as she has practiced it for almost 20 years.  

Her new loan of 500,000 francs CFA will permit her to stock up on more merchandise (peanuts and dried beans) so that she can expand her business and satisfy the needs of her clientele. 

The profit generated by her business will permit her to take care of her child and to put aside more savings with her "village bank".

loans.use: to buy peanuts and beans.

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Deggo a été crée depuis le premier cycle du BV et il est composé actuellement de 9 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village et partageant de bons liens sociaux .

Madame Thiané (debout à gauche sur la photo et levant la main) est responsable de ce groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants et 3 autres à sa charge. 

Thiané est membre du BV depuis sa création, et s'active dans l'embauche ovine depuis presque 30 ans.

Son nouveau crédit de 50000 francs CFA lui permettra d'acheter des brebis qu'elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois.

Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettront d'acheter des denrées alimentaires mais également de

satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The Deggo group was created in the first cycle of the banc villageois. It is currently composed of nine women who all live in the same village and share strong social ties.
Madame Thiané (standing on the left and raising her hand) is responsible for the group. She is 48, married, and has three children and three others under her care.
Thiané has been a member of the banc villageois since its creation. She has worked fattening sheep for almost thirty years.
Her new loan of 50,000 francs will allow her to buy ewes which she will fatten and re-sell after four or five months.
This will allow her to buy food, but also to cover her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy ewes.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Madame Adama est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans et mère de 9 enfants .

Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 16/06/2006 et appartiens depuis lors à au groupe de solidarité 

niàk jeriniou.

Adama fait de l'embauche et du petit commerce de produits divers.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine  pour  l'avoir pratiqué pendant longtemps .

Son nouveau crédit de 500 000 francs CFA lui permettra d'acheter des brebis , du riz du sucre et du lait 

destiné  à la revente.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettront d'aider son mari dans la l'achat de denrées alimentaires 

pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Adama is a married woman, who is 44 years old and mother to nine children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 16th December 2006 and has belonged to the Niàk Jerinou solidarity group since then. 

Adama fattens animals and also trades in a variety of products. She has good experience in this field having done it for a long time. Her new loan of 500,000 FCFA will enable her to buy sheep, rice, sugar and milk, which she will then resell. The profits she generates from this business will allow her to help her husband to buy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep and other products

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and is married.  She has 3 children, who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Rosalie has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Rosalie has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun, 39, is married, and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a soldier who earns approximately USD 7 per day. One of her children is employed in a hotel and earns about USD 3 per day. Due to the difficulty of the family’s transportation, Chun is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business of buying watermelons to sell in order to generate more income for her family and help her children get bachelors degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and bigger to and to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Dynamique Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira, leader du groupe d’affaire «Dynamique », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 35  ans, mariée, mère de 6 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un technicien Menuisier. Elle est  vendeuse de denrees alimentaires. Il y a  12 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  8eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  4 bidons huiles, 50 kg des farines,50 kg de riz, 200 kg de haricots, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: This lender’s name is Kavira. She is the leader of the Dynamique business group. She is an entrepreneur, 35 years of age, married and the mother of six young children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a carpenter. She is a vendor of staple foods. She has been earning income in this way for 12 years already. She just obtained her 8th loan from Hekima. This new loan will enable to her to buy four jugs of vegetable oil, 50 kg [110 lbs] of flour, 50 kg of rice, 200 kg [440 lbs] of beans etc. In addition, she would like to see her children grow up in comfortable conditions and her business expand. As a client, she thanks Hekima for its actions in support of impoverished women excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy four jugs of vegetable oil, 50 kg   of flour, 50 kg of rice, 200 kg   of beans etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sitti Hawa

texts.en:
Sitti Hawa is 44 years old and married.   She has 7 children.  With 2 children in school, Sitti Hawa works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Sitti Hawa has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, shampoo, noodles, soft drinks, etc.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her two children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia, a 60-year-old widowed mother of five, works hard to provide for her family. The operator of a sari-sari store in the Philippines for the past 15 years, she also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

Rosalia has borrowed and repaid 12 previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting a PHP 20000 loan to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Sarain

texts.en:
Sarain 44 years old, married, and has one child.  She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over eight years, growing rice and fattening up cattle.  They have extensive experience and are successful in their careers. They earn approximate $5 per day. Sarain's husband is also employed as a construction worker and earns the extra income of $5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Sarain is requesting a loan for $700, which she will use to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to save money on her transportation expenses  and use that money to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and help her child earn a bachelor's degree. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and bigger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 46 years old and married with 2 children. She earns a living by buying and selling piglets in the Philippines. Ellen has been buying and selling piglets for 4 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Ellen is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Experia

texts.en:
Experia is 60 years old and widowed with 8 children. 

Experia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store. Experia has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and rice retailing.

Experia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Florenda has been raising livestock for 3 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Florenda is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock and feed. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and feed

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este Comité llamado Kuña Katupyry se formo a través de la Sra. Maria y la Sra. Rebeca, quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más al respecto del  Programa, son 20  mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Rebeca tiene una mercería bien surtida con todo tipo de productos, como ser ropas, artículos de bazar, calzados, etc. Tiene muy buena clientela gracias a la gran variedad de productos que tiene, lo que la ayuda mucho. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio que después con el correr del tiempo fue agrandando gracias a su trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, artículos de bazar y demás artículos, con lo cual podrá surtir su local y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank called Kuña Katupyry was formed by Maria and Rebeca, who came to the Fundación Paraguaya office to learn more about the program. The group comprises 20 hardworking and humble women who must earn their living every day and in this way help their families. 

Rebeca has a well-stocked notions store with all types of products, such as clothing, household items, footwear, etc. She has many clients because of the wide variety of products she stocks, which helps her a lot. She says that she started with a small shop that grew over time thanks to her work.

She is requesting this loan to buy garments, household items, and other things with which she will be able to stock her space and, therefore, continue to offer a wide variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy items to stock her notions store.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa works hard to support her family. Jesusa is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Jesusa requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

In the future, Jesusa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Allan has been in this business for 11 years. He also earns more income from hog raising.

He is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials such as bamboo, screen and nylon for his fishing business. He has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Allan is hoping to save enough money to buy an additional fishing boat for fishing.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bamboo, screen and nylon for his fishing.

loans.name: Wilsonia

texts.en:
Wilsonia is 42 years old, married, and has four children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years.  She also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Wilsonia is requesting a loan for 13,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional livestock to raise.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Virgen de Fatima es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 8º ciclo con 17 integrantes quienes son señoras trabajadoras que se esmeran en salir adelante en invertir el crédito en sus respectivas actividades.
La Sra Sulma es una de las miembros, ella se dedica al tejido desde hace ya un buen tiempo. Ella hace todo tipo de tejidos, como ser sobrecamas, abrigos y demás, con lo cual ha podido mantener a su familia. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que quiere salir adelante y es por ello que se esfuerza siempre para poder salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas y demás insumos con lo que podrá abastecerse y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando. Ella agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee named Virgen de Fatima is from the city of Carapeguá. Today the committee is on the 8th cycle with 17 members who are working women that strive to move forward by investing credit into their respective work. 
Sulma is one of the members. She works as a seamstress for a living and has for quite some time. She does all types of sewing, such as for bedspreads, coats, and more, with which she has been able to maintain her family. She defines herself and a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person that wants to progress and it is for that that she always pushes herself to be able to move forward.
She is requesting a loan in order to purchase thread, needles and other supplies with which she will be able to stock up and be able to continue working. She is grateful to the foundation and to kiva for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: Comprar insumos para los bordados.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, 52 years old and single, works hard to provide for her family. The operator of a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 25 years, she also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Nida, who has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF, is now requesting a PHP 20000 loan to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. Nida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Akarapu’Uara Group

texts.es:
El comité Akarapu’ara está integrado por seis jóvenes, se formo con la iniciativa de Ramona, está ubicado en la ciudad de Curuguaty, y se confrmó con el compromiso de trabajar todas ellas en equipo. Ellas son mujeres de escasos recursos, quienes se reúnen con el propósito de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Liliana integra este grupo, y nos comenta que se dedica a la cría de animales, de todo tipo, comos ser cerdos, gallinas, patos, etc. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se esfuerza por salir adelante y desea demostrarse a si misma, que por medio de su trabajo puede conseguir sus propósitos y metas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos, cerdos pequeños y balanceados para estos, con lo cual podrá seguir en su trabajo. Ellas agradecen a kiva y a la fundación paraguaya por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee Akarapu’ara  is made up of 6 young women. It was formed with the initiative of Ramona. It is located in the city of Curuguaty and was formed with the promise of everyone working together as a team. They are women of scarce resources who came together with the purpose of moving forward and helping each other.
Liliana is a member of this group and tells us that she raises animals of all kinds for a living like pigs, chickens, ducks, etc. She describes herself as a very hardworking woman who is a fighter that forces herself to progress and wants to show herself that by means of her work she can get meet her aims and goals.
She is requesting a loan to buy chicks, baby pigs and food for them with which she will be able to continue in her work. She is grateful to kiva and to the Paraguayan Foundation for the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: Comprar pollitos, cerdos, y balanceados.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 43 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Florencia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas. 

Florencia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Florencia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Florencia was born in the city of Lamay and she is 43 years old. She lives with her partner and their three children. She lives in the city in which she was born and this is also where she carries out her work. She breeds small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens for a living. At this time Florencia needs the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Florenica belongs to the communal bank "Virgen de Fátima de Lamay" from the Arariwa Association of the Calca province, in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Florencia is grateful for the loan and she promises to make her monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 44 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene un hijo, él vive en la ciudad Lamay y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él se dedica a la carpintería y tiene un taller en su domicilio. Sergio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. 

Sergio pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Sergio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Sergio was born in the city of Lamay and he is 44 years old. He is married and he has one son. He lives in the city of Lamay and this is where he carries out his work. He works as a carpenter and he has a workshop at his home. At this time Sergio requires a loan to buy wood.

Sergio belongs to the communal bank "Virgen de Fátima de Lamay" of the Arariwa Association in the Calca province, in the department of Cusco in Peru.

Sergio is grateful for the loan and he promises to make his monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Sanh

texts.en:
Sanh, 31, is married and lives with his wife and two school-age children in Kampong Chhnang province. He works for a private company as a car driver, so his daily duty is to transport items from one place to another as required by the employer. He is the main income provider for his family. On the other hand, his spouse helps earn income by cultivating potatoes on their own farm.

With the amount he requested through HKL, he will pay for laborers to tidy up his land for planting potatoes. He will use the remainder, to buy farming supplies for this process.

loans.use: to pay the salary for the laborers

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie works hard to support her family. Annie is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Annie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Annie has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Annie would like to save enough money to provide a secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 44 years old, married, and has two children. With both of her children in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them. Gemma runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more dry goods to sell in her variety store.

Gemma has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as slippers, bags, balls, and other dry goods. Gemma would like to save enough to expand her business and provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en: Emelie works hard to support her family. Emelie is married and has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. Emelie requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy firewood to sell. Emelie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Emelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Jocely

texts.en: Jocely is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocely is 41 years old. Jocely has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Jocely requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell. She has been in this business for three years. Jocely would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefania nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 40 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la ciudad Lamay y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, zapallos, cebollas, tomates, papas, maíz, choclo, cebolla china y otras cosas más. Estefania en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras. Estefania pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Estefania agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Estefania  was born in the city of Lamay and is 40 years old. She lives in a common law marriage from which she has two children. She lives in Lamay where she does her economic activities. She sells vegetables for a living such as carrots, squash, onions, tomatoes, potatoes, maize, corn, chinese onion and more. In this opportunity Estefania needs a loan in order to buy vegetables. Estefania belongs to the communal bank “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” of the Arariwa Association from the Calca province in the department of Cusco, Perú.

Estefania appreciates and values the loan and promises to comply with the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Jorge

texts.es:
Doña María, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijas y su nieto en la ciudad de Langue, departamento de Valle, al sur de Honduras.
Su negocio es la venta de tortillas, su puesto lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de Langue, también vende sus tortillas en algunos restaurantes, cafeterías de esta ciudad y en su casa de habitación.
Esta solicitando la cantidad de 8,000.00 lempiras para la compra de maíz, leña y material para mejorar el taller donde ella elabora sus tortillas y de esta manera tratar de fabricar más tortillas para lograr mejores ingresos.
Entre uno de sus proyectos a futuro esta el de comprar una maquina para elaborar tortillas, para que su negocio crezca mas y le de mejores  ingresos, para ayudar a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Doña María is a single mother and she lives with her two daughters and her grandson in the city of Langue in the department of Valle in the south of Honduras.

Her business is selling tortillas. Her stand is located in the municipal market in Langue. She also sells her tortillas in various restaurants and cafeterias in the city and also in her house. She is requesting the amount of 8,000.00 lempiras to buy maize, wood and material to improve the workshop in which she makes her tortillas, and she hopes that this will allow her to make more tortillas, thus improving her income.

One of her plans for the future is to buy a machine to make tortillas in order for her business to grow. This will earn her a better income and help her family.

- San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy maize and wood for her tortilla business

loans.name: Ellen Ruth

texts.en:
Ellen Ruth is a hard working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Ellen Ruth has been in this business for five years. Ellen Ruth earns more income from buying and selling pigs.

Ellen Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en: Marifel is married and has eight children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marifel is 37 years old. Marifel has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. Marifel requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell. Marifel has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Marifel would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 53 years old, married, and has five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Estrella is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Estrella has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Narcissa

texts.en: Narcissa is 51 years old, married, and has 10 children. With three children in school, Narcissa works very hard to provide for them. Narcissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell. Narcissa has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc. In the future Narcissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 47 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, él vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él se dedica a la venta de pasto a una empresa privada. Demetrio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para el forraje y pasto. 

Demetrio pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Demetrio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Demetrio was born in the city of Lamay and he is 47 years old. He is married and he has two children. He lives in the city in which he was born and this is also where he carries out his work. He sells grass to a private company for a living. At this time Demetrio requires a loan for fodder and grass. 

Demetrio belongs to the communal bank "Virgen de Fátima de Lamay" of the Arariwa Association in the Calca province in the department of Cusco in Peru.

Demetrio is grateful for the loan and he promises to make the monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fodder and grass

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de Dios nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 41 años de edad, él es separado pero tiene tres hijos, él vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él se dedica a la venta de madera. Juan de Dios en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera.  

Juan de Dios pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Juan de Dios agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Juan de Dios was born in the city of Lamay and is 41 years old. He is separated but has three children. He lives in the city where he was born, and that is where he works. He works selling wood. On this occasion Juan de Dios needs a loan to purchase wood.

Juan de Dios belongs to the "Virgen de Fátima de Lamay" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa in the province of Calca, department of Cusco.

Juan de Dios is grateful and appreciates the loan. He commits to meeting the monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Zafir Shirinov

texts.ru:
Etomu molodomu cheloveku 24 qoda. On uje 3 goda kak imeyet magazin gde prodayet razniye zapchasti shnuri i nujniye veshi dlya remonta. Zafir nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi kupit bolshe tovarov dlya prodaji spros na kotorix bolshe sredi pokupateley. On etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyego otca.  
Zafir jivet v Fizuli regione, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda i yavlyayetsya IDP personom. Zafir ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
This young man is 24 years old.  He has had a store, where he sells various spare part, wires and necessary things for repairs, for three years.  Zafir needs 1600 AZN to buy more merchandise that has the highest demand among his customers.  He learned this business from his father.  Zafir lives in the Fuzuli region.  He relocated from the city of Fuzuli and is an IDP.  Zafir is not married and has no children. 

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person who have been forced or obliged to flee his home, in particular as a result of an armed conflict, violence, violations of human rights or natural or human-made disasters, and who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an internationally recognised State border and remains on the territory of his own country. (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs)

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Suyapa Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Suyapa, tiene 31 años, tiene 4 hijos  entre 2 y 14 años de edad, esta casada, su esposo es pintor y reside en una aldea rural del municipio de La Másica, Atlántida.
Suyapa se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de abarrotería (granos básicos, harina de trigo, consomé de pollo, sal, azúcar) y productos de aseo y limpieza. Ella inicio su negocio con sus propios ahorros y además con la ayuda de financiamientos.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 18,000 Lempiras los cuales piensa invertir en la ampliación de su negocio, aumentando el inventario para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
Manifiesta estar motivada a seguir adelante ya que los ingresos que obtiene le permiten suplir las necesidades de su familia.  En el futuro Suyapa espera tener un mini súper.
texts.en:
Suyapa, age 31, has four children between the ages of 2 and 14.  She is married, and her husband is a painter.  She lives in a rural village in the La Másica municipality, Atlántida.
