For six years Suyapa has been selling groceries (basic grains, wheat flour, chicken consommé, salt, and sugar).  She also sells hygienic and cleaning products.  She started her business with her own savings and with the help of loans.

She is currently requesting a loan for 18,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to expand her business and to increase her inventory so that she can offer variety to her customers.

She states that she is motivated to get ahead because the income that she gets allows her to supply her family’s necessities.  In the future Suyapa hopes to have a mini supermarket.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fortuna Group

texts.es:
Fortuna es un grupo integrado por 12 mujeres, de una de las colonias indígenas de la ciudad de Curuguaty, está actualmente en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
El comité Fortuna tiene como presidenta a la señora Amancia, que se dedica al comercio, ya que tiene su pequeña Despensa que desde el primer ciclo invirtió en el comprando más productos para poder abastecerlo. Ella comenta que inicio con una pequeña despensa, que luego fue creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y asi poder tener, algún día, un mini súper bien surtido.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá surtir su local y de esa forma hacer frente a los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fortuna is a group made up of 12 women, from one of the indigenous colonies and from the city of Curuguaty. It is currently in its second cycle of the program of women entrepreneurs from the Paraguayan Foundation.
The Fortuna Committee has Amancia as a president, who is in retail for a living. She already has a small store that since the first cycle she invested in the purchasing of more products to be able to stock it. She says that she began as a small pantry that later was growing thanks to her efforts. Her goal is to be able to continue working and also to have, some day, a well stocked convenience store.
She is requesting a loan in order to buy drinks, food, dairy products and other supplies with which she will be able to stock her store and in this way be able to fulfill the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock the store.

loans.name: Diana Zarahi

texts.es: Diana es  una persona  muy trabajadora  que  día   con día  se  preocupa  por  salir  adelante, ella  actualmente  tiene  una estética  desde  hace   ya  cuatro  años, la cual  le  ha  permitido  sacar adelante a  su  familia  ,  es por  ello que se acerco a la institución para   recibir  apoyo  para  la realización de su proyecto, el cual consiste  en comprar  materia  prima  para  seguir  laborando, agradece  el apoyo  brindado para la realización de el proyecto.
texts.en: Diana is a hard worker who worries daily about getting ahead. She’s owned a hairdressing salon for 4 years now, which has helped her family get ahead. She is requesting a loan to help bring her project to fruition. Her project entails buying basic materials to continue working. She’s grateful for the support offered to her for the realization of her project.

loans.use: buy basic materials for her business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 39 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella se dedica venta de chicha de jora y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Paulina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para la educación de su hijo. (Su hijo de Elfi estudia en una academia pre universitario). Su sueño de Paulina es sacar profesional a sus hijos.   

Paulina pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Paulina agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Paulina was born in the city of Lamay and is 39 years old. She lives in a common law marriage from which she has four children. She sells traditional corn liquor and also small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. At this time, Paulina is requesting a loan to pay for her child's education. (Her son Elfi studies at a university preparatory academy.) Paulina's dream is that all her children become professionals.  

Paulina belongs to the communal bank “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” of the Asociación Arariwa of the province of Calca in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

Paulina is grateful for and values the loan. She promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to pay for her child's education.

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es: María  actualmente  se  dedica a la  venta  de   ropa  , este    negocio le  a permitido  sacar  adelante  a  su  familia, en  esta  ocasión se  acerco  a  la institución  ya  que  requiere  realizar  la compra  de  mercancía  para  su  negocio, nos  comenta  que  sus  ventas  han  incrementado  satisfactoriamente, ve  en  el  crédito la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio brindándole  la posibilidad  de  dedicarse a  lo que  mas  le   gusta   que  es  el comercio ya  que  desde   hace  mucho tiempo a  tenido mucha  atracción al respecto.
texts.en:
María currently works selling clothing. This business has allowed her to help her family get ahead. On this occasion she approached the institution because she needs to purchase merchandise for her store. 

She tells us that her sales have increased satisfactorily. With this loan she sees the possibility to expand her business. This will give her the opportunity to work doing what she likes the most, sales, because for a long time she has really enjoyed this work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es:
Rosalva nació en la ciudad de Calca y tiene 32 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene un hijo, ella tiene dos carros que se utilizan para brindar servicio de transporte interprovincial. Rosalva en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los carros. Su sueño de Rosalva es abrir una empresa de transportes.  
  
Rosalva pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Rosalva agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rosalva was born in the city of Calca and she is 32 years old. She is married and she has a son. She has two cars which she uses to provide interprovincial transport services. At this time Rosalva requires a loan to carry out some maintenance on the cars. Rosalva's dream is to open a transport company.

Roslva belongs to the communal bank "Virgen de Fátima de Lamay" of the Arariwa Association in Calca province, in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Rosalva is grateful for the loan and she promises to make her monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on her cars.

loans.name: Ansor

texts.ru: Ансор 47 - летний женатый мужчина. У него двое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Ansor is a 47 year-old married man.  He has two children.  He has a secondary education.  Ansor earns a living by breeding cattle.  He has been involved in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Jipargul

texts.ru: Жыпаргул 38 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Жыпаргул занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое в 2000 году с 6,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 дойные коровы и земля мерою в 1,05 га,  где она выращивает хлопок. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпаргул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Жыпаргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Jipargul is 38 years old, married and raising four children.  She is involved in animal husbandry and farming to provide a source of income for her family.  This business, started in 2000 with 6,000 som (KGS), today yields about 7,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  Today, her business contains two dairy cows and land measured at 1.05 hectares, where she grows cotton.  In order to further develop her business, Jipargul requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a further increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is married with four children aged 1-13. Two of them are enrolled in school. Jean Paul has been a rice farmer for 1 year, and his wife also works as a farmer. Jean Paul is requesting this Kiva loan to pay for fertilizers, seeds, and labor support so he can get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to increase his output. 

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending for agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds, and labor support

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is a youth client age 25. She is married and has one child.

Marwa has been a tailor since 2006. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing such as suits, coats and dresses for women. She has more than four years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and a knowledge of their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $3,000 youth loan in order to purchase two tailoring machines and to buy more fabrics and buttons. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two tailoring machines and to add more goods as fabrics and buttons.

loans.name: Malahat Mammadova

texts.ru:
Malahat zamujem i  mat chetirex(4) detey. Yey 42 qoda. Ona uje 3 goda kak prodayet frukti i ovoshi. Seychas ona nudjayetsya v 2350 AZN chtobi kupit bolshe fruktov i ovoshey dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Tak kak u neyo bolshaya semya i mnogo detey ona nujdayetsya v uvelichenii mesachnix doxodov chtobi soderjat semyu vmeste s mujem.
Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
Malahat is married and has four children.  She is 42 years old.  She has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years.  Currently, she needs 2350 AZN to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale and development of her business.  Because Malahat has a large family and many children, she needs to increase her monthly earnings in order for her and her husband to provide for their family.  Malahat is an IDP from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her family.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person who have been forced or obliged to flee his home, in particular as a result of an armed conflict, violence, violations of human rights or natural or human-made disasters, and who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an internationally recognised State border and remains on the territory of his own country. (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs)

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru:
Нуриле 43 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Нурила на протяжении 12 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нурилы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  4 коровы, 8 овец и земельный надел мерою 0,67га, где она выращивает хлопок. Доходы от бизнес – деятельности Нурилы позволяют оплачивать обучение ее детей в университете. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурила обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nurila is 43 years old, married and has two children. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years, after starting this business with an amount of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Nurila's hard work, today her business contains four cows, eight sheep and a land plot measured at 0.67 hectares, where she grows cotton. The earnings from her business allow Nurila to pay for her children's education in a university.  In order to further develop her business, Nurila requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings into a further increase of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aksanti Mungu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabera, leader du groupe d’affaire «Aksanti Mungu », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 39  ans, mariée, mère de 6 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est aussi petit commerçant. Elle est  vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Il y a  9 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  14eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  15 bidons huiles, 10 sacs des farines, 4 casiers de Fanta, 3sacs kg de riz, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement, accroitre son entreprise et construire en dur.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: This lender’s name is Kabera. She is the leader of the “ Aksanti Mungu” business group. She is an entrepreneur, 39 years of age, married and the mother of six young children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is also a vendor. She sells staple foods. She has been earning income in this way for  nine years already. She just obtained her 14th  loan from Hekima. This new loan will enable to her to buy 15  jugs of vegetable oil,  10 bags of flour,  10 bags of flour, four cases of Fanta, three bags of rice,   etc. In addition, she would like to see her children grow up in comfortable conditions and her business expand, and to build a durable house. As a client, she thanks Hekima for its actions in support of impoverished women excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy 15  jugs of vegetable oil,  10 bags of flour,  10 bags of flour, four cases of Fanta, three bags of rice,   etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jepopyhy Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras Jepopyhy es del chaco, ellas actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que siempre se esfuerzan por ayudar a sus familias, por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas.
Aurelia es modista, y comenta que trabaja en esto hace mucho tiempo, por lo que ya se ha hecho una buena clientela que siempre acude hasta ella para darle trabajo. Sus vecinos dicen que es una muy buena trabajadora y que siempre hace muy buenas prendas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes. Ella y sus amigas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Jepopyhy is from Chaco. Today they are in the first cycle of the program of women entrepreneurs from the Paraguayan Foundation. They are very hardworking and entrepreneurial women who always strive to help their families, through the joint work of all of them.
Aurelia is a dressmaker and says that she has been working for a long time, by which she has already made a good client base that always comes to her to give her work. Her neighbors say that she a good worker and always makes very good clothes.
She is requesting a loan to purchase fabric, thread, rubber and other supplies to be able to continue working and complying with the demands of her customers. She and her friends appreciate the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for a sewing shop.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 39 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella tiene una tienda de emporio o minimarket. Ya son nueve años que se dedica  a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y le va muy bien. Betty en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, cajas de leche, bolsas de fideos y otros más. Su sueño de Betty es sacar profesional a sus hijos. 
  
Betty pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Betty agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Betty was born in the city of Lamay.  She is 39 years old, married, and has three children. For the past nine years, she has owned a minimarket where she sells basic necessities, and the business is going well.  At this time, Betty needs the loan to purchase merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar, containers of milk, bags of noodles, and other products.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals. 

Betty belongs to the “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” Communal Bank, part of the “Arariwa” Association, located in the province of Calca, department of Cusco, Peru.  She appreciates and values the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments on time.  
.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Maribel Elva

texts.es:
La señora Maribel  es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones Unidos”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 1 hijo en estudio.  Ella cuenta con educación secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de servicio de llamadas telefónicas (cabinas), actualmente se dedica a la venta de comidas (restaurante).
Ahora solicitará un nuevo créditos por la suma de  S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá implementar su restaurante y pondrá una cafetería, en el negocio le ayuda su hermana.
Su sueño para el futuro es poner restaurantes en otros lugares.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la capacitación respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the communal bank “Corazones Unidos” in the district of Desaguadero, Chucuito province, Department of Puno. She is 33 years old, single, and has 1 child in school. She has a high school education.

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, money which she invested in her telephone service business (telephone booths). Now she sells food (restaurant).

She will now request a new loan for the sum of S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to set up her restaurant and put in a coffee bar. Her sister helps her in the business. Her dream for the future is to have restaurants in other locations.

What she likes best about her communal bank is the business training.

loans.use: to set up her restaurant and put in a coffee bar.

loans.name: Izzatbubu

texts.ru:
Иззатбубу 41 год, замужем, имеет 4 детей, младшему из которых 4 года . Иззатбубу на протяжении 15 лет занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Иззатбубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  земельный участок 0,40 га, где она выращивает картофель и морковь.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Иззатбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку минеральных удобрений и семян картофеля.  Доходы от кредита Иззатбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса за счет покупки дойных коров.
texts.en: Izzatbubu is 41 years old, married and has four children, the youngest of whom is four years old. She has been involved in farming for 15 years, after starting this business with an amount of 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Izzatbubu's hard work, today her business has a 0.40 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes and carrots.  In order to further develop her business, Izzatbubu requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase mineral fertilizers and potato seeds. She plans to invest the earnings into a further expansion of her business by purchasing dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and potato seeds

loans.name: Burulush

texts.ru:
Бурулуш 50 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Бурулуш на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 18,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бурулуш в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  6 коров и земельный надел 3,93 га где она выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса Бурулуш составляет 25,000 сом.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулуш обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить надои.  Доходы от кредита Бурулуш планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Burulush is 50 years old, married and has three children. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 15 years, after starting this business with an amount of 18,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Burulush's hard work, today her business contains six cows and a land plot of 3.93 hectares, where she grows potatoes, cereal crops and alfalfa. Her monthly business income amounts to 25,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Burulush requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase dairy cows. She plans to invest the earnings into a further increase of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis, un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, emprendedor y muy trabajador nos manifiesta su agradecimiento por el préstamo Kiva que ha recibido ya que no solo a el lo ha beneficiado como agricultor también le ha permitido brindar empleo a otras personas cercanas a su comunidad.Ahora este cerdito lo requiere para sembrar otra área mas de hortalizas, compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra. Con el objetivo de ir mejorando su producción de hortalizas y brindar oportunidad de empleo a los campesinos de su comunidad.
texts.en: Luis is young man with high hopes to get ahead. This hard working entrepreneur tells us that he is grateful for the Kiva loan he has received as it has not only benefitted him as a farmer, but has also allowed him to hire others in his local community. The loan he is currently requesting is to sow another vegetable crop, buy supplies and pay manual labor. His objective is to improve the production of vegetables and offer employment to the peasants of his community.

loans.use: sow another vegetable crop, buy supplies and pay manual labor.

loans.name: Silvia Alicia

texts.es: Silvia  es  una persona  que  con esfuerzo  a  salido adelante, ella  es  cliente  distinguido de la institución ya que a  lo largo de sus  créditos  se  ha caracterizado por  tener  una excelente  cultura   de pago, actualmente  la señora  cuenta  con una tienda de abarrotes  la cual le permite  obtener  ingresos  para  sacar adelante  a su  familia, ella  esta  muy  contenta  ya que  nos  comenta  que  sus  clientes  han incrementado  satisfactoriamente, es por ello que en esta  ocasión  requiere  realizar  la compra  de mercancía  para  seguir   brindado a  sus clientes el  excelente  servicio que  la  ha  caracterizado.
texts.en: Silvia has made great strides in getting ahead. Throughout her previous loans, she has become a distinguished member of the Communal Bank for her excellent payment schedule. She has a grocery store that allows her to generate income to get her family ahead. She tells us that she is very happy because her clientele has increased satisfactorily. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise so she can continue offering the excellent service she’s known for.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья с семьей живет в Приветном и занимается выращиванием ранних овощных культур. На 170 сотках земли в теплицах и под дугами она  делает две высадки: каждый раз садит 40 000 голов капусты, 60 000 кустов перца и 30 000 – сахарной кукурузы. Фермерством Наталья занимается уже 8 лет. В хозяйство у нее вложено около 100 000 гривен. 

На полученные от КИВА средства Наталья собирается купить семена на 3 000 гривен, полиэтиленовую пленку на 10 000 гривен, удобрения на 4 000 гривен, а также стройматериалы для новой теплицы на 1 000 гривен и шланги для капельного орошения на 2 000 гривен.    
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Natalya and her family lives in Privetnoye and is involved in growing early vegetable cultures.  She plants twice on 170 sotkas of land in greenhouses and under arches.  Every time, she plants 40,000 heads of cabbage, 60,000 bunches of pepper and 30,000 of sugar corn.  Natalya has been involved in farming for eight years.  She has about 100,000 hryvnia invested in her business.  Natalya plans to use the obtained loan from Kiva to buy seeds with 3,000 hryvnia, plastic with 10,000 hryvnia, fertilizers with 4,000 hryvnia and also construction materials for a new greenhouse with 1,000 hryvnia, and hoses for drip irrigation with 2,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to buy seeds with 3,000 hryvnia, plastic with 10,000 hryvnia, fertilizers with 4,000 hryvnia and also construction materials for a new greenhouse with 1,000 hryvnia, and hoses for drip irrigation with 2,000 hryvnia

loans.name: Dilsa Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Dilsa, es soltera, con 1 hijo, reside en la ciudad de Langue, y vive en su propia casa  con su hijo y su mama, en esta ciudad en el sur de honduras.
Doña Dilsa se dedica a la venta de joyas de fantasía, oro, plata y relojes,  en el mercado municipal de Langue, Doña Dilsa también visita a domicilio a sus clientes en barrios y colonias de Langue, Doña Dilsa vende anillos, cadenas, esclavas, aritos, relojes para niño, relojes para adulto, repuestos de relojes de todo tipo, etc.
Esta solicitando su préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir más su negocio, para de esta manera generar mejores ingresos en su negocio, así lograr un mejor posicionamiento de su negocio en el mercado y mejorar el estatus de vida de su hijo y su mama. 
Entre sus sueños a futuro esta la idea de construir un local mejor acondicionado para que su negocio este mejor distribuido.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Dilsa is single and has one child.  She lives in the city of Langue in her own house.  She lives with her son and her mother in this city, which is in the southern part of Honduras.

Dilsa sells costume jewelry, gold, silver, and watches in the Langue municipal market.  Dilsa also goes to her customers’ homes in the Langue neighborhoods and settlements.  Dilse sells rings, chains, ID bracelets, earrings, children’s and adult’s watches, and replacement parts for all types of watches, etc.

She is requesting her loan to buy merchandise to stock her business more.  This way she will generate better income in her business.  She will manage to improve the position of her business in the market and improve the standard of living for her son and her mother.

Among her dreams for the future is the idea to build a place that is better equipped so that her business can improve its distribution.

loans.use: to buy watches, chains, bracelets, ID bracelets, rings, and others for her business.

loans.name: Edgar Hipolito

texts.es:
Edgar nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 35 años de edad, él tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él es albañil y se dedica a la construcción de casas, edificios y otras cosas. Edgar en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales y maquinas de construcción. 

Edgar pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Edgar agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Edgar is 35 years old and was born in the city of Lamay.  He lives in a common-law marriage from which he has two children.  He is a bricklayer and builds houses, buildings, and other structures.  At this time, he is requesting the loan to purchase materials and construction machines.  Edgar belongs to the “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” Communal Bank, part of the “Arariwa” Association, located in the province of Calca, department of Cusco, Peru.  He appreciates and values the loan, and promises to make his monthly payments on time.  .

loans.use: to purchase materials and construction machines.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones Unidos”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, estado civil casada, con cinco hijos (1 dependiente y 4 independientes), no tiene estudios.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 7 años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio venta de golosinas, galletas y gaseosas.
En la actualidad requerirá de un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles dinero con la que comprará cinco cajas de galletas, 10 paquetes de gaseosas,  golosinas en general, la señora trabaja sola, su esposo trabaja de triciclista.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar el negocio y cambiar.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y las charlas educativas
texts.en:
Señora Juliana is a member of the Communal Bank "Corazones Unidos" [United Hearts] in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito province in the department of Puno. She is 47 years old and is married with five children (1 of whom is a dependent and 4 are independent). She has had no education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past 7 years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300.00 nuevos soles. She invested this loan in her business of selling candy, cookies and soft drinks.

She currently requires a new loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. She will use the money to buy five boxes of cookies, ten packages of soft drinks and also candy. She works alone. Her husband is a tricyclist. 

Her dream for the future is to improve her business and make changes. The thing she most likes about her Communal Bank is the ease of borrowing and the educational lectures.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of cookies, ten packages of soft drinks and also candy

loans.name: Juan Carlos Perez

texts.es: El señor Juan es una persona joven y muy emprendedora, se dedica a su negocio la venta de ropa nueva como ser, pantalones, camisas, blusas, sandalias, ropa para niños, ropa interior y mas, desde hace seis años, desde muy temprano instala frente al parque una carpa para poder mostrar la mercadería a las personas que transitan por el lugar ya que es una zona muy visitada, atiende todos los días de la semana y realiza sus compras tres veces al mes, gracias a sus utilidades ha ido creciendo su negocio y ahora puede ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, vive con sus hermanos y les ayuda con la educación. Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 20,000.00 Para poder invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para esta temporada de verano como ser, short, camisetas, trajes de baño y mas.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is an enterprising young person.  He has a business that sells new clothing such as trousers, shirts, blouses, sandals, children's outfits, undergarments, and other items.  Juan has been doing this for six years.  In the early morning hours, he sets up a tent in front of a park where he displays his goods so that people passing by this place can see them since it is a high-traffic area.  He attends to his customers every day of the week and makes his purchases three times a month.  Thanks to the profits he has earned, Juan has been able to grow his business and now offers more variety to his customers.  He lives with his siblings and helps them with their education.  

Juan is requesting a loan valued at 20,000 HNL so that he can invest in the purchase of merchandise for the summer season such as shorts, bathing suits, and other items.

loans.use: to buy shorts, t-shirts, sandals, and swimsuits.

loans.name: Yorman Alexander Salazar Mazo

texts.es: Yorman de 21 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 1 a 5 años. Él  tiene una tienda, donde vende ranchos, víveres, enlatados etc.; Experiencia aprendida trabajando como vendedor  en una de ellas. Viendo crecer económicamente a su antiguo jefe, pensó en convertir su sueño emprendedor en realidad, por eso comenzó su propio negocio, donde hoy puede decir que ha logrado su  crecimiento personal y financiero apoyando su bienestar familiar. Su meta mas adelante es capitalizar su negocio, pero su falta de recursos para surtirlo como el necesita tenerlo es su gran desafío. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprara, víveres, abarrotes, tendientes a incrementar sus inventarios y a lograr descuentos por compras de contado y en efectivo,lo cual contribuírá a incremntar su ofera y potencializará sus ventas; justificando así el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Yorman, 21, lives in the city of Cartagena with his spouse and their four children, ages 1 through 5.  He has a store where he sells food, supplies, canned goods, etc., experience he learned from working as a merchant in one of them.  Seeing his former boss grow economically, he thought about converting his entrepreneurial dream into reality.  This is why he started his own business, where today he can say that he has achieved his own personal and economic growth, helping the well-being of his family.

His long-term goal is to reinvest in his business, but his big challenge is his lack of capital to stock it as is necessary.  This is why he is coming for a Kiva loan, the first financing he has asked for from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy supplies and groceries, measures to increase his inventory and realize discounts from cash purchases.  This will contribute to increasing his supply and will improve his sales, thus justifying the success of his investment.

loans.use: to buy supplies and groceries.

loans.name: Grupo Libertad 1 Group

texts.es:
Don  Mamerto  es  un  señor muy trabajador,  dedicado  a su trabajo,  padre  de  4  hijos   los  cuales  ya son    mayores  de  edad. Sus hijos  ayudan  en  la  parte  económica a Don Mamerto.  Don Mamerto ejerce su  actividad  en  varios  barrios de  Choluteca en el sur Honduras y  lo realiza   en  bicicleta  desde hace  mas  de  25  años.  Don Mamerto se dedica   a  la  venta de  pan. El préstamo  lo necesita  Para invertir en la compra de  pan. Que le  ayudara   a  que  tener  capital  fresco  ya  que  trabaja  con  créditos,  también  da  créditos   a  sus  clientes  en  los  negocios. sus  sueños   es  de  construir  su casa  ya  que  alquila  y no ha  podido   ahorrar para comprarse una vivienda,  Don Mamerto cree que con su negocio y la ayuda de sus hijos el sueña con algún día pueda comprar una casa para dejar de alquilar.

Macaria se  dedica   a su negocio propio   venta  de   golosinas   y  venta de leña,   actividad  que  realiza  desde  hace mas  de  15  años   actualmente  vive  con  su  esposo y  2  hijos. 

Oscar se  dedica  la  venta  de  pan,  actividad  que lo  hace  en  su  vehículo    desde  hace  mas  de 4  años. Actualmente  vive  con  su esposa   y 2 hijos 


Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Mamerto is a hardworking man, dedicated to his job, and father of 4 children who are already of legal age. Mamerto's children help him economically.  Mamerto conducts his work in various areas and neighborhoods in Choluteca in the south of Honduras. For more than 25 years, he has done this work on his bicycle.

Mamerto sells bread. He needs the loan to invest in buying bread. It would help him to have new capital, as he has loans and offers credit to his business customers. His dream is to build a house, since he rents and has not been able to save to buy his own house. Mamerto believes that with his business and the help of his children, he can dream of buying a house one day and stop renting.

2. Macaria has her own business selling sweets and firewood. She has been doing this work for more than 15 years. She lives with her husband and 2 children.
3. Oscar sells bread. He has been doing this for more than 4 years using his own vehicle. He lives with his wife and 2 children.

Choluteca, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy bread for his business.

loans.name: Soledad Del Valle   (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Soledad del Valle está formado por 5 socias y 2 socios, quien son personas trabajadoras, amables y de un corazón muy cálido, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ser independientes económicamente y ayudar a solventar los gastos de sus hogares. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad cuenta con una belleza arquitectónica y natural, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. La gastronomía de esta ciudad es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Zoila, tiene 34 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el extranjero ha migrado para darle un mejor futuro a su familia, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Zoila pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos ya que aun son pequeños, también se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica, tiene este negocio hace 2 años
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.

La foto pequeña es de un socio que por motivos del trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Soledad del Valle Community Bank comprises 5 female and 2 male members.  They are hard working, friendly and kind hearted people who work in diffferent activities, which allows them to be financially independent and to help pay the household bills.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, a city of natural and architectural beauty, which has been classified as a Cultural Heritage of Humanity site since December 1999.  The people of the city maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  The gastronomy is very varied, cultivating the palate of both locals and visitors.

Zoila is one of the members of the Community Bank.  She is 34, in a civil partnership and has two children aged 9 and 7, who study at a small school in the city.  Her partner works abroad; he has migrated in order to provide a better future for his family.  She doesn’t own her own home and so they rent. 
Zoila stays at home to look after their children, as they are still young.  She also breeds chickens and guinea pigs, which she sells as and when she needs the money.  She has had this business for 2 years.

She is going to use the new loan to buy chickens and chicken food.

Her goal is to own her own home.

The smaller photo is of a member of the group who, for work reasons, could not be present when the photo of the group was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken food

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es  una  persona  muy  emprendedora  que  a salido adelante  día  con día, ella  junto  con su  esposo se  dedican  al comercio,  actualmente  ella  tiene  un  negocio de  venta  de  ropa  el cual le  ha  permitido   sacar  adelante a  su   familia, en esta  ocasión se  acerco a la  institución  ya  que  desea  realizar   la compra  de  mercancía para  el   negocio  ya  que    se  preocupa   por   brindar  a  sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio  que  la  a caracterizado.
texts.en: Maribel is an enterprising person who is making progress, day by day.  She and her husband are both engaged in business.  Currently, she sells clothing, which has allowed her to get her family ahead.  She is approaching the institution because she wishes to purchase merchandise for her business.  She is concerned about offering her customers the excellent service that she is known for

loans.use: to purchase clothing for re-sale.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Ermelinda es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones Unidos”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, estado civil casada, con 02  hijos en estudio, la señora realizo estudio de educación secundaria.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de prendas de vestir.
En la actualidad requerirá de un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar 3 docenas de uniformes, camisetas, medias escolares, pantalón escolares, faldas, camisas, blusas, la mercadería lo compra de la localidad de Juliaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital para mejorar el negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el compartir con las socias, dialogar y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ermelinda is a member of the 'Corazones Unidos' community bank which is located in Desaguadero district, in Chucuito province, in Puno department.  She is 29 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.  Ermelinda completed her secondary education.

Ermelinda has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for 500 soles and she invested that money in her business selling clothing.  She currently needs a new loan for 2,000 soles which she will use to buy three dozen uniforms, t-shirts, school socks, school trousers, skirts, shirts and blouses.  She will buy her merchandise in the town of Juliaca.

Ermelinda's dream for the future is to have more capital so that she can improve her business.  What she most likes about her community bank is sharing and talking with her fellow members and the responsibility.

loans.use: to buy three dozen uniforms, t-shirts, school socks, skirts, shirts and blouses

loans.name: Juan Cancio

texts.es:
Juan nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 56 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, él tiene una tienda de ferretería y ya son cinco años que le va muy bien con el negocio. Juan en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo clavos, cemento, pintura, alambres y otras cosas más. 

Juan pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Juan agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Juan was born in the city of Lamay.  He is 56 years old, married, and has three children.  He has owned a hardware store for five years and his business is doing very well.  On this occasion, Juan needs a loan to buy merchandise such as nails, cement, paint, wires, etc.

Juan is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Virgen de Fátima de Lamay" community bank which is located in Calca province, in Cusco department, Peru.

Juan is grateful for this loan and appreciates it.  He pledges to make his monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as nails, cement, paint, wires, etc.

loans.name: Emprendedores De La Juan Antonio Ríos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Emprendedores de la Juan Antonio Ríos”, está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran almacenes de abarrotes, confección y costura, y otros vendiendo diferentes productos en ferias libres. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Bernarda, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila de pie, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, vistiendo una polera color negro, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto, quien además sostiene una carpeta de la institución en sus brazos.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la peluquería desde hace tres años. Presta sus servicios de peluquería a domicilio de lunes a domingo en horario flexible. Sus clientes son vecinos, conocidos y familiares.
Comenta que realizó un curso en una reconocida institución.
Su mercadería la compra en un centro comercial, especialistas en vender productos de belleza a bajo costo para comerciantes.
Con el crédito comprará máquinas para cortes de cabello de hombres.
Una de sus metas es aumentar su clientela, a través de la instalación de una peluquería en un local establecido. 
Bernarda vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 19, 12 y 1 año de edad. Sus sueños son brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que ha sido una gran ayuda para su negocio y por ende su familia. 
Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy responsable y que con las capacitaciones ha logrado conocer nuevas estrategias de inversión y contabilidad. Todo esto para llevar un buen negocio. 
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called "Emprendedores de la Juan Antonio Ríos" (Entrepreneurs of Juan Antonio Ríos), which consists of 19 members who engage in different trades such as grocery stores, sewing and dressmaking, and other retail businesses that involve selling various products at the open fairs. All of them are from the community of Independencia, which is located in the city of Santiago.

Bernarda is seen in the photo standing in the second row (first person going from right to left) and wearing a black t-shirt. Her hair is dark chestnut brown and she is wearing it down. Also, she is holding a Fondo Esperanza folder in her arms. Bernarda has operated a beauty salon for the past three years. She offers her services from her home Monday through Sunday and works on a flexible schedule. Her customers include neighbors, acquaintances, and relatives. She said that she completed a course at a recognized institution. Her merchandise is purchased at a shopping center that specializes in selling beauty products at low cost to retail customers. With this loan, she will buy machines used for men's haircuts. One of her goals is to expand her clientele so that she can open a salon in an established location.

Bernarda lives with her husband and three children (ages 19, 12, and 1). Her dreams are to provide her family a better quality of life. She is very pleased and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, which has been a great help to her business and for her family. Bernarda says that her Communal Bank group is very responsible and the training classes have taught her new investment strategies and accounting techniques. All of these tools will help her have a successful business.

Independencia is one of 34 communities that make up Santiago, the Chilean capital. It is located in the north-central section. In the 19th century, Independencia emerged as one of the more traditional sectors of the city. The main thoroughfare is Independencia Avenue, which served as the old Incan Road and the gateway to the north from the city of Santiago. Given the growing indigenous population, Independencia is known as the "Indigenous Cultural Center of Chile". It also has important historical sites, including six Chilean historical monuments.

loans.use: to buy clipping machines used for men's haircuts.

loans.name: Kristel Kimberli

texts.es:
Kristel es una joven muy entusiasta y trabajadora, ella vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus hermosas playas y sus exquisitos camarones; por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Chupe de Camarones”; es madre de un pequeño de 2 años al que ama muchísimo y es el motor de su vida, por ello ella trabaja muy duro para sacarlo adelante y para que sea mejor que ella; Kristel solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto año de secundaria  pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos; ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 12 horas diarias, le gusta su trabajo y por ello se levanta muy temprano para limpiar el lugar donde comen y viven los cerditos, asi como también alimentarlos; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que es muy amable con los clientes y cría a los animales de manera adecuada y por ello los clientes tienen confianza en lo que Kristel ofrece.

Kristel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá realizar una mejora en los corrales donde cría a los cerdos, así los animales tendrán un mejor espacio y podrá aumentar sus ingresos para seguir luchando cada día para cumplir su gran sueño.” Seguir creciendo en su negocio y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Kristel is an enthusiastic and hard-working young woman, who lives in the city of Camaná, which is characterized by its hot climate, beautiful beaches and delicious shrimp. One of her favorite dishes is the tasty, “Chupe de Camarones,” or the shrimp sucker. Kristel is the mother of a 2-year-old son, who is the joy of her life. She works hard to provide for him, and to give him a better life than she had. 

Kristel was only able to study through five years of secondary school, but she would have liked to study nursing. Through great effort, she has been able to start her own business raising and selling pigs, and she works at the business about 12 hours per day. She likes her work, and often gets up very early to clean the feeding areas for the pigs and then feed them. 

She believes that her business is going well because she is very kind to her customers, and since she treats her pigs well, her customers are confident in the quality of products she offers. Kristel is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support, as it will allow her to make improvements to the corrals where she keeps her pigs. This expansion will improve the space her pigs have, and will allow her to increase her income and continue working toward her dream of building her business and providing a good education for her son.

loans.use: to improve the corrals for her pigs.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo trabaja como conductor. Está estudiando la carrera de derecho y cursa el último año, solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios, él es el primer miembro de su familia que cursa la educación universitaria. Su mayor inspiración es su mamá ya que durante todo el tiempo le ha brindado su apoyo anto en lo económico como en lo moral. Espera que al finalizar su carrera pueda poner su propia oficina donde desarrollar los conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en: Jairo works as a driver.  He’s studying Law and is in the final year.  He’s asking for the loan to pay final course fees.  He’s the first member of his family to attend university.  His greatest inspiration is his mother who has given him both economic and emotional support all this time.  He hopes that once he completes his studies he will be able to open his office where he can put the knowledge he’s acquired to use.

loans.use: to pay professional degree fees.

loans.name: Beanka Jhoossuas

texts.es: Beanka está estudiando la carrera de derecho, solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera. Dentro de algunos años se ve trabajando en el Poder Judicial y con su título optará por un puesto mejor. Sus padres son su inspiración, porque vienen de una familia muy humilde y han podido salir adelante con sus esfuerzos. Su meta ha sido culminar su carrera, y está a un paso de poder lograrlo, agradece el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Beanka is studying law. She is requesting the loan to pay for her degree course. Within a few years, she sees herself working in the judiciary. With her degree, she would seek a better position.

Her parents are her inspiration because they come from very humble families and have been able to get ahead through their own efforts. Her goal is to finish her degree. She is one step from achieving this and is grateful for the support offered.

loans.use: to pay for her degree course.

loans.name: Blanca Esther

texts.es: Blanca trabaja como ejecutiva de ventas en una empresa de Chontales, y es así como paga los gastos de su educación. Está estudiando la carrera de Química en Farmacia y el crédito será usado para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios y gastos de título. Su meta es superarse tanto personal como profesionalmente, espera en un futuro tener su propio negocio y generar sus propios ingresos.
texts.en: Blanca works as a sales executive for a firm in Chontales and this is how she pays for her education.  She’s studying for a degree in Pharmaceutical Chemistry and the loan will be used to pay for her final course and graduation fees.  Her goal is to improve both personally and professionally.  She hopes in future to have her own business and generate her own income.

loans.use: to pay final course fees.

loans.name: Favio Alejandro

texts.es: Favio es casado. Está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en Administración, cursa el último año de su carrera y el préstamo será usado para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios de su carrera. Dentro de algunos años se mira como gerente de operaciones de una empresa capaz de dirigir una empresa, innovar nuevas ideas enfocado en la superación personal, familiar y laboral. Le inspira la necesidad de brindarle a su hijo lo que él no pudo tener, le inspira su fuerza de voluntad que no tiene límites.
texts.en:
Favio is married. He is studying for a degree in Business Administration. He is in the last year of his degree program, and the loan will be used to pay for the completion course he needs in order to finish his degree. 

Within a few years he sees himself as operations manager of a company; able to lead a company, and innovate with new ideas focused on personal, family, and work improvement.

What inspires him is the need to offer his son what he could not have, and his limitless will power.

loans.use: To pay for his degree completion course.

loans.name: Noel Ernesto

texts.es: Noel solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios de su carrera de Administración Turística y Hotelera, así mismo también cursará un Especialización en Pryectos de Marketing. Dentro de algunos años se ve dirigiendo una tour operadora, superarse y ser un profesional de prestigio. Le inpsira a hacer ésto su familia, para sacarla adelante e imitar a su padre que ha sido siempre un hombre trabajador. Este ha sido su mayor desafío y espera poder superarlo.
texts.en: Noel is asking for the loan to pay for the final course of study for his program in Hotel and Tourism Management. He will also take a specialization in Marketing Projects. Within a few years he has gone from directing a tour operation to bettering himself and being a professional of prestige. His family inspired him to do this in order to move them forward and to imitate his father, who has always been a hard-working man. This has been his greatest challenge, and he hopes to overcome it.

loans.use: to pay for degree expenses

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, esta casada, tiene tres hijos y vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en la ciudad de Langue, departamento de Valle, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Gloria tiene su negocio de venta de repollo, papa, yuca, zanahoria, elotes, camote, lechuga, patastes, tomates, queso fresco y queso seco. Doña Gloria tiene su negocio ubicado en el mercado municipal de Langue, frente a la estación de buses de la zona.
Doña Gloria solicita la cantidad de 8,000.00 lempiras para la compra de verduras para abastecer mas su negocio, de esta manera lograr mejores ingresos y que su negocio se fortalezca cada día mas.
Uno de sus principales sueños es poder comprar un vehículo para vender verdura en su carro ambulante, por diferentes aldeas, barrios y colonias del sector.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Gloria is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and their children in the city of Langue in the Valle department, which is in the southern part of Honduras.

Gloria has a business selling cabbage, potatoes, yucca, carrots, corn, sweet potatoes, lettuce, chayote squash, tomatoes, soft cheese and hard cheese.  Gloria’s business is located at the Langue municipal market in front of the bus station in the area.

Gloria is requesting a loan for 8,000 lempiras to buy vegetables to stock her business more.  This way she will get improved income, and her business will get stronger each day.

One of her main dreams is to be able to buy a vehicle to sell vegetables using her car.  She would sell in an itinerant manner in the different villages, neighborhoods, and settlements in the area.

loans.use: to buy yucca, potatoes, onions, cabbage, cheese, and soft cheese for her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 41 años de edad, ella tiene una relación libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ceviche y venta de productos de primera necesidad. Juana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite y para preparar ceviche necesita insumos como por ejemplo limón, sal, pescado y otros ingredientes. 

Juana pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Juana agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Juana was born in the city of Lamay.  She is 41 years old and lives with her partner and three children.  Her business is selling 'ceviche' (a marinated fish dish) and basic household products.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy basic household products such as rice, sugar and oil, as well as ingredients she needs for preparing her 'ceviche' such as lemon, salt, fish, etc.

Juana is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Virgen de Fátima de Lamay" community bank which is located in Calca province, in Cusco department, Peru.

Juana is grateful for her loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Oleg

texts.ru:
Олег с супругой и дочерью Викторией живет в селе Гладковка, Херсонской области. Олег занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в теплицах. Занимается этим он уже 6 лет. В хозяйство уже вложено 100 000 гривен. Чистая средняя прибыль составляет около 6 000 гривен в месяц. 

Олег планирует вложить кредит КИВА в размере 20 000 гривен в развитие своего фермерского хозяйства: он планирует закупить семена на 1 500 гривен, пленку на 6 500 гривен, удобрения на 5 000 гривен и дрова на 7 000 гривен. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Oleg, his wife and daughter Victoria live in the Gladkovka village, Kherson region.  Oleg is involved in growing early vegetables in greenhouses.  He has been in this business for six years.  He has 100,000 hryvnia invested into his business.  His net monthly profit is about 6,000 hryvnia.  Oleg plans to invest the 20,000 hryvnia Kiva loan into developing his farming business.  He plans to buy seeds with 1,500 hryvnia, plastic with 6,500 hryvnia, fertilizers with 5,000 hryvnia and wood with 7,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to buy seeds with 1,500 hryvnia, plastic with 6,500 hryvnia, fertilizers with 5,000 hryvnia and wood with 7,000 hryvnia

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru: В прошлый раз Наталья использовала кредит дял пополнения ассортимента товара. В этот раз Наталье нужен кредит для тех же целей - пополнить ассортимент весеннего товара. Наталья планирует получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить свои жилищные условия. Она живет в собственной квартире с мужем и взрослым сыном.
texts.en: Last time Nataliya used her loan to refill her clothing inventory. This time she is asking for a loan for the same purpose: to purchase seasonal spring clothes for resale at her market stall. Nataliya is planning to use the additional profits to improve her family's living conditions. She lives in her own apartment with her husband and son.

loans.use: to refill her inventory with spring weather clothes

loans.name: Homidjon

texts.ru: Хомиджон житель района Рудаки. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. Образование у него среднее. Хомиджон на сегодняшний день занимается изготовлением фарша. В этой области он три года. Кредит берет для приобретения электрической мясорубки.
texts.en: Homidjon lives in Rudaki region. He is 28 years old and married. Homidjon has a high school degree and for the last three years has been selling ground meat that he prepares himself. He needs to take out this loan to purchase a new electrical meat grinder.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical meat grinder

loans.name: Yuldash

texts.ru: Юлдаш проживает в районе Вахш. Ему 62 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Более четырех лет Юлдаш занимается животноводством. Он берет кредит для закупа мелко – рогатого скота с целью накопления денег для свадьбы сына.
texts.en: Yuldash lives in Vakhsh region. He is 62 years old, married and a father of four children. Yuldash has a high school degree and has been raising livestock for four years. He is taking out this loan to purchase more sheep for his herd in order to save money for his son's upcoming wedding.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Humbetali

texts.ru: Хумбетали житель района Вахш. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него 8 детей. Его сын работает в Российской Федерации. Сам он имеет средне – специальное образование, водитель. В этой области он уже пятнадцать лет. Также Хумбетали занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Humbetali lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 56 years old, married and a father of eight children. His son is a migrant worker in Russia. Humbetali has a professional degree as a driver and has been working as a driver for more then fifteen years. For the last ten years Humbetali has also been raising cattle for sale. He is taking out a loan to buy another cow for his herd.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, trabaja en el área de la carpintería junto a su esposo y sus hijos ya que tienen su taller propio.
El crédito lo necesitan para  pagar los estudios de su hijo mayor que es postulante para ingresar a un centro de artesanía, de tal manera que pueda perfeccionar y ayudar  a mantener a la familia.
Juana, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la zona Bautista Saavedra en la ciudad de El Alto.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juana works in carpentry alongside her husband and children since they own their own shop.  They need the loan to pay their oldest son's educational costs since he's been accepted to enroll in a crafts center so that he can specialize and help support the family.

Juana is married and has two children she lives with in the city of El Alto's Bautista Saavedra zone.

This is the first time she's worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay her oldest son's education costs at a crafts center.

loans.name: 20 De Enero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “20 DE ENERO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Miguelina Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de fruta, venta de tripitas de res, peluquería, tejido de prendas de bebe, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, elaboración de zapatos de cholita.

La señora Miguelina, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace tres años y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de zapatos, que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su tía. El crédito de este ciclo es para la ampliar su negocio (compra de zapatos) ente producto lo adquiere de los productores, al por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializara en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Association "20 de Enero" (20th of January) will begin its 3rd loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Communal Bank Senkata. It’s made up of 9 members and a group of directors, of which, Miguelina is the head. The members of our community have various businesses and lines of work like fruit sales, tripe sales, hair salon, woven baby clothes sales, vegetable sales, corner store, shoe sales. 

Miguelina indicates that she’s been a member of this association for more than 3 years and she has a shoe sales business that she’s owned for 3 years, learning the ins and outs from her aunt. The loan for this cycle is to expand her business (buy shoes). She buys the shoes wholesale from the manufacturers and then she sells them at the fairs. This line of work helps her support her family as she is a widow with 3 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health training and loans.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана замужем. Ее супруга зовут Александр. У них двое детей.  Светлана имеет собственный бизнес.

Светлана раньше была наемным  работником, но спустя некоторое время решила начать собственное дело. Сейчас она торгует детской одеждой на центральном рынке города.  У Светланы уже есть свой сотрудник.  Светлана очень ответственная и трудолюбивая, так как это основной доход ее семьи.  В данное время Светлана с мужем и двумя детьми проживает в общежитие, в одной комнате.

Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20000 гривен на оплату аренды за 2012 год и на закупку весеннего ассортимента детской одежды. Кредит поможет ей увеличить доход. Эти деньги она хочет потратить на ремонт в новокупленном доме и переехать.
texts.en: Svetlana is married.  Her husband's name is Aleksandr.  They have two children.  Svetlana has her own business.  Previously, she worked as a hired employee, but, after some time, decided to start her own business.  Currently, she sells children's clothing at the city's central market.  Svetlana already has a co-worker.  Svetlana is very responsible and hardworking because this business is the primary source of income for her family.  At the present time, Svetlana, her husband and their two children live in one room in a hostel.  Svetlana is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia to pay for lease for the year 2012 and purchase a spring selection of children's clothing.  The loan will help her to increase her income.  She wants to spend this money to make repairs in her newly-purchased home and move.

loans.use: to pay her store lease and buy merchandise

loans.name: Begmurod

texts.ru: Бегмурод уже 7 лет занимается животноводством. Он 12 лет проработал бригадиром в дехканском хозяйстве. Ему 50 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Бегмурод берет кредит для закупа двух телят.
texts.en: Begmurod is 50 years old, married and has six children. For twelve years he has worked as a manger for the farming co-op. Begmurod has also been raising cattle for seven years. He is requesting this loan to purchase two calves.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат проживает в районе Бохтар. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее сын уехал на заработки в Россию. Сама она более семнадцати лет работает в колхозе. Кроме того она у себя дома разводит мелко – рогатый скот. Кредит берет для закупа овец.
texts.en: Sabohat lives in Bohtar region. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. Her son is a migrant worked in Russia. Sabohat herself has worked for the farming co-op for seventeen years. She also raises sheep and goats at home. Sabohat is taking out this loan to buy more sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Oliya

texts.ru: Олия жительница района Вахш. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Сама она имеет средне – специальное образование, медсестра. По специальности Олия проработала 10 лет. Сейчас она занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Кредит берет для приобретения небольшого холодильника и покупки продуктов.
texts.en: Oliya is a resident of Vakhsh region. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. Oliya has a professional degree as a nurse and has worked as a nurse for ten years. Currently Oliya manages a grocery store. She is taking out this loan to purchase a small refrigerator and additional groceries for sale at her store.

loans.use: to purchase a small refrigerator and additional groceries for sale

loans.name: Rajabmo

texts.ru: Рачабмо проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 31 год. У нее трое детей. Рачабмо более двух лет занимается торговлей. Она берет кредит для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Rajabmo lives in the Vakhsh region. She is 31 years old, and has three children. Rajabmo has been selling fruit for two years. She is taking out this loan to purchase another batch of fruit for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, es un joven muy entusiasta y empeñosa, de 26 años de edad; vive en su propia casa junto a su amado Rogelio de 32 años y su pequeña hija Yeradis de 03 años a quien le brindan mucho amor. Nancy, es una mujer de lucro, siempre esta al pendiente de su esposo y de su hija, ella se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de plantas de cacao; producción que le llevo 05 años a tener mucha experiencia y de la cual hoy se siente muy orgullosa por obtener lo que siempre ah deseado. Normalmente ella, labora junto a su esposo el desmonte de su cultivo pero en los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros; quienes le ayudan a extraer de manera rápida los frutos de cacao; para luego llevarlas a vender a los centros de acopio de su localidad. Con el tiempo desea en sembrar mas plantas de cacao para hacer crecer su producción. Pero ahora su prioridad es realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, para poder tener gran obtención en su próxima cosecha. Este es su crédito numero 01 con MFP; y se siente contenta por el apoyo que le brindan; por otra parte se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo, es agradecida a su banco comunal por elegirla como miembro de su junta directiva. Con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar fertilizantes naturales y abono para mantener fuertes a sus siembras.
texts.en:
Nancy is an enthusiastic and industrious young woman. She is 26 years of age and lives in her own home with her beloved Rogelio, age 32, and her young daughter Yeradis, age 3, who she loves very much. Nancy is a woman who looks to profit since she always tries to support her husband and daughter. She plants and grows cacao. Nancy has been producing this crops for five years and has plenty of experience. Today she is very proud to have obtained what she always wanted. Normally she works with her husband dismantling their crop, but during the harvest season they have the help of workers who can quickly extract the cacao beans so that they can sold at the local collection center. Over time, she wants to grow more cacao plants so that she can increase her production. For now, her priority is to maintain her crops so that she can have good results for her next harvest.

This will be her first loan with MFP. Nancy is pleased with the support that has been given to her and promises to be punctual with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to her Communal bank for electing her to become a board member. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy natural fertilizers and compost for maintaining her crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers and sacks of compost.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 41 years old, and married with two children. She sells water to earn a living, and she has been in the business for one year. She describes her business environment as good because she has many customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy two water tanks.

loans.use: to buy two water tanks.

loans.name: Phelomena

texts.en:
Phelomena is a business lady who sells bags and clothes.  She has been in the business for eight years.  She also farms crops for extra income.  With the income from her business, she is able to raise her two-year-old child.  

She has requested for a loan of 12,900 to buy a solar lamp so as to light her house.

Phelomena says that she has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya, because she has learned business and management skills.  She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp so as to light her house.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 42 years old and a mother of four. For three years she has been gathering and selling old cartons and wrapping papers for recycling.  This business has helped her in providing for her family.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business. She desires to open other outlets of her business.  She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy used cartons.

loans.use: To buy used cartons.

loans.name: Duo Sumpango Group

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria de 51 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de productos basicos de forma ambulante,desde hace 7 años no cuenta que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en productos de basicos de consumo diario,ya que es una forma de generar mas capital y ayudar a su familia,ella luse muy contenta porque sabe que con esta ayuda que le puedan dar, podra agrandar mas su negocio y tener mas bariedad,la siguiente socia se dedica a la misma venta.
texts.en: Ana Maria is 51 years old and works selling basic products as an itinerant street vendor.  She has been in this business for seven years.  She tells us that she is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise.  She will buy household staples as this is a way of making more money and helping her family.  She is very happy because she knows that, as a result of this help, she will be able to further expand her business and offer her customers more variety.  The other member of this group is in the same business.

loans.use: to buy basic products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito Group

texts.en:
The town of Patzun is located in southwest Guatemala. While it is a fairly quiet community, the town has a variety of bustling commerce activities. In the West Village of Patzun, the Trust Bank Mujeres de Éxito (Successful Women) was formed four years ago and currently has nine determined women in the group, all of whom identify with the name of the Trust Bank. The vast majority of women in this group are engaged in hand weaving, selling screws and selling fruits and vegetables. They are all neighbors and know each other well.  

Maria Magdalena is a member of the Mujeres de Éxito Trust Bank. She is 50 years old, married, and has eight children (four of them still live at home). Thanks to Maria and her husband’s hard work, all of her children were in school until the heavy rains hit Guatemala last year and her oldest child, who was in college, had to drop out. Maria Magdalena only has three years of education, because her family couldn’t support her schooling anymore. Maria learned to make huipiles (traditional blouses) when she was a child, and over time she learned the styles from other places. She now makes different styles of huipiles from different areas. She also learned how to make chocolate (a product that originated in Quetzaltenango, Guatemala, where she is originally from). Maria Magdalena travels to Antigua, Guatemala (two hours away from home), Monday through Saturday and sells her products from 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. She also sells her products in Patzun on Sundays.

With her new loan, Maria Magdalena will buy fabric and thread to make huipiles. She will also use the materials to make aprons since her orders are on the rise because the Easter season is fast approaching. She will also use her loan to buy more ingredients to make chocolates so that she can keep up with demand (she has many orders for chocolates as well). One of Maria Magdalena’s goals is to grow her businesses and have her children help manage the businesses with her. She also wants to help her child, who had to drop out of college, go back to school. 

She is very happy and grateful to Friendship Bridge for the opportunity to have been a client for the past four years, which has allowed her to invest in her business. Likewise, the Trust Bank that she belongs to feels so grateful to the KIVA lenders because even though they do not know the lenders, they rely on their support.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread to make huipiles and aprons.

loans.name: Mijgona
