texts.ru: Мичгона жительница города Вахдат. Ей 23 года. Она занимается торговлей продуктов питания и парфюмерии. В этой области она два года. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Mijgona lives in Vahdat region. She is 23 years old. She has been selling groceries and cosmetics for two years. Mijgona is taking out this loan to purchase fruit for sale at her store.

loans.use: to buy fruit for sale

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Рахматулло проживает в городе Дангара. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он более трех лет занимается торговлей. Рахматулло имеет небольшой продуктовый магазин. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания.
texts.en: Rahmatullo lives in Dangara. He is 52 years old, married and has five children. Rahmatullo own a small grocery store which he has been managing for three years. He is taking out this loan to purchase groceries for sale in his store.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his store

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Luis tiene 58 años, el es viudo con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 21-14-12 y 10 años, el se dedica  a la fabricación  de guinches y mezcladoras su taller  se  encuentra en la zona de  Pasankeri,  Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Luis utilizara  este préstamo para la compra motor para guinche y materiales para su negocio, ya que esto le permitirá realizar un mejor trabajo, Luis  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son Incrementar la venta de guinches y mezcladoras para así generar mas ingresos  que seguirá invirtiendo en mejorar su taller, el Sr. Luis es una persona muy amable se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad con la que me mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis is 58 years old and a widower with four children (ages 21, 14, 12, and 10).  He manufactures winches and cement mixers in a workshop in the District of Pasankeri.  This loan is his first with Emprender.  Luis will use this loan to buy a motor for a winch and materials for his business.  This will help him do a better job.  
Luis faces challenges in his business, but he has been able to increase his sales of winches and cement mixers so that he can generate more income to invest in improvements to his workshop.  

Sr. Luis is a friendly person who feels grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided since his business is the only means for him to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a winch motor and materials.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia de 51 años, convive con Víctor con quien tiene 4 hijos. Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia en el anexo de Tiambra, distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma. Celia se dedica a la agricultura. Cuenta con varias parcelas de terrenos distribuidas en varios cerros de su distrito. Siembra papa, arvejas.
“Al año siembro 2 bolsas de arvejas, 2 veces al año”, dice. Además la producción de papas también es rentable, pero debe de invertir mucho para adquirir buenos frutos. Enero, febrero y marzo, son meses donde las papas tienen mayor demanda. A su distrito llegan compradores de otras ciudades. Celia agiliza sus ventas así, de lo contrarió traslada su cosecha hasta la ciudad de Tarma. Le va bien.
Hace 30 años que trabaja la tierra, de la mano de su esposo; y como sus hijos también son mayores, apoyan activamente. La actividad agrícola es muy sacrificada. Las lluvias y la inaccesibilidad de sus tierras hacen difícil sus labores, pero eso no es obstáculo para cuidar sus papas y arvejas. Celia es una mujer con coraje. Este sería su crédito número 12 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Santa Rosa de Tiambra”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que siente identificación por tener como socios a personas responsables. De obtener el dinero podrá comprar 20 bolsas de abonos orgánicos de 120 soles cada una para la papas que aún tiene cultivadas y otro porcentaje para fertilizar un sembrío de arvejas  que recién sembrará.
texts.en:
Celia, aged 51, lives with Victor, with whom she has four children. She and her family live in their own house in the neighborhood of Tiambra, located in the district of Huasahuasi in the province of Tarma. Celia is a farmer and owns a few fields scattered throughout several hills of the district. Celia grows potatoes and peas. "Each year I sow two bags of peas, twice a year," she says. Although potato production is profitable, she has to invest a lot to get a good crop. January, February and March are the months with the highest demand for potatoes. Merchants from other cities travel to her district and buy a sizeable proportion of her crop. What is left over will be transported by her to the city of Tarma. She does well in her business.

Celia has been working in the fields for thirty years, actively helped by her husband and her children, who are grown up by now. Farming is an activity that demands sacrifices. The rain and the inaccessibility of her lands make her work difficult, but this does not prevent her from looking after her potatoes and peas. Celia is a courageous woman.

This will be her twelfth loan from the microfinance institution Microfinanzas Prisma. She promises to be punctual in paying the monthly installments. "Santa Rosa de Tiambra" is the name of her communal bank, with which she identifies because it is made up of responsible people. She will use her loan to buy 20 bags of organic fertilizer at 120 new soles each to fertilize the potatoes that are currently growing, on one hand, and to fertilize a field that she is about to sow with peas, on the other hand.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma de 43 años convive con Oscar con quien tiene 3 hijos: Sheila de 23, Miguel de 20 y Jordi de 17 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Palca- Tarma. Norma es agricultora. Su carácter fuerte y constante le ayudan a afrontar lo agotador que puede se esta actividad. Ella siembra papas, arvejas y flores de gladiolos. “Siembro de todo, pero prefiero las arvejas y gladiolos, porque el precio es favorable”, dice. Cada vez que cosecha vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Ella siembra gladiolos con más frecuencia, ya que requiere de poco abono y se cosecha en 4 meses. Afirma que las ventas en mayo son mejores porque llega a costar a 80 soles el paquete, ya que normalmente cuesta a 60 soles.
Norma está contenta con su trabajo, porque ahí puede desplegar todo sus conocimientos y tiempo.
Espera continuar con esta labor, hasta tener ahorros suficientes para adquirir mejores condiciones de vida. Éste sería su crédito número 5 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los Cantaritos”, es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente satisfecha de trabajar con personas empeñosas y responsables. Con el dinero logrará adquirir 10 bolsas de abonos para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de arvejas y gladiolos.
texts.en:
Norma, age 43, is in a common-law marriage with Oscar.  They have three children, 23 year old Sheila, 20 year old Miguel, and 17 year old Jordi.  They live in their own house in the Palca – Tarma district.

Norma is a farmer.  Her strength of character and her perseverance help her contend with how exhausting this work can be.  She grows potatoes, peas, and gladiola flowers.  “I grow everything, but I prefer peas and gladiolas because they have a favorable price.”  

Each time that she harvests she sells her products at the wholesale market in Tarma.  She grows gladiolas more frequently because they require little fertilizer and are harvested in four months.  She asserts that sales in May are better because the cost of a packet is 80 soles, and the normal price is 60 soles.

Norma is happy with her work.  That is where she is able to use all of her knowledge and time.  She hopes to continue with this work until she has enough savings to acquire better living conditions.

This will be her 5th loan with MFP.  She pledges to be punctual with her monthly payments.  Los Cantaritos is the name of her communal bank.  She is happy to work with diligent and responsible people.  She will use the loan to buy ten bags of fertilizer to spread on her pea and gladiola crops.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is married and has three children. She has a general store and works hard to support her children.

Viola is requesting a 3500 loan PHP through NWTF to purchase a solar light. She knows that by using this light she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

Viola is getting the light so she can extend her business hours after nightfall.

loans.use: To purchase a solar-operated light for her store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her three children.  She is married and has a fishpond business in the Philippines.

Evangeline has requested a loan in the amount of 10,542 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase a solar lamp.  She is purchasing the solar lamp because she wants to use it in her fishpond.  Evangeline is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support 4 children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a loan of 1,800 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide light for her children when they are studying their lessons.

Rosemarie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nélida, de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Ocoro – Colcabamba. Se caracteriza por tener un semblante fuerte, ello lo demuestra en su trabajo, pues como buena mujer dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo en la agricultura. Oficio que aprendió desde muy pequeña, y que en la actualidad aprovecha para poder generar ingresos para su familia. Todavía no tiene una pareja ni hijos, eso no le molesta, “estar al lado de mis hermanos y padres me hace sentir feliz”, comenta. Sus principales sembríos constan de maíz y papa. Lo que comercializa a la ciudad de Huancayo y en campaña grande a la capital del país. Como toda mujer entusiasta, ahora desea incrementar sus ganancias y además está ahorrando dinero para poder comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, ya que no cuenta con unos propios. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Virgen candelaria” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Nelida de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en su próximo sembrío de papa.
texts.en:
Nélida is 34 and is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her parents and siblings in their own home located in Ocoro, Colcabamba.  She is characterized by having a strong expression, which she shows in her work.  As a good woman, she dedicates her time and effort to agriculture.  This is a trade she learned when she was very young.  Currently she makes the most of it by being able to generate income for her family.  She does not yet have a husband or children, but this doesn't bother her.  She says, "being by the side of my siblings and parents makes me feel happy."  Her main crops are corn and potatoes.  She sells them in the city of Huancayo and in the capital of the country during the main growing season.

Like every enthusiastic woman, she hopes to increase her profits and save money to buy her own land, since she doesn't have her own right now.  She belongs to the communal bank, "Virgen Candelaria."  This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, where she feels accomplished and happy.  She hopes to obtain this loan to continue with her goals.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  She is a responsible and supportive person.  Upon receiving her loan, Nélida will invest the requested money in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spread on her next potato planting.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela de 37 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Ocoro – Colcabamba. Adela es una mujer independiente, pues cuida de sus hijos, sola. Su principal esfuerzo se ven recompensado por el  cultivo de productos de primera necesidad como, maíz y papa. Los cuales siembra con mucha dedicación ya que ella constantemente limpia la maleza que crece entre los surcos. Por otro lado le molesta la s plagas que llegan a sus cultivos producto del frío del lugar. Cuenta además que gracias a la buena intervención de sus sembríos puede contrarrestar los problemas causados por estas peligrosas bacterias. Gracias a ello obtiene buenas ganancias en la cosecha de sus sembríos. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus alimentos para poder recibir un precio más justo a sus sembríos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Virgen candelaria” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Adela de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus sembríos de maíz que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en: Adela is 37 and is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her children for whom she cares in her own home, which is located in Ocoro, Colcabamba.  Adela is an independent woman.  She cares for her children alone.  She grows basic crops like corn and potatoes.  She grows them with a lot of dedication, and she is constantly cleaning out the weeds that grow between the rows.  On the other hand, there are pests on her crops because of the colder climate that bother them.  She tells us that thanks to her good intervention with her crops, she can counteract the problems caused by these dangerous bacteria.  Thanks to this, she obtains good profits when she harvests her crops.  Now she hopes to improve the quality of her plant food so she can receive a fairer price for her crops.  She belongs to the community bank, "Virgen Candelaria," and this is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, where she feels accomplished and happy.  She hopes to obtain another loan to continue with her goals.  She also promises to be punctual with her payments.  She is a responsible and supportive person.  Upon receiving her loan, Adela will invest the requested money in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spread on her corn crop, which she will harvest very soon.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es: Avelino, de 41 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ocoro - Colcabamba. Durante la mañana, desde muy temprano. Avelino se dedica al cultivo de diversos productos agrícolas como maíz y papa, que son su principal sustento económico. Gusta de cultivar y mantener los surcos de sus sembríos alineados y en buen estado de esa manera, asegura una buena cosecha, con productos de primera calidad. Además de ser una de las personas más carismáticas y en la negociación de sus cultivos constantemente recibe buenas utilidades, por ese poder de negociación. Además cuenta que desea mejorar sus ganancias para poder comprar nuevos terrenos agrícolas. Sabe que lo conseguirá pues tiene la convicción de mejorar sus sembríos y de trabajar sin cansancio. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Virgen candelaria” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Avelino de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Avelino, 41, is a responsible man who lives with his wife and children in their own house in Ocoro-Colcabamba.  Very early in the morning Avelino starts working with his crops of different plants such as corn and potatoes because they are the main economic support for his family.  He likes keeping the furrows aligned and in this way he is assured of a good harvest with top quality vegetables.  Hhas a charismatic personality and constantly receives good prices because he is able to negotiate well.  He wants to increase his earnings so he can buy new fields.  He knows that he will succeed because he is sure he can improve his crops and he works tirelessly. 
He belongs to the communal banking group “Virgen Candelaria” and this is his third loan with MFP.  He feels supported and happy since he hopes to get the loan to continue with his goals.  He also promises to be prompt with his payments.  
Since Avelino is a responsible and helpful person, he will use the support of the requested loan to buy natural fertilizer to spread among his corn plants.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 36 años y es casada tiene 3 hijos, ella junto a su esposo tienen un taller de Chapería que se encuentran en un zona muy estratégica de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Juana utilizara este préstamo para compra de herramientas y materiales para su Chapería, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es que tiene mucha demanda de su servicio ya que ellos son muy conocidos por el buen  trabajo que realiza, La Sra. enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia Juana va utilizar los beneficio del crédito en compra de electrodomésticos para su casa y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia y por ende  mejorando su calidad de vida, la Sra. Juana se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. En la Foto la Sra. Juana se encuentra en compañía de su esposo.
texts.en:
Juana, 36, is married and has three children.  She and her husband have an auto body repair shop in a very strategic area in the city of Cochabamba.

This loan is her second cycle with the institution.  Juana will use this loan to buy tools and materials for her auto body repair shop.  The reason for requesting this loan is that she has a lot of demand for her services because they are very well known for the good work they do.

The challenge she faces in her business is competition.  Juana is going to use the profits from the loan to buy electrical appliances for her house and so give her family greater comfort, consequently improving their quality of life.  Juana is happy with and grateful to the institution for the support given.

In the photo Juana is seen with her husband.

loans.use: to buy tools for her auto body repair shop.

loans.name: Matilde De Jesus

texts.es: Matilde, originario de la comarca El Coyolito, Jinotega nos expresa lo que represento para el su primer préstamo KIVA, que utilizo para compra de insumos , abono, pago de mano de obra , gasolina para su motor de riego todo esto contribuyo a sacar adelante su siembra de repollo. La cual noto que deja buenos ingresos sise sabe administrar y conseguir un precio justo por su cultivo. Por lo cual está solicitando de nuevo este crédito para volver a comprar insumos, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra, gasolina para sembrar un área mas de repollo. El desea seguir trabajando en su negocio para salir adelante y llegar aumentar sus terrenos de siembra.
texts.en: Matilde was born in was born in Coyolito county in La Concordia, a municipality of Jinotega.  He states that he used the first Kiva loan for supplies, fertilizer, labor payments, and gasoline for his irrigation motor, which all contributed to a successful cabbage planting.  He notes that he earns good income, has good management skills, and gets a fair price for his crops.  He is requesting a loan again for supplies, fertilizer, labor payments, and gasoline in order to plant cabbage in another area.  He wishes to continue working in his business in order to get ahead and increase his land for planting.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase supplies, fertilizer, and gasoline in order to plant cabbage in another area.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 24 años de edad, ella tiene una relación libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo platería y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio. Karina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como plata piña. 

Karina pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Karina agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Karina was born in the city of Lamay.  She is 24 years old and lives with her partner and son.  Her business is selling silverwork.  She has a small workshop in her home.  On this occasion, Karina needs a loan to buy materials such as raw silver.

Karina is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” community bank which is located in Calca province, in Cusco department, Peru.

Karina is grateful for this loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials such as raw silver

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old, married, and has nine children, two of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for her family.  Virginia runs a flower selling business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years.

Virginia is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will to purchase more stocks of flowers to sell.  In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase flowers to sell.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora Lidia actualmente viven por la zona 26 de septiembre, la casa esta en alquiler, su cónyuge es chofer de un taxi. La solicitante vende huevos con chuño y fideo en uno de los mercados muy concurridos de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, la clienta sale a vender desde las 6 de la mañana y hasta las 10 de la mañana ya no tiene comida para vender a esta hora lo vende todo. Esta actividad la viene desarrollando más de dos años de antigüedad, teniendo buenos ingresos. La solicitante como vive en alquiler, esta solicitando el crédito con la institución para tomar dos cuartos en anticrético este contrato consiste en entregar una suma de dinero al dueño por un año y pasado el año el dueño devuelve la misma suma de dinero, y es como si viviera con el pago del interes del dinero, en si es como un prstamo de dinero. La clienta agradeció a la institución por la oportunidad brindada y al mismo tiempo agradeció por la rapidez que se la atendió.
texts.en: Lidia currently lives in the area known as  September 26. She currently rents her house.  Her husband is a taxi driver. The applicant sells eggs with potato flour and noodles in a crowded market in the city of Santa Cruz. She goes out and starts selling her food from 6 am until 10 am. By then, she has no more food to sell. She sells everything.  She has been doing this type of activity for more than two years and generating good income from it. Since she is currently renting, Lidia would like to get this loan with  this institution since she would like to create a land pawn contract (known as anticrético) for two rooms. This contract consists of giving a certain quantity of money to the owner for a year, and the following year the owner returns the same amount of money. The owner lives off of the interest of the money; in this way it functions almost like a loan to the owner. The customer thanked the institution for the opportunity and at the same time appreciated  how fast she was offered help.

loans.use: To get a land pawn contract known as Anticretico

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support five children. She is married and has a transportation business in the Philippines.

Leonila requested a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a trisikad transportation vehicle (a tricycle). She is seeking the trisikad because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from motorized vehicles' continued pollution. Leonila feels that, by using the trisikad, she will not only save money but will also help the environment and reduce health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her trisikad business.

loans.name: Lourdes Yosit

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones Unidos”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.  La señora realizó estudios de educación superior técnica.
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicita un préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de víveres para su restaurante como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, menestras y otros productos para el negocio.
Su sueño para el futuro es crecer más en el negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the 'Corazones Unidos' community bank which is located in Desaguadero district, in Chucuito province, in Puno department.  She is 31 years old, single, and has one child.  She completed her higher education at a tech school.

Lourdes is a new member who recently started working with Manuela Ramos.  She is requesting a loan for 500 soles to invest in buying food products for her restaurant such as rice, sugar, noodles, mixed vegetables, etc.

Lourdes' dream for the future is to further grow her business.  What she most likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining loans.

loans.use: to buy food products for her restaurant such as rice, sugar, noodles, mixed vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 38 years old, married, and has six children. With five children in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Alma has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, soap, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old, married, and has six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, coffee, sardines, etc. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Gulnor

texts.ru: Гулнор 42 года, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Супруг Гулнор находится в России на заработках.  Раньше она торговала детской одеждой китайского производства в одной небольшой торговой точке. В настоящее время имеет две торговые точки в одной из которых торгует в основном  детской одеждой турецкого производства. За время кредитования в нашей организации активы Гулнор увеличились в несколько раз. Гулнор намерена увеличить ассортимент готовой продукции с целью получения достаточной прибыли для того, чтобы супруг больше не выезжал за пределы Таджикистана на заработки. По приезде супруга она планирует задействовать его в торговле.
texts.en: Gulnor is 42 years old, married and the mother of four. Her husband temporarily works in Russia. Gulnar used to have just one stall, where she sold children's clothing imported from China. Now she has two stalls, and uses one of them to sell mostly children's clothing imported from Turkey.  In the time since Gulnar started taking out loans from our organization, her working capital more than doubled. Gulnor plans to expand her stock of ready-to-wear products in order to receive sufficient revenues so that her husband would no longer  need to leave Tajikistan in search of work. After her husband comes back, Gulnar expects him to get involved in the business as well.

loans.use: to buy  an assortment of children clothes for spring.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  ubicado en el distrito Paucarcolla, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 5 hijos independientes.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.

Su primer préstamo de Movimiento Manuela Ramos fue por la suma de  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de animales, también tiene una tienda de abarrotes.

En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1,200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizara para comprar detergentes, aceites, gaseosas, huevo, fideos, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, para su tienda la mercadería lo compra de la ciudad de Puno y Juliaca, trabaja sola, su esposo se dedica con los animales.

Su sueño para el futuro  es seguir con el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es  la facilidad del préstamo, el ahorro y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of Santiago Apóstol Communal Bank, located in the district of Paucarcolla, in the province and department of Puno.  She is 48 years old and married, and has five financially independent children.  She does not have an education.

Her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for the sum of 300 nuevos soles (PEN), money she invested in her business selling animals.  She also has a grocery store.

Currently she will request a new loan of 1,200 PEN, money she will use to buy detergent, oil, soda, eggs, noodles, rice, sugar, and candy for her store.  She will buy the merchandise in Puno and Juliaca.

She works alone and her husband works with the animals.  Her dream for the future is to continue with the business.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the ease of the loan, the savings, and her profits.

loans.use: to buy detergent, oil, soda, eggs, noodles, rice, sugar, and candy.

loans.name: Mylina

texts.en:
Mylina is 60 years old, married, and has two children.

Mylina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Mylina has borrowed and paid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Mylina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 58 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, cream, coffee, canned goods, egg, spices, etc. 

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sheila Marie

texts.en:
Sheila Marie is 42 years old, married, and has two children. With both children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Sheila Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, noodles, and other groceries. 

Sheila Marie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing net making business in the Philippines.

Socorro requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more nylon for making fishing nets. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Socorro would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more nylon for making fishing nets.

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en:
Chhom is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites. Chhom and her husband have been involved in agriculture for over twenty years.  They have extensive experience and are successful in their careers. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. They earn approximately US $5 per day. Chhom's two children are construction workers. They earn about US $8 per day. 

Due to her family’s transportation expenses, Chhom is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money she saves on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland for growing rice to generate more income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai, 46, is widowed and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites. 

She has been running a food store for over six years, earning approximately USD 30 per day. One of her children is a construction worker and earns about USD 3 per day. In order to improve her business, Hai is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more food ingredients to produce all kinds of food to sell. By doing so, she would generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child get a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients to produce all kinds of food to sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат проживает в городе Душанбе. Ей 25 лет. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Образование у нее высшее. По профессии она экономист. В этой области Шарофат проработала год. На сегодняшний день она занимается торговлей женской одежды и пастельного белья. Этим видом деятельности она занимается два года. Кредит берет для покупки женского нижнего белья.
texts.en: Sharofat lives in Dushanbe.  She is 25 years old.  She is married.  She lives with her parents.  She has a college education.  She is an economist by profession.  She worked in this sphere for a year.  Today she sells women's clothing and lingerie.  She has been in this business for two years.  She is taking out a loan for the purchase of women's lingerie.

loans.use: to purchase women's lingerie

loans.name: Fabio Benito Mercados Hernandez

texts.es: Fabio de 30 años de edad, emprendedor y con iniciativa propia, ya que luego de formar parte de una empresa de telefonia celular de nuestro pais, nace la idea de crear su pequeño negocio, es por ello que desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la venta de telefonos celulares y accesorios, gozando de su propio local en nuestra capital Managua, local mismo que lo ha podido sostener mediante esfuerzos y los financiamientos prestados por Afodenic. Este nuevo credito lo ocupara para realizar las compras de telefonos celulares,accesorios,manos libre, memorias micro,carcasas,protectores,cables usb entre otros articulos y de esta manera engrandecer su negocio con nuevos productos de mercado y estar dentro de la competencia comercial.
texts.en:
Fabio is 30 years old and he is a hard worker with his own initiative.  After working for a mobile phone business in our country, he came up with the idea of creating his own small business.  This is why for the last four years he has made a living from the sale of mobile phones and accessories, enjoying his own shop in our capital Managua, which he has been able to sustain through his hard work and loans from Afodenic.

This new loan will help him buy mobile phones, accessories, hands-free headsets, micro memory cards, cases, protectors, USB cables, among other products. This way he can grow his business with new products and be able to compete in this market.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say is a 54-year-old married mother of two children.  Both her children are employed, working in construction.

Say has spent most of her life working in rice husbandry in Kompong Cham province. She works in this type of business along with her husband. Together, they generate in the neighborhood of US $10 per day to provide economic stability for their family.

Now she is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her two sons to travel to their workplaces. She aspires to raise her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her two sons to travel to their workplaces.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has one infant child. In her married life, Grace has allowed herself to discover her capability to raise domestic animals, particularly pigs, making this a central source of income for the family. Every month, she makes about PHP 3,000. 

Earlier this year, Grace joined GDMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 from the Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative to purchase pig food for nourishment for fast growth. Grace hopes for prosperous years of business undertakings. She plans to buy more piglets to grow and eventually sell to make good cash inflow.

loans.use: to buy feed and another little piglet to raise.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the  agricultural business for over 10 years, growing rice and fattening up cattle.  They have extensive experience and are successful in their careers. They earn approximately $7 per day. 

In order improve her family’s economy, Sophea is requesting a loan for $1,250, which she will use to purchase more farmland for growing crops in order to generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business, build a concrete house, and help her children earn  bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more farmland.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Мавлуда занимается торговлей на рынке и у себя дома. В основном она продает детскую одежду и ткани. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации. Она берет кредит для покупки новых видов тканей и хозяйственных товаров.
texts.en: Mavluda lives in Isfara.  She is 43 years old.  She is married.  She has three children.  Mavluda trades at the market and from her home.  Mostly she sells children's clothing and fabrics.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation.  She is taking out a loan to purchase new types of fabric and household goods.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabric and household goods

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фируз десять лет как занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров и сервизов. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. Фируз имеет среднее образование. Он берет кредит для приобретения фужеров, наборов чашек и сервиза.
texts.en: Firuz has been selling household goods and dish sets for ten years.  He is 35 years old.  He is married.  Firuz has a high school education.  He is taking out a loan to purchase wine glasses, cup sets and dish sets.

loans.use: to purchase wine glasses, cup sets and dish sets

loans.name: Sanou

texts.fr: Madame  Sanou  est une vieille femme de plus d’une soixantaine  d’années qui vit au Sénégal.  Elle évolue  depuis plus de 15 ans dans le secteur du commerce. Elle exerce  la vente de couscous, thiacry et patte d’arachide dans la localité ou elle habite. Elle a choisi cette  activité par opportunité  dans le but de  subvenir à ses propres besoins mais aussi dans le souci de soutenir sa famille. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2005. Elle a déjà remboursé 10 prêts  antérieurs au sein de l’institution.  Elle sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs prévu pour s’approvisionner en mil et en pâte d’arachide. Le mil est une denrée de base et en meme temps une  matière première pour la préparation de cous couscous et thiacry. Tous ces produits seront destinés à la vente. Pour madame Sanou  les bénéfices réguliers que lui procure  son activité de commerce lui permettent  d’acquérir  une indépendance financière car elle parvient à satisfaire  ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille sans l’aide de personne, et aussi de s’équiper en mobilier.
texts.en:
Madame  Sanou  is over sixty years old, and lives in Senegal. For the past fifteen years, she has been involved in retail, selling couscous, "thiacry" (steamed millet couscous), and peanut paste in her neighborhood. She chose this activity as it was an opportunity, and allows her to meet her own needs as well as support her family. 

She has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since February 2005, and has already repaid ten previous loans. She is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs to buy millet and peanut paste. Millet is a food staple and also the main ingredient in couscous and "thiacry." Madame Sanou will re-sell everything she buys. Thanks to her business' profit, she can be financially independent as she meets her needs and those of her family without relying on anyone else. She can also buy furniture.

loans.use: to buy millet and peanut paste to re-sell.

loans.name: Las Lideres De America Group

texts.es: Un grupo de mujeres con iniciativa, valores y buenas propuestas de cómo hacer negocio hoy en día, son las mujeres del grupo llamado "Las Lideres de America"  conformado por 6 socias con interés de desarrollo. Este grupo comienza a dar marcha hace ya 1 año y 6 meses. Mujeres que con esfuerzo y dedicación salen a delante sin importar las adversidades y problemas que vengan en el camino. Un caso particular es el de la señorita Estephanie es la tesorera del grupo, de 29 años de edad soltera, sale adelante cada día que pasa dándole empeño y esmero, ella se dedica ala venta de productos de belleza hace 3 años, comenzó con este negocio por la invitacion de una amiga, en el futuro le gustaria poner un negocio de venta de ropa. El presente préstamo lo invertirá en compra de mercaderia.
texts.en:
The group “Las Lideres de America" ["The Leaders of America”] is made up of six women with initiative, values and good proposals on how to do business today, as well as an interest in development.  This group was started a year and a half ago.  They are women who use hard wark and dedication to move forward, regardless of any adversity and challenges that they meet along the way.

One case in particular is Estephanie, who is the treasurer of the group.  She is 29 years old and single.  She moves forward every day with determination and poise.  For the past three years, she has made a living from the sale of beauty products.  She started the business at the invitation of a friend.  In the future, she would like to start a clothing business.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 40-years-old. He lives in a small village in the Kakheti Region with his family: wife – Maya and two sons (15 and 14 years old). Both children go to school. Koba and Maya work as agricultural workers. They provide seasonal agricultural services to local farmers and are paid for this. Total average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris. 

Koba used to grow cabbage on a family owned plot of the land, but in recent years he couldn’t sow cabbage, because he didn’t have financial resourses for covering land cultivation and sowing expenses. Koba requested credit for cultivation of the land and sowing cabbage. He will harvest in summer and sell harvested products at the local market. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to fight the poverty.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for land cultivation and seeds of cabbage.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 50 years old. She is single and lives in Kvareli District of Kakheti Region. She lives alone. Marine works in a local church. She sells candles and other church products. Her monthly salary is 250 Laris. 

Marine requested credit for a start-up agricultural business. She will sow maize on a family-owned plot of land. In the late summer Marine will sell harvested maize and get additional income. She plans to reinvest part of the income in the same business and the other part will be used for purchasing additional household goods to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and purchase maize for sowing

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 45 years old. She lives in a small village in the Telavi district of East Georgia. Manana lives with her mother-in-law, 73-year-old Tina. Tina is retired. 

Manana is currently unemployed. She used to run a small business, but because of her mother-in-law's illness she had to stop the business. The family lives under the poverty line and receives social assistance from the government. The only income for the family is Tina’s pension and the social assistance, which makes 230 Laris per month.

Manana requested credit to restart her trade business. She will purchase second-hand clothes at the wholesale market and sell them in the village with a price mark-up. The income for the family will significantly increase and Manana and Tina will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefania es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  ubicado en el distrito Paucarcolla, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos independientes, la señora estudio hasta 4to de educación primaria.

Hace dos años trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizo en su negocio venta de ganados, leche, golosinas y gaseosas.

Solicitara un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementará al capital de su negocio y comprará chanchos, ovejas, vaca, la señora cuenta que lo compra y vende en las ferias de la localidad, le ayuda su esposo en el negocio y también trabaja en construcción.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad, responsabilidad, el ahorro y su ganancia
texts.en:
Estefania is a member of the 'Santiago Apóstol' community bank which is located in Paucarcolla district, in Puno province and department.  She is 43 years old, married, and has four children who are independent.  She completed four years of elementary school.

Estefania has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business selling livestock, milk, candies and soda.

Estefania is requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles to increase her business capital and buy pigs, sheep and cows.  She says that she buys and sells her animals at markets in her town.  Her husband helps her in the business and also works in construction.

Estefania's dream for the future is to improve her business.  What she most likes about her community bank is the punctuality, the responsibility, the savings and the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy pigs, sheep and cows

loans.name: Indira

texts.en:
Indira is 34 years old. She lives in a village of Tskaltubo District, West Georgia. Indira is unmarried and lives with the family of her younger sister – Londa (her sister), her brother-in-law, her 3-year-old nephew and 4-year-old niece. Londa is a student. Indira is busy with agriculture, which is the main source of the income for the family. She grows maize on the family-owned 1 hectare of land. Maize is sold on the local market and brings the family on average 200 Laris per month. This income is hardly enough for feeding family members. 

Indira requested credit for starting up an agricultural business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with easy conditions for country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the loan Indira will start up a dairy farm. She will purchase four milk cows. Cows will be placed in an old cattle-shed, located in Indira’s yard. She will produce on average 100 kg of cheese, 90 of which will be sold on the local market, to dairy products retailers. The income of the family will increase by 500 – 600 Laris, which will mean 150 – 200% increase. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase four milk cows for starting up a dairy farm

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali, age 57, is a music teacher. She lives in a village in the Tskaltubo district with her 24-year-old son Iason. Lali earns a monthly salary of 200 Laris per month. Iason keeps busy running the family's small-scale dairy farm. They have two milk cows and produce cheese to sell at market. Iason sells an average of 35 kilograms of cheese at the local open market per month. 

Lali has requested credit for the purpose of building a greenhouse. The new business will be an additional source of the income for the family, which will allow them to combat the poverty in which they live. Lali’s loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program offers business start-up capital and re-startup credit with generous lending conditions to country rural poor, who often do not have access to credit as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Lali will purchase materials for greenhouse construction (iron pillars and polyethylene covering) and will then construct the greenhouse, where vegetables and greens will be grown throughout the year.  

Lali and Iason will work in the greenhouse themselves. They will sell their harvested produce at the local open market. The income of the family will significantly increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is 53 years old. He lives in a small village of Khoni District, West Georgia with his family: his wife Tamila and two sons (31 and 27 years old). Tamila is a housewife, her sons are unemployed. The only source of income for the family is a milk cow. Tamila produces cheese and sells it in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris. They live in poverty. 

Temur is a joiner. He has a small furniture-making workshop in his house, which is stopped at the moment, as Temur couldn't get financial resources for purchasing raw-materials. He requested credit for buying wooden materials for restarting the workshop. 

Temur's loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit, being regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of low income. 

With the borrowed funds Temur will be able to re-start the production of furniture, which will be sold in a nearby town. The income of the family will double. For the first year Temur plans to reinvest his profits in the workshop, to increase the volume of production and sales. As a result of the family's increase in income its members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials for furniture production

loans.name: Lavra

texts.en:
Lavra is 43 years old. She lives in a village of mountainous Kakheti, East Georgia. Lavra is divorced and she lives with her two sons (23 and 6 years old) and 73-year-old mother. Her younger son goes to school. Her elder son works as a worker. Lavra's mother has health problems. She gets a monthly pension. 

Lavra grows tomatoes, cucumbers and greens in her garden. She sells harvested products in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 350 Laris, including the pension of Lavra's mother. It is hardly enough for feeding the four-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Lavra requested credit for starting up an agricultural business. She received the loan in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo startup loan program, which envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup loans with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as "high risk borrowers" due to their low income. 

With the credit Lavra will purchase calves. She will feed them for five to six months and sell them for a profit in early fall. The family will get additional income. Lavra plans to re-invest part of it in the same business, and use the other part to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is 56 years old and from a village of the Kakheti district. She lives with her husband Eldar. The only source of income for the family is a small plot of land that they own on which they grow vegetables. Makvala sells their harvested vegetables at the local market. The average monthly income of the family is less than 200 Laris which is hardly enough for food. 

Makvala is requesting a loan to purchase a truck trailer. Eldar has a truck and he will use the trailer to provide transportation services to local farmers. Makvala will receive her loan from Credo as part of a start-up loan program, initiated jointly by Kiva and Credo. Start-up loans provide business loans and credit at lower interest rates to the rural poor who do not have access to many credit programs as they are regarded as high-risk borrowers because of low income. As a result of this investment, Makvala's family  income will significantly increase and the family will be able to combat poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a truck trailer

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 40 years old. She is unmarried and lives in Akhmeta District, East Georgia. Leila is an agricultural worker. She provides various seasonal agricultural services to local farmers. She earns 250 Laris per month. Leila can be esteemed to belong to the vulnerable poor category. 

Leila used to have a small poultry farm, but she sold her hens two years ago, as she needed to buy medicines for her elderly mother. Now she has requested a loan for re-starting the farm. She received the loan in the framework of a start-up loan program, initiated jointly by Credo and Kiva. This program aims at provision of business start-up or business re-start credits to Georgian rural poor, who do not have access to regular credit products, as they live in poverty and are regarded as “borrowers with high risk of default”. 

With the requested credit Leila will purchase chickens and raise them. After 4-5 months she will start the sale of hens. Hens will be sold on the open market of the nearby town by Leila. She will reinvest the profit for further expansion of the farm. Also part of the profit will be used for purchasing necessary household goods, to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Chrun

texts.en:
Chron is 52 years old, married, and has one child.  She resides in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice for over 20 years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns approximately $6 per day. Her daughter is a garment worker and earns approximately $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Chron is requesting a loan for $1,500 , which she will use to purchase a car for her husband to run a taxi service to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to build a concrete house to provide a better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old, married, and has four adult children.  She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. During a recent visit to her store, she explained that her prior loan through Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative has allowed her to buy more sari-sari (variety) products, which has increased the number of customers and doubled her profit. Teresita has always invested her profits back into the business. 

Teresita is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to finance her other line of business in the agriculture sector, raising bananas to sell.  She will buy banana fertilizer and sprouts. She has been in this business for two years. 

Teresita's business management has made her stand out. At the end of the month, she receives 3,100 PHP, which she uses for day-to-day expenditures and on other wants as well. Teresita hopes to earn adequate income from this investment so she can expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy banana fertilizer and sprouts.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр  женат. Его супругу зовут Инна. У них есть дочь Карина.  Александр обеспечивает свою семью.

Александр имеет бизнес. Он продает на центральном рынке города такие товары, как одеяла, пледы и постельное белье.  Этим направлением Александр  занимается на протяжении 8 лет.  Он трудолюбивый, общительный и жизнерадостный. Александр всегда готов помочь покупателю сделать правильный выбор. Его цель - развивать бизнес.

Александр просит предоставить ему  кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на расширение ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Alexander is married.  His wife's name is Irina.  They have a daughter, Karina.  Alexander provides for his family.  He owns his business.  Alexander sells goods, such as comforters, blankets and bedding.  He has been involved in this type of business for eight years.  He is very hardworking, communicative and joyful.  Alexander is always ready to help a customer to make the right choice.  His goal is to develop his business.  Alexander is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvnia to expand his merchandise selection.

loans.use: to expand the merchandise selection

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has operated his retail shop in Olkalou town for the last 19 years. He is 41 years old, married to Nancy and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first (KADET) loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of sugar, rice, and soft drinks for sale in his retail shop.

In the future, Joseph hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, and soft drinks for sale in his retail shop.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Son señoras muy trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante y por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto poder ayudar a sus hijos y familiares. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa y están aprendiendo el trabajo en equipo.
Juana, es una de las miembros del grupo, y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de bebidas, como ser gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, y demás tipos, en lo cual le va muy bien , gracias a que siempre tiene bien abastecido su local. Su meta es poder agrandar su loca, y de esa forma tener mayor capacidad para sus bebidas.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás. Agradecen a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que les están dando a ellas y sus amigas.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the city of Caacupé.  They are very hard-working women who wish to get ahead, and through working together, they are able to support their children and families.  Currently, they are in the first cycle of the program and they are learning about teamwork.

Juana, one of the members of the group, tells us that she sells beverages such as soft drinks, beer, wine, and other types of drinks.  Her business is going very well because her store is always well-stocked.  Her goal is to be able to expand her business location in order to increase storage capacity for her beverages.

She is requesting the loan to purchase soft drinks, wine, beer, and other beverages.  She is grateful to the foundation and Kiva for the help they are providing her and her friends.  
.

loans.use: to purchase beverages to stock her business.

loans.name: Wilian

texts.es:
Wilian nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 24 años de edad, él tiene una relación libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, él se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio. Wilian en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, clavos, cola de carpintero y otras cosas más.  

Wilian pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Wilian agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Wilian was born in the city of Lamay and is 24 years old.  He has an open relationship from which he has three children.  He works making wood furniture and has a small workshop in his home.

He requires this loan to buy work materials such as wood, nails, wood adhesive, and other things.

Wilian belongs to Virgen de Fátima de Lamay Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa in the province of Calca and department of Cusco, Peru.  He is grateful for and values the loan, and he promises to make his monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to buy work materials such as wood, nails, wood adhesive, and other things.

loans.name: Leonarada Avelina

texts.es:
Leonarda es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  ubicado en el distrito Paucarcolla, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, la señora no cuenta con estudios.

Conjuntamente con su esposo se dedica a la venta de animales como ovinos, porcinos, trabaja hace 6 años con Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de ovejas.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de dos chanchos para su engorde, para luego venderlos carneado (al por menor).
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es seguir operando en el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es el préstamo de la cuenta interna
texts.en:
Leonarda is a member of the 'Santiago Apóstol' community bank which is located in Paucarcolla district, in Puno province and department.  She is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  She did not attend school.

Together with her husband, Leonarda sells animals such as sheep and pigs.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos for six years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she used that money to buy sheep.

Leonarda is requesting a new loan for 600 soles to invest in buying two pigs to fatten.  She will later sell their meat retail.

Leonarda's dream for the future is to continue working in her business.  What she most likes about her community bank are the loans from the internal account.

loans.use: to buy two pigs to fatten

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: María  es una persona  muy trabajadora,  ella se  preocupa  por  brindar a  su  familia  una excelente  estabilidad,  es  por  ello  que  acudió con  nosotros  para    pedir  apoyo para la realización de  su proyecto, el cual consiste en realizar la compra  de  puertas  y  ventanas  para  su  vivienda,  ve en  el crédito la posibilidad  de   ofrecer a  su  familia  una  mayor seguridad, además  de  que   nos  ve  como la mejor  opción debido  a la  comodidad para  realizar  sus  pagos.
texts.en: María is a very hard-working person who works to provide her family with excellent stability.  She came to us to request our support in carrying out a project, buying doors and windows for her home.  She sees this loan as providing a possibility for her to offer her family more security.  She also sees us as the best option available owing to the convenience of the repayments.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows

loans.name: Set

texts.en:
Set is 39 years old and married with four children attending school, living in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Set was born and grew up there on the family farm. For additional income, she raises and sells pigs as her second business. 

In order to develop her living status, Set has turned to HKL, a partner of Kiva, to request a loan in the amount of USD 1,000 to buy cashew nuts in bulk from local farmers to stock for the future sale. This investment will allow Set to make a good profit in following months when the market demand is increasing. Set plans to save her profits on her children's tuition at the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk from local farmers to stock for future sale.

loans.name: Non

texts.en: Non, 30, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over twenty years, have an extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Approximately, they earn USD 5 per day. Her daughter is a garment worker who earns about USD 4 per day. Due lack of fund, Non is requesting for a loan of USD 500 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to use in her farming work. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it stronger to provide a better living condition for her family. Moreover, she wants to help her children get bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to use in her farming work

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Phal, 30, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 10 per day. Her son is a construction worker and earns USD 6 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Phal is requesting for a loan of USD 1100 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate extra profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use further profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house with fence around the house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate extra profit to support the family

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat is 33 years old man who lives with his wife and 2 kids in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His wife is helps her husband's business, also she sews traditional clothes. His oldest kid studies at the high school. He operates garment trading business and carpentry business. 
Since 2002, he has been running garment retailing business and from 2007 he started his carpentry business. He brings the supplies from China. While he is away to bring the supplies, his wife stays at the shopcounter. He has made number of regular customers and they appreciate the goods. He plans to expand the business activities by getting the supplies in large quantities from China so that he would trade various types of it. Erdenebat is an intelligent guy who says that "I would like to expand my business to save the transportation expenses and bring the supplies in large quantities and profit more to save for the kids". The total amount he is requesting is 800,000 MNT to bring the garments from China.

loans.use: To purchase the garments from China

loans.name: Enkhsaikhan Buyankhishig

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhsaikhan, 38 is a taxi driver and has been running his business for 6 years around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his 3 daughters in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. His wife is unemployed, caring for her children at home. Currently his business is a main income source of this family. Enkhsaikhan works 12-15 hours in a day and his taxi earnings do not usually meet with his family expenses. Two of his daughters attend state college and their school fees are high in a year. 
Lately his taxi car has been becoming bad and damaged its body. This influences his service quality and income, as well as customers safety and satisfaction. Therefore he is taking a loan to purchase the new car body for his old taxi car renovation.

loans.use: To purchase the new car body for his old taxi car renovation.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 46-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in the island of Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Jocelyn runs a sari-sari store business. She sells various items like spices, toiletries, canned goods, soy sauce and vinegar. Jocelyn is able to contribute to her family's earnings with the income she earns from her store. Jocelyn hopes for her business to grow more.

Jocelyn plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, canned goods, vegetables and toiletries. This will help increase Jocelyn's profitability.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, canned goods, vegetables and toiletries

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 25 years old,he runs a taxi (car transport) business to earn a living, he has been in the business for 8 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. To earn extra income he does maize farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Anet

texts.en:
Anet lives in yei. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 26 years old, married, and has two children; all of them are still in school. 

Anet heard about BRAC South Sudan from credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 400 in order to purchase cassava flour, maize. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour, maize for sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es socia de del Banco Comunal Nueva ilusión, es madre de un hijo, dueña de una bodega, y socia de Finca Perú desde hace un año, lo que más le gusta de las reuniones de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro, ella pudo aprender más acerca de cómo hacer negocio, y como administrar su negocio, el poco tiempo que es socia le ayudó a valorase como mujer y como madre, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
texts.en: Rosa is a member of the communal bank Nueva Ilusión [New Hope]. She is the mother of a son, owner of a grocery store and has been a member of Finca Perú for a year. What Rosa enjoys the most about her communal bank meetings is the savings and she was able to learn more about how to do business and manage her business. The short time she has been a member has helped her appreciate herself, as a woman and a mother. Now with the loan she will be able to invest in the purchase of groceries.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Ibaniza

texts.es:
Ibaniza nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 36 años de edad, ella tiene una relación libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pollipapas, gaseosas, frutas, dulces y otras cosas más. Ibaniza en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, frutas y otras cosas más.  

Ibaniza pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

Ibaniza agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ibaniza was born in the city of Lamay and is 36 years old.  She has an open relationship from which she has two children.  She works selling "pollipapas" [chicken and fried potatoes], soda, fruit, candy, and other things.

Ibaniza requires this loan now to buy soda, fruit, and other things.

Ibaniza belongs to Virgen de Fátima de Lamay Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa in the province of Calca, department of Cusco, Peru.  She is grateful for and values the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to buy soda, fruit, and other things.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  ubicado en el distrito Paucarcolla, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con cinco hijos en estudio, la señora estudio educación secundaria.

Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de pan, bebidas gaseosas, golosinas, venta de tejidos como chompas y ponchos.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, golosinas, galletas, etc,  la señora vende en las ferias de la localidad  y en eventos deportivos, en le negocio le ayudas sus hijos y su esposo, también este trabaja en construcción.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio y poner tienda de abarrotes.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es  la facilidad del préstamo y el préstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the 'Santiago Apóstol' community bank which is located in Paucarcolla district, in Puno province and department.  She is 41 years old, lives with her partner, and has five children who are in school.  She completed her secondary education.

Leonor's first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business selling bread, soda and candies, and also knitted products such as sweaters and ponchos.

Leonor is requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles which she will invest in buying soda, candies, cookies, etc.  She makes her sales in markets in her town and also at sporting events.  Her children and her husband help her in her business.  Her husband also works in construction.

Leonor's dream for the future is to improve her business and set up a grocery store.  What she most likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining loans and the loans from the internal account.

loans.use: to buy soda, candies, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  ubicado en el distrito Paucarcolla, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos en estudio, la señora estudió solo la primaria.

Luisa trabaja hace 6 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  la primer vez se hizo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio venta de golosinas, pan, bebidas gaseosas y venta de chanchos.

Ahora requerirá de un nuevo préstamo por la suma de   S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar golosinas, galletas gaseosas,  y chanchos para su engorde, en el negocio le ayuda su esposo también este trabaja en mototaxi.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es tener sus tienda de abarrotes bien lleno.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es el compañerismo, la distracción con las socias y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the 'Santiago Apóstol' community bank which is located in Paucarcolla district, in Puno province and department.  She is 32 years old, married, and has four children in school.  She herself only studied at elementary school level.

Luisa has been working with Manuela Ramos for six years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business selling candies, bread, drinks and soda, and also her business selling pigs.

Luisa now needs a new loan for 1,000 soles to buy candies, cookies, soda, and pigs to fatten.  Her husband helps her in her business and also drives a motorcycle taxi.

Luisa's dream for the future is to have a well-stocked grocery store.  What she most likes about her community bank is the sense of camaraderie, the enjoyment she gets from meeting with her fellow members and the responsibility.

loans.use: to buy candies, cookies, soda, and pigs to fatten

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 28-year-old married man, father of three children, who has owned a grocery store since 2009. Abass is well known in the region with his good reputation.

Abass is a hardworking man who seeks perfection and a good living for his family. He also works hard to provide a good education for his children.

Abass applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his merchandise with special goods with special prices.

Abass is willing to expand his business more and more in the future to insure that his family's needs are well met.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise with special goods and special prices.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 40 years old and she lives in Ijevan city. Anhit’s son is a fourth year student of Ijevan branch of Yerevan State University. He is studying in ecological department. Anahit is requesting a loan of 110.000 AMD to pay for her son’s education.

Anahit is married and has a daughter as well. Anahit’s husband periodically moves to Russia for seasonal work. This is Anahit’s third loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education at the University

loans.name: Chanthea

texts.en: Chanthea, 31, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been working as tailor for over ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a mechanic who earns approximately USD 6 per day. In order to improve her family’s living condition, Chanthea is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase motorbike’s spare part for her husband to sell as well as to repair for his clients. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to sell as well as to repair for his clients

loans.name: Malai

texts.en:
