Teresa de Jesús is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has a beauty salon at the local market.  She started this business 15 years ago with only a few products.  Teresa has now improved her business by purchasing chairs, mirrors, and other items.  

This loan will be invested in dyes, treatments, nail polishes, and other supplies.  Teresa is married to Don Rafael, who is a welder, and they have two children.

loans.use: to buy dyes, treatments, nail polishes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora es residente en una comunidad de Nacaome, Valle. Ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, dedicándose a la venta de papas fritas, enchiladas, yuca frita, tacos y refrescos, ella tiene su negocio  en su casa y sus clientes llegan día con día a disfrutar de sus platillos y refrescos, ella esta solicitando a PRISMA un préstamo por la cantidad de 6,000.00 lempiras para compra de refrescos de botella, verduras, agua en bolsa, carnes y demás productos que ella necesita para preparar sus golosinas.
El sueño de Doña Dora es que sus hijos se graduén de la universidad.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Dora lives in a community in Nacaome, Valle.  She lives with her husband and her two children, and works selling fried potatoes, enchiladas, fried yucca, tacos, and soft drinks.  She has her business in her house and her customers come every day to enjoy her dishes and refreshments.

She is requesting a loan of 6,000 HNL from PRISMA to buy bottled soft drinks, vegetables, bags of water, meat, and other products she needs to make her food.

Dora's dream is for her children to graduate from the university.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Santos Humberto

texts.es:
El Señor Humberto, se dedica a la venta de Huevos, Frijoles, Arroz, Maíz, Refrescos, Condimentos, Aceite, Manteca y otros artículos de uso diario en su casa de habitación de la aldea la cuesta, en donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de la zona, familiares, amigos.
Don Humberto, Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años en donde a demostrado crecimiento en su nivel de vida y económico.
Don Humberto esta solicitando a PRISMA de Honduras la cantidad de 7,000.00 lempiras para invertirlos en su negocio a un corto plazo en compra de artículos para abastecer su negocio.
Su sueño principal es que su pulpería crezca cada día.


San Lorenzo, FEBRERO 2012.
texts.en:
Humberto works selling eggs, beans, rice, corn, soft drinks, seasonings, oil, lard, and other daily necessities in his home in the town of La Cuesta.  His main customers are the neighbors in the area, family members, and friends.  Humberto has worked at this job for several years, and has shown growth in his standard of living and economic level.

Humberto is requesting the sum of 7,000 lempiras (HNL) from Prisma Honduras to invest in his business to buy items to stock his business.

His main dream is for his grocery store to grow every day.

San Lorenzo, February 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, coffee, rice, and other products for his business.

loans.name: Fernando Favio

texts.es:
Fernando, vive en la ciudad de Camana; ciudad que se caracteriza por ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial por el cultivo del Arroz, el cual es muy conocido a nivel internacional, así como también se le conoce por sus hermosas playas y la generosidad de sus pobladores. Es padre de 2 hijos de 5 y 8 años a los cuales ama muchísimo y por los cuales se esfuerza mucho por sacarlos adelante y que tengan una vida feliz y sin penuria; en su tiempo libre a Fernando le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos, así como también comer uno de sus platos favoritos los riquísimos “frejoles”.

Con mucho esfuerzo Fernando trabaja en su negocio como maestro constructor, labora alrededor de 12 horas al día, pero depende del tamaño de la construcción que realice, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y honrado con los clientes por ello le tienen confianza y lo recomiendan.

Fernando está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a  la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mejoramiento a su vivienda, en especial mejorar la fachada de su casa para poder tener mayor seguridad; con esta mejora su vivienda tendrá mayor seguridad, así seguirá trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in the city of Camana, a city characterized by agriculture, especially the cultivation of rice, which is internationally known, as well as for its beautiful beaches and the generosity of its inhabitants.

Fernando is the father of two children, 5 and 8 years old, whom he loves greatly and for whom he works hard to get ahead so that they will have a happy life, free of hardships. In his spare time, he enjoys playing soccer with his neighbors and also eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “frejoles” (beans).

With a great deal of effort, Fernando works at his job as a master builder. He works around 12 hours a day, depending on the size of construction he is doing. He believes his business is doing well because he is very responsible and honest with his clients so that they have confidence in him and recommend him to others.

Fernando is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to their help he will be able to make improvements to his dwelling, especially the front of his house, in order to have greater security. Thus, he will continue working to fulfill his great dream: “Giving his children a good education.”

loans.use: to improve the front of his house.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is sixty years old and married with four children. She has been running a sari-sari (general) store for ten years and earns an income from selling rice and raising livestock as well. She works hard to provide for her family.

Prior to this loan request Perla borrowed and paid off thirteen loans from NWTF. She would now like a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase more groceries to sell. Perla’s desire is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Simion Lapur

texts.en: Simon is a charcoal vendor. He started his business 12 years ago, and earns a good income. He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase timber to burn to produce charcoal. This is his second loan, and he hopes to repay it successfully.

loans.use: to buy one acre of trees to burn to produce charcoal

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 28 year old single mother of two children, aged 8 and 3. She has been in the tobacco selling business for four years, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.  She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 that she will use to purchase tobacco and transportation services. The profit she earns from this business will help her to start poultry farming. Her dream is to be successful in life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase tobacco and transportation services.

loans.name: Caudencio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Niassa, Norte de Moçambique, casado e não tem filhos. Fez a 7ª classe e parou quando foi incorporado no serviço militar, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.

Saiu de Niassa para Maputo no distrito de Boane em missão de serviço. Trabalha como militar há mais de 21 anos pertence ao quadro do Ministério da Defesa Nacional e tem um salário de 8.300.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Já teve empréstimo no BIM a longo prazo e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (ferro, cimento, areia, blocos e outros). 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Caudencio was born in the province of Niassa in northern Mozambique.  He is married and doesn't have any children.  He studied through the 7th grade and stopped when he joined the military.  He lives in his own home with his family and supports two nephews that live with him.

He left Niassa for Maputo in the district of Boane on a mission with the military.  He has worked for the military for more than 21 years and is part of the National Ministry of Defense.  He has a salary of 8,300 meticals a month that he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.  He already had a long-term loan with BIM, and he was able to pay it without difficulty.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend that is also a client of the institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction material for his home (iron, cement, sand, bricks, etc.).

He promises to make his payments on time, and in the future, he would like to finish his house, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home (iron, cement, sand, bricks, etc.).

loans.name: Don De Dieu Group

texts.fr: DON DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Attintèko Françoise (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31ans et est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Faustin. Attintèho Françoise a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Attintèko Françoise vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a un an déjà, Attintèko Françoise vend des cartes de recharges téléphonique à son domicile. Attintèho Françoise s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Attintèho Françoise et les autres membres du groupe DON DE DIEU sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit à été bien remboursé.
texts.en: DON DE DIEU is a group of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's leader, Attintèko Françoise (her hand is raised in the photograph), is 31 years old and is married to a teacher named Faustin. Attintèho Françoise finished her primary school education. They have two children who are in school. Attintèko Françoise lives with her children and husband, together they manage the household expenses. For the past year, she has been selling prepaid phone cards door-to-door. Attintèho Françoise buys her inventory in a city in Benin. This is the second time she and the other members of the group DON DE DIEU have requested a loan from ALIDé. They would like to strengthen their working capital and strengthen their business to meet client demands. Their first loan was properly reimbursed.

loans.use: to purchase prepaid telephone cards for resale.

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doris, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere comprar mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes como pantalones jeans, camisas, bóxer, zapatos, esto aumentara su disponibilidad y mejorara las ventas.
Ella considera que con cada préstamo logra mejorar su condición y sobre todo que las ganancias aumentan, esto le motiva a continuar trabajando de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Doris has decided to request another loan because she wants to buy merchandise to offer to her customers, such as jeans, shirts, boxers, and shoes.  This will increase her assets and improve her sales.

She considers that with each loan she manages to improve her conditions and, above all, the profits increase.  This motivates her to continue working in the best way.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, boxers, and shoes.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She is a manufacturer who makes curtains, blankets, and kitchen and bathroom sets. Dolores buys the materials, sews the items, and then sells them to her clients (some of which are small stores). She will use this loan to buy fabric of different quality, color, and designs and to buy thread, needles, and other sewing and decorating accessories. 

Dolores is a single mother of four children. She is dedicated and works hard to provide for her family. Dolores tells us that for her the most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and give them a good education. She is very excited to be receiving her second loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has been working at her business for about ten years. She is very thankful to have received this loan from Esperanza because she will improve her sales. She plans to save the profits for future reinvestment, especially during seasons with more demand. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, needles, and sewing and decorating accessories.

loans.name: Evelyn Johanna

texts.es:
Evelyn, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada, su esposo es electricista, tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos estudia en la escuela y vive en un barrio de Puerto Cortes.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, motivada a superarse y mejorar la calidad de vida familiar, hace tres años decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de comida, donde vende desayunos típicos, baleadas (tortilla de harina con frijol, huevo, queso o mantequilla), almuerzos y cenas. este negocio lo tiene en su casa y esta ubicado en un punto estratégico por donde circulan personas con vehículos de carga pesada como trailer o furgones y ella ha visto la oportunidad de ofrecerles comida. Trabaja desde muy temprano hasta parte de la noche atendiendo sus clientes.
Es su primer préstamo que solicita a ODEF, y lo va invertir en la remodelación del local del negocio de comida, va construir una pared y arreglar el techo,brindando asi un mejor servicio al cliente. Tiene como meta ampliar la variedad de comidas a ofrecer a los clientes para aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 34, is married and her husband’s an electrician; she has two children and one of them attends school.  She lives in a neighborhood in Puerto Cortes.

She is a very hardworking woman who is motivated to do better and improve her family’s quality of life.  Three years ago she decided to start her own food selling business where she sells traditional breakfasts, baleadas (flour tortilla with beans, eggs, cheese or butter), lunches and dinners.  

She lives in a strategic spot where many people circulate in heavy cargo trucks toward the port and she has the opportunity to offer them food.  She starts work very early and is still taking care of customers until nightfall.

This is the first loan she’s requested from ODEF and she will use it to remodel her business, constructing a wall and fixing the root in order to offer better service.  She already has the goal of expanding the variety of dishes on offer to customers to increase sales and income.

loans.use: to remodel her locale by building a wall and fixing the roof.

loans.name: Mujeres De Debora 3 Group

texts.en:
Jose is the coordinator of his group "Mujeres de Debora" group 3. This group is located in the city of Puerto Plata whose population is made up of Dominicans and Haitian migrants. The region's economy is dependent on the rum industry as well as tourism and real estate. It was the first tourist destination in the Dominican Republic and is one of the biggest sugar producers. Jose is running a cybercafe, where he offers computer services such as internet, homework search, and also photocopying. He also sells parts and cameras.

Jose makes his home in a simple structure. He is a single man, and one of his greatest dreams is to get married and become a man of God. Also he wants to have a successful business. Jose is excited to be taking his first loan. His business has been here around five years, and he started it when he stopped working for a company. He plans to use this loan to purchase computers parts and cameras. He will use the profits to reinvest in his business. His long-term goal is to reinvest in his business. He said his most difficult challenge has been to overcome an illness. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy computer parts and cameras

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Pablita works hard to support her family.  She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an internet cafe and food vending. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle.

Pablita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle.

loans.name: Remilda

texts.en: Remilda is 41 years old, married, and has two children who are currently going to school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for the past 10 years. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos dos quais um frequenta a Escoa e o outro ainda é bebé. Frequenta a 12ª classe, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É assistente de laboratório há mais de 5 anos pertence ao quadro do MISAU e tem um salário de 3.700.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (janelas, portas, cimento, areia e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 12.000.00mt,aplicado na habitação.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa e investir no curso de ciências e tecnologia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alberto was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  He is married and is the father of 2 children, one of whom goes to elementary school, and the other is still a baby.  He studied through the 12th grade.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.

He has been a laboratory assistant for more than 5 years for MISAU.  He has a monthly salary of 3,700 meticals that he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials for his home (windows, doors, cement, sand, etc.).  His previous loan was for 12,000 meticals, which he also put towards his home.

He promises to make his payments on time.  In the future, he wants to finish his house and invest in a science and technology class, for which he is planning on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home (windows, doors, cement, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Henry Aurelio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar  vive el señor Henry, está casado y de esta relación tiene un pequeño hijo de 3 años. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidad a su pequeño bebé.

Él tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa, ya son casi seis años que lleva con su negocio y aun recuerda que con lo poco que tenia fue comprando poco a poco las cosas para surtir su tienda, la misma que en la actualidad y gracias a los créditos recibidos la ha ido ampliando poco a poco, ahora la tiene bien surtida y con esto ha ganado muchos clientes que dia a dia se acercan hasta su local a realizar sus compras. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 19h00, aunque es su esposa la que más tiempo pasa en el local pues él también trabaja en un tanquero repartiendo agua para los vecinos de la localidad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar y otros productos de primera necesidad que por el tiempo de invierno se escasean. Lleva más de 2 años  en el banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para surtir su tienda aun más.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Los Corrales (The Yards) Communal Bank meets every fortnight in a community called Los Corrales, which is located a few minutes away from Montecristi, a town with a rich prehistoric culture. The majority of the inhabitants of this place engages in different activities such as handicrafts and general trade.

Here we meet Henry. He is married and has a little son aged 3. His wife cares for their little child and she tends to the various tasks of the house.

He runs a small grocery store in his house, an activity he has been running for almost six years. He still remembers when he started buying products little by little with the little money he had, in order to stock up his shop, the same that today he has been gradually expanding thanks to the loans he has received. He now has it well supplied and thanks to this he has gained many customers who come to his shop every day to do their shopping. He works every day form 5 am to 7 pm, even though it’s his wife who spends the most time in the shop, as he also drives a tanker truck and he distributes water among the neighbors of his community.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar and other basic necessities that may become scarce during the winter. He has been a member of the communal bank for more than 2 years, and he likes it because of the help he is being given in keeping on supplying his shop.

His wish is to keep on carrying on his activity.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Edinson Paolo Rodriguez Huaman

texts.es:
Edinson vive junto a su pareja y su pequeño de 2 años de edad, al cual ama mucho y es su razón de vivir cada día en la ciudad de Chincha; ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, la generosidad de sus pobladores y por la rica sazón que tienen para la preparación de los platillos característicos de la zona. En su tiempo libre a Edinson le gusta salir a pasear con su familia y sobre todo comer su patillo favorito, “Tallarines Rojos”. El solo estudio hasta el quinto grado e secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar derecho.

Con mucho esfuerzo él trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 60 clientes, el se esfuerza mucho sobre todo porque en ocasiones no va a su casa a almorzar para poder tener más clientes, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque hay mucha necesidad de transporte en el barrio donde vive y además porque ofrece un buen trato a sus clientes.

Edinson agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo y además podrá apoyar a su esposa en su negocio de venta de desayunos, esta mejora le permitirá tener un vehículo en buenas condiciones y su esposa podrá mejorar su negocio de venta de desayunos, así seguirá trabajando para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a  su hijo y comprar un camión”.
texts.en:
Edinson lives in the city of Chincha with his life partner and his little two year old, whom he loves very much.  They are his reason for living each day.  Chincha is known for its beautiful beaches, its generous population, and for the delicious way the typical dishes are prepared.

In his free time Edinson likes to go for walks with his family.  Above all, he likes to eat his favorite dish, “Tallarines Rojos” ["red spaghetti," with a Peruvian-style red sauce].  He only went to school up until the fifth year of high school.  However, he would have liked to have studied law.

With great effort he works as a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver.  He devotes around 12 hours a day to his business, and he can take care of up to 60 customers.  He puts forth a great deal of effort.  Sometimes he does not go home for lunch in order to have more customers.  He believes that the business is going well for him because there is a great demand for transportation in the neighborhood where he lives.  Also, he treats his customers well.

Edinson is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  With their help he will be able to perform general maintenance on his vehicle.  Also, he will be able to support his wife in her business of selling breakfasts.  This improvement will allow him to have a vehicle that is in good condition.  Also, his wife will be able to improve her business of selling breakfasts.  This way he will continue working to fulfill his biggest dream:  To give his child a good education and to buy a truck.

loans.use: to provide maintenance on his vehicle and for the breakfast business.

loans.name: Srey March

texts.en:
Srey March, age 27, is a garment factory worker. She resides with her parents, her husband, and their one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have both been working in a garment factory for over six years, earning approximately USD 9 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in accessing transportation for the family, Srey March is requesting a loan of USD 1400 in order to purchase a motorbike, which will be used for commuting. This purchase will enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support her family. 

In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and to help her child achieve a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to build a new, separate house for her parents to live in.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use for commuting

loans.name: Catarina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.

É operária agrícola na Bananalândia há mais de 10 anos e tem um salário de 2.230.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (areia, blocos, cimento, pedra, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 13.000.00mt, aplicado na habitação.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e comprar uma viatura, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Catarina was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is married and the mother of 3 children, all of whom go to school.  She studied through 4th grade but stopped due to her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports two nephews that live with her.

She has been an agricultural worker with Bananalândia for more than 10 years.  She makes 2,230 meticals a month, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.  

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 13,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials for her home (sand, bricks, cement, rock, etc.).  Her previous loan was for 13,000 meticals, which she also put towards her home.

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future, she would like to finish her home and buy a vehicle, for which she plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home (sand, bricks, cement, rock, etc.).

loans.name: Dona Group

texts.fr: DONA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Alice (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans et est veuve. Alice n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Alice a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés mais seulement deux restent à sa charge. Alice vit ensemble avec ses deux enfants. Alice assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis dix ans, Alice vend du maïs et de charbon de bois à son domicile. Alice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la troisième fois que Alice et les autres membres du groupe DONA sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux crédits précédemment consentis ont été bien remboursés
texts.en: DONA is a group of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's leader, Alice (her hand is raised in the photograph), is 47 years old and a widow. Alice did not complete much schooling. She has four children, some of whom still attend school. She is only currently financially responsible for two of them. Alice lives together with her two children and takes care of all the household expenses herself. For the past 10 years, Alice has sold corn and charcoal from her home. She buys her inventory from the market in Benin. This is the third time Alice and the other members of the group DONA have requested a loan from ALIDé. They want to strengthen their working capital and strengthen their business to better meet their client's demands. The two previous loans were both properly reimbursed.

loans.use: to purchase bags of corn and charcoal.

loans.name: Johanna Beatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johanna, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene un hijo de tres años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ganar sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sus clientes también llegan hasta sus casa a comprar cuando lleva mercadería nueva,  la mayoría de las veces sale en las  mañanas ya que a esta hora su suegra le cuida a su pequeño hijo y los fines de semana su esposo le ayuda, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva año y medio con su negocio y le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisetas, ropa de niños entre otras prendas. Lleva año y medio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito pudo empezar en su negocio.
 
Su sueño  es tener casa propia ya que vive en la casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
Los Corrales (The Yards) Communal Bank meets every fortnight in a community called Los Corrales, which is located a few minutes away from Montecristi, a town with a rich prehistoric culture. The majority of the inhabitants of this place engages in different activities such as handicrafts and general trade.

Here we meet Johanna. She is 27, she is married and she has a 3-year-old child. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

She is housewife who engages in selling various items of clothing to earn some money of her own and to help her husband paying for their household expenses. She sells door to door, but her customers also come to her house to shop whenever she has new products. She works mostly in the mornings because her mother-in-law can take care of her little child, and in the week-ends, with the help of her husband. She sells on credit and she collects cash every eight or every fifteen days. She has been running this activity for one and a half years and things are going very well.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy trousers, T-shirts, children’s clothes and other items of clothing. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for one and a half years and she lives it because she has been able to start her activity thanks to her fist loan.

She dreams of having a house of her own because she is currently living in the house of her parents-in-law.

loans.use: To buy trousers, T-shirts and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, age 53, is a responsible and industrious mother who always takes care of her family and manages the household in a well-organized way. She has become a single parent and lives with her elderly mother, her younger sisters and brothers, and her two children in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. 

In the back yard of her home, she operates a hog-raising business. She has been engaged in this business for over 20 years. She owns a medium-size wooden pigpen for fattening three or four pigs. She raises these for three to five months and sells to local butchers, who are her frequent customers.

At present, Sun is seeking a loan in the sum of KHR 1,200,000 to renovate her old pigpen and purchase eight pigs for raising. She hopes to make a good income after her pigs become full-grown. With the additional income she will earn, she will be able to expand her savings to further grow her business and to keep for emergency use.

loans.use: to renovate her pigpen and to purchase eight pigs to raise

loans.name: Ester

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 4 frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É negociante há mais de 29 anos e dedica-se a compra e venda de produtos alimentares, e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.900.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, batata, amendoim, peixe, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.500.00mt, aplicado na compra de um congelador.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir uma casa digna para a sua família, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's married and has five children, four of which attend school. She completed 4th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over 29 years. She buys and sells foodstuffs and earns an income of about 3.900mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 13.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (rice, potatoes, peanuts, fish, etc.) in order to increase the volume of her merchandise. The previous loan was for 10.500mt and it was used for purchasing a freezer.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to build a decent home for her family, and for that purpose she plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods (rice, potatoes, peanuts, fish, etc.) for selling.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez o nível primário e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Trabalha como operador de máquinas na Bananalândia há mais de3 anos e tem um salário de 6.178.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (pedra, cimento, areia, blocos, e outros).  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jeremias was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  He is the father of four children, all of whom go to school.  He finished elementary school and stopped due to his parents' lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.

He has worked as a machine operator for Bananalândia for more than 3 years.  He makes 6,178 meticals a month, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials for his home (rock, cement, sand, bricks, etc.).

He promises to make his payments on time.  In the future, he would like to finish his home, for which he is planning on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home (rock, cement, sand, bricks, etc.).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 30, is a fish vendor living in Yei. She has been engaged in her business for five years. She and her husband have seven children, six of whom are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan in the amount of 600 in order to purchase fish to offer for sale. 

She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, age 40, is a farmer. He and his wife have been blessed with five children between the ages of six and 15 years old. He began his farming business 10 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has requested a loan in the amount of KES 50,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season. The anticipated profit will help him pay the school fees of his children. 

He dreams of being a successful farmer as well as ensuring the education of his children. This is his third loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer in preparation for the planting season

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 1ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É negociante há mais de 12 anos e dedica-se a compra e venda de produtos diversos, e tem um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (carne, cerveja, refrescos, sumos, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt, aplicados no negócio.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende melhorar as condições do seu estabelecimento para fazer crescer o seu negócio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's single and has four children, all of which attend school. She completed first grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over 12 years. She buys and sells various products and earns an income of about 10.000mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 12.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (meat, beer, refreshments, juice, etc.) in order to increase the volume of her merchandise. The previous loans were for 10.000mt and 15.000mt and they were used for her business.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to improve her store's premises in order to expand her business. For that purpose she plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (meat, beer, refreshments, juice, etc.).

loans.name: Masika

texts.fr: La cliente Masika est  un entrepreneur, âgée de 52 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants et plusieurs petits fils. Son mari est un chômeur suite a une logue maladie  qui a failli qu’il perd son emploi. Elle est vendeuse de poissons. Elle expose ses marchandises au marché central de Virunga. Depuis sa jeunesse, elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre jadis,  quand elle vivait dans une pêcherie de Vitshumbi avant de s’installer dans la ville de Goma. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  19eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 gros sacs de poissons. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement , finir leurs cycles à  l’université et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client, Masika, is an entrepreneur who is 52 years old, married, has 5 children, and many grandchildren. Her husband is unemployed as the a result of a long illness, which caused him to lose his job. 

She is a fishmonger who sells her goods at the central market of Virunga. Since her youth, she’s been carrying out this type of old-fashioned business when she lived in a fishing ground in Vitshumbi, and before she moved to the city of Goma.

She has just obtained her 19th loan from Hekima. This new loan will help her buy 2 large bags of fish. She also hopes to see her children grow up comfortably, to have them finish university, and to grow her business. 

The client thanks Hekima for their actions in favor of the poor women excluded from traditional banks.

loans.use: 2 large bags of fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 63 años de edad está casado con la Sra Flora hace más 25 años y vive en su casa propia en la ciudad de Carapeguá, tienen 3 hijos todos ya son mayores de edad, que se manejan de manera independiente.
Don  José  es una persona muy sacrificada, y nos cuenta que  hace años que trabaja en el campo cultivando todas clase de hortalizas para la venta, también a la vez se dedica a la ganadería, compra animales para faenar  y vender, ya que así le resulta muchos más rentable. Gracias a la trayectoria de su trabajo y esfuerzo hoy en día puede brindarle a su familia un hogar confortable y con las comodidades necesarias.
 Solicita el préstamo para la compra de animales para faenarlos ya que en esta época donde hay muchas demanda. Está muy contento por la oportunidad que está recibiendo por parte de fundación paraguaya y de kiva.
texts.en:
José is 63, and has been married to Flora for more than 25 years. They live in their own house in the city of Carapeguá, and have three children who are now all adults and independent. José is a very self-sacrificing person, and tells us that he has farmed for years, growing all kinds of vegetables for sale.

At the same time, he raises livestock, and buys animals to slaughter and sell, as this way it proves much more profitable for him.

Thanks to his years of work and effort, nowadays he can offer his family a comfortable home with the necessary conveniences.

He is applying for the loan to buy animals for slaughter, as there is lot of demand at this time of year. He is very happy about the opportunity he is receiving through the Fundación Paraguaya and from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy animals for slaughter.

loans.name: Melati Putih Group

texts.en: After succeding with the first loan, the Melati Putih Group decided to borrow a new loan for a bigger amount. Now each member gets 1.5M IDR. Kadek will use the loan to purchase piglets and make a good barn. Now her pigs run away in her yard. Kadek has the full support of her husband because the business helps to improve the family income. Kadek hopes this period will be more successful and she will have enough profit to do business without borrowing a loan.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed and to renovate the barn.

loans.name: Adisatu

texts.en: Adisatu  is a trader.  She sells onions, jeans, ladies wear and scarves.  She has been selling these items for some time now.  Adisatu is single and has one child. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her child.  Adisatu will use her loan to purchase more jeans, ladies wear and onions to sell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy jeans, ladies wear and onions

loans.name: Katherina

texts.en:
Katherina lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for five year. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children -- all of them are still in school. 

Katherina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer,  This is her fourth loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SGD 2000 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.  She is 58 years old, married and has five children.  Edna used her last loan to purchase grocery goods to sell. Her business has grown and become successful.  Now she is taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  She hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: buy products to sell

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 37 years old and is married to a teacher who brings in additional income.  They are blessed with four children between the ages of five and seven years.

Reuben practices farming, a business he started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000.  He has requested for a loan worth KES 50,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season.  The anticipated profit will help pay school fees for his children.  He dreams of being a successful farmer in the region.  This is his third loan.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a small trader who operates a grocery shop at Amoanda near Elmina.  She has done this 7 years now.   The items in her grocery shop include milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft  drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish,  biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc.  

Aba is married and has 4 children.  Her husband is a driver.   Aba uses her income to support her husband to pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Aba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy grocery items

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a married lady who has one child.  She is 19 years old and resides in Pangabuan, Tangub City, Philippines.  Amy raises pigs for a living and has been in this business for 5 years.  Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. 

Amy requested a loan of  PHP 5,000 to buy feeding supplies.  She joined GDMPC recently. In the future, Amy wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Sebastiao

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta os pais enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas dispesas.

Saiu de Gaza para Boane a procura de melhores condições, É carpinteiro há mais de 22 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Já teve empréstimo no BCI e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar madeira para o fabrico de portas e janelas, para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, e 9.000.00mt, aplicados na carpintaria.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua carpintaria e comprar uma nova maquina para facilitar no corte da madeira, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. He's married and has three children, all of which attend school. He completed 4th grade and stopped because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports his parents by sending them money to help with their expenses.
He left Gaza for Boane in search of better living conditions. He has been a carpenter for over 22 years and earns an income of about 6.000mt. He uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in his bank account.
He has had one loan with BCI and has managed to repay it without difficulties. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 12.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase wood for making doors and windows, in order to increase the quantity of his merchandise. The previous loans were for 5.000mt and 9.000mt and they were used for carpentry.
He pledges to make his repayments as scheduled. In the future he intends to expand his carpentry business and to purchase a new machine that makes it easier to cut wood. For that purpose he plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make doors and windows.

loans.name: Kembang Kertas Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah lives in Melaya, West Bali. Though Ni Nengah often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.  She has been raising pigs for 10 years.  

Ni Nengah is the head of the Kembang Kertas group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s third loan with MUK.  With the Rp 1,500,000 that Ni Nengah receives, she will purchase three piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising business, she hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy three local pigs and feed

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a farmer in the Litein area of South Rift Kenya with seven years of active farming.  He is married and has three children aged between ten and three years.  He relies on farming as the only source of income for his family.

Erick has requested a loan of 90,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy two dairy cows.  He is focusing on consistently expanding his dairy business in the years to come.  He says effective farming will enable him provide better for his family.

Erick says drought has been a challenge in farming.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena is 38 years old and is from the village of Pangabuan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with 4 children. Efrena works in an agricultural business project raising domestic animals (primarily pigs) to earn an income. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns about Php 5,000 per month. 

In 2011, Efrena joined GDMPC to gain financial services from the cooperative as additional investment for her existing business raising pigs for sale. She requested a loan in the amount of Php 12,000 to purchase feeds for her domestic pigs for their growth and good nourishment. Efrena hopes that continued success in her business will allow her to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 26 years of age with no dependent to care for.   He practices farming, a business he started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

Eric has requested a loan worth KES 50,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season.  The anticipated profit will help him expand in maize farming. He dreams of owning rental houses to make more income.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Tun, 43, is married and resides with her husband and a son in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling traditional cakes for over three years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband runs a business buying junk materials to sell at the junk shop and earns approximately USD 10 per day. Her son is a construction worker who earns about USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s living condition, Tun is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital for her husband’s business to purchase more junk materials to resell. This loan will enable her husband to purchase junk materials in larger amount for resale and generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a junk shop at home and rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide convenient living conditions for her family.

loans.use: buy recycle materials

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 70-year-old businessman. He is married to Mary, a farmer. They are blessed with one child, aged 18 years. He has been in the livestock trading business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. John will use the loan to purchase more goats and sheep for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup for transporting the livestock to different markets.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and sheep for selling.

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en:
The Dewi Fortuna group received another loan from MUK for 22M IDR. There are 11 members in the group and each member gets 2,2M IDR. These loans are used to raise pigs.

Jero Pudak used this loan to buy two superior quality piglets for fattening. The price today is Rp 450.000 per piglet. The remainder of the loan was used to buy feed. To reduce the cost of feed, Jero Pudak is using traditional feed made from banana stems and various kinds of leaves.

Jero Pudak pursues this effort to support the family's economy, particularly the cost of educating her two children.

Jero Pudak is standing in the photo wearing a black shirt

loans.use: To buy two superior quality piglets for fattening

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 10ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É agente polivalente da saúde há mais de 9 anos e negociante há mais de 4 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos e tem um salário de 2.500.00mt, e um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (feijão, refrescos arroz, óleo, farinha, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negócio e criar aves, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the district of Namaacha, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. He's married and has four children, all of which attend school. He completed 10th grade and stopped because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and does not support anyone else.
He has been a community health worker for over 9 years and a businessman for over 4 years. He sells various products. He earns a salary of 2.500mt and profits of about 3.000mt. He uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans with other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 12.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase goods such as beans, refreshments, rice, oil, flour, etc., in order to increase the quantity of his merchandise.
He pledges to make his repayments as scheduled. In the future he intends to expand his business and to raise poultry. For that purpose he plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as beans, refreshments, rice, oil, flour, etc. for selling.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a 34-year-old lady is married to Petrus, a 41-year-old man. They are blessed with five children, namely Klara, 14; Ona, 11; Siprianus, 9; Maria, 7 who are all attending school and Roswita, 5.

Agnes owns a business selling vegetables and corn at a traditional market. Every day she goes to the market to sell her agricultural produce such as corn, cassava leaves, fresh pumpkin leaves, etc. The income from selling the products is spent to buy food for her family.

In order to generate more income, Agnes intends to sell other items such as string beans, gourds, water spinach and mustard greens. She is expecting to generate more income from the business to help Petrus in financing their children’s schooling fees. Therefore, she submitted a loan application to TLM and requested a loan of IDR 5,000,000.

loans.use: To purchase string beans, gourds, water spinach, and mustard greens.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a widow who sells palm oil at Jukwa near Abura. She has been selling palm oil for 10 years now. She has three children.  She is responsible for the upkeep of her children. Abena will use her loan to purchase gallons of oil and palm fruit for her oil. With the new profit from her expanded business, she wishes to produce oil in a large quantity

loans.use: to purchase oil and palm fruit

loans.name: Domingos

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Marracuene, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou para se formar como policial, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É policial no Comando Provincial há mais de 14 anos e tem um salário de 5.118.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Já teve empréstimo no Barclays e conseguiu pagar sem nenhuma dificuldade, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (ferro, cimento, areia, blocos, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 4.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, e 10.000.00mt, aplicados na habitação.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the district of Marracuene, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. He's married and has six children, all of which attend school. He completed 7th grade and stopped in order to become a police officer. He lives with his family in a house he owns and does not support anyone else.
He has been a police officer at the provincial headquarters for over 14 years and earns a salary of 5.118mt. He uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in his bank account.
He has had a loan with Barclays and has managed to repay it without any difficulties. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his 6th loan with Hluvuku. It is for 12.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build his house (iron, cement, sand, bricks, etc.). The previous loans were for 4.000mt, 8.000mt, 8.000mt and 10.000mt, all for housing expenses.
He pledges to make his repayments as scheduled. In the future he intends to finish building and furnishing his home, and for that purpose he plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to build his home (iron, cement, sand, bricks, etc.).

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Sot, 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over 20 years, have an extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening cattle. They earn approximately USD 4 per day. All of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 16 per day. Due to the difficulty of transportation for the family, Sot is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike to use for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a 59-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol.  She is married and has 10 children.  Nena and her husband till their land together and grow rice crops to sell. While her husband mainly manages the rice farm, Nena also runs their sari-sari (variety) store business, which they started a year ago.  She sells items like vinegar, cooking oil, instant noodles and canned goods.  Nena earns 4,000 PHP monthly from her store.

Nena has requested this loan to purchase fertilizer for the farm and more items such as canned goods and noodles to sell in the store.  Nena hopes this loan will help improve their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice farm and more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Diem

texts.en:
Diem is a 23-year-old married woman with a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in a shop producing ice cream. 

Diem supports her family by selling beverages in front of her house. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. The earnings she gets are enough to cover her family's basic living expenses.

Diem would like to get a loan to repair her shop and buy different kinds of beverages to sell to better meet her customers' needs.

She hopes that she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings through the loan.

loans.use: to repair her shop and buy different kinds of beverages to sell

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
This is Madel, 29, resident of Bacoor,Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rene, her business partner, and mother to their two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Madel operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts, and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Madel dreams to be able to give her children a good future and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
25-year-old Lorenzo is a married man from Trinidad, Bohol.  He is a farmer who primarily grows rice crops for sale. Lorenzo hires laborers to help him till his land.  Lorenzo also owns a sari-sari store/cafeteria at the bus terminal of Talibon, Bohol.  Lorenzo's wife manages their cafeteria.

Lorenzo has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, and canned goods, snacks and other items for sale at the store.  Lorenzo hopes his businesses grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and canned goods, snacks and other items for the store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah, 35, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Elmer, 36, a marketing staffer, and is a mother of their two children, both not yet of school age. She keeps herself busy attending to her business. 

Sarah maintains a piggery business. She buys piglets and raises them for four months before selling them in the market. The cost per kilo of live pork is Php130. Every pig, if it was raised and fed well, will weigh about 90-94 kilos. She can have Php5,000 as net income from every pig that she sells.  She earns a minimum of Php650 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php31,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan as additional funding for purchasing more piglets. She will save her profits for future investments. 

Sarah dreams that all her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good life.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow and sustain the daily needs of her family. She wants to have her own dream house someday.  She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* meetings that allows her to share her own story on how great God is by providing her with enough strength to overcome all trials in her life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional piglets needed in her business.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is from Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 75 years old. Dominga is widow and has 11 adult-aged children. Dominga is in retail business selling cooked viand (vegetable with coconut milk). Dominga sell it door to door, roamed around the public. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. Aside from this business she also continued her agriculture business raising pig for sale. Doing this all kind of business really helped her in the day to day living.

Dominga is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy ingredients in selling cooked food  (vegetable with coconut milk). In 2007, Dominga joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in selling cooked viand  (vegetable with coconut milk)

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA UNION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Miriam; ella es soltera y tiene 25 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de golosinas, ella tiene una carreta donde vende caramelos, chupetes, galletas, gaseosas entre otras golosinas, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas al por mayor como chicles, caramelos, galletas al por mayor.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de  venta de gorros, negocio de crianza de animales.

Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal llegaron despues a la reunion,ellas pidieron permiso por motivos de salud

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "LA UNION"; this bank is located in the district of Cusco, belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Miriam, she is single, 25 years old and has 1 son, she works in the business of selling snacks, she has a cart where she sells candy, suckers, cookies, pop and other snacks, she sells in an itinerant manner from 7 AM to 8 PM, through this small business she gets her son ahead, her dream is to have a grocery store.  She requests a loan to buy snacks at wholesale prices such as gum, candy and cookies.  The other members of the group work on: a restaurant, food sales, grocery sales, selling hats, raising livestock. 

The members that were attached to the group photo arrived after the meeting, they asked for permission to miss it because of health reasons.

The member is thankful to those who are part of her dream through Kiva and she commits to make the repayments in the agreed term.

loans.use: to buy snacks at wholesale prices such as gum, candy, cookies.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child. 

George has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

George became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Jerryle

texts.en:
Jerryle is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Jerryle has a vulcanizing shop that provides vehicle repairs. Her husband is the repairman. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the electricity used in the vulcanizing shop.

Jerryle has been a member of HSPFI since 2008  In the future, Jerryle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for electricity used in the vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Darling De Jesus

texts.es: Darling es un humilde agricultor de la zona de la Ceiba ubicada en Masaya, el habita junto a su familia, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar su humilde vivienda  ya que la actual es de madera y tienen serios problemas en tiempos de invierno, Don Darling desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de yuca, la mayor afectación que se le presento fue los grandes chubascos de agua   que se paso llevando gran parte de la plantación, obstruyendo cercos y otros. Pero gracias a Dios y al apoyo que le brinda cada ciclo Kiva logro establecer un cuarto de piña y con eso logro pagar su préstamo , pero ahora el necesita que le apoyen para volver a sembrar yuca ya que en estos momentos no cuenta con los recursos económicos para realizar la plantación .Con el préstamo a va comprar madera de yuca, fertilizantes , herbicidas , fungicidas, urea , entre otros productos .
texts.en: Darling is a humble farmer from the area of La Ceiba, located in Masaya. He lives with his family. His plans for the future are to improve his humble house, since it is currently built of wood and it has serious problems in the winter. Darling has been cultivating cassava for several years. The biggest difficulty he has had was a very heavy rain storm that washed out a large part of his farm, blocking fencing and other things. But thanks to God, and to the support that Kiva provides him every loan cycle, he was able to establish a parcel of pineapples and with that he was able to pay his loan. Now he needs your support so he can plant cassava again, because at this time he doesn’t have the economic resources to plant his farm. With the loan he will buy cassava cuttings, fertilizers, herbicides, fungicides, urea, and other products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es: La señora María, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, ella desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña, la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo como es la mosca blanca, ya que es un insecto difícil de combatir, los planes futuros hacia su vivienda en poder mejorarla ya que está muy deteriorada por los años , doña María es madre soltera y con los pocos recursos económicos de la agricultura logro sacar adelante a su hijos , él mayor ahora le apoya con el cultivo de piña ya que ella se siente muy cansada .El préstamo lo quiere para comprar fertilizante e insumos necesarios para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de piña ya que este tiene un mal color debido a que le hace falta exfoliación .
texts.en: María is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe. She has grown pineapples for several years. The biggest problem she has are the pests that invade her crop, like the white fly, since it is difficult to fight against that insect. Her future plans are to improve her home which has deteriorated over the years.   María is a single mother and has been able to get her children ahead with the little resources she gets from farming. The oldest helps her now with growing the pineapple, since she feels very tired. She wants the loan to buy fertilizer and the necessary materials to maintain her pineapple crop, since it has a bad color due to a lack of exfoliation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and materials.

loans.name: Telson Misael

texts.es: Telson Misael tiene 29 años de edad, trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una de las empresas de la localidad  ya tiene años de estar trabajando en ella. Telson tiene una vivienda en el cual  desde hace rato le ha querido realizar algunas remodelaciones pero con su salario no puede cubrir con todo para realizarlas. Telson está solicitando financiamiento para realizar las remodelaciones a su vivienda lo cual comprara perlines, zinc, cemento, arena entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Telson Misael is 29 years old, he works as a security guard in one of the local companies and has been working there for many years.  Telson has a home to which for a while he has wanted to do renovations on, but with his salary he hasn't been able to work on them.  Telson is requesting a loan to work on the renovations of his home and he will buy metal beams, zinc, concrete, sand and other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy metal beams, zinc, concrete, sand and other construction materials.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman who has two children. She is 55 years old and resides at Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Victoria owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP. She requested a loan of PHP 17,300 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Victoria has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Victoria wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is from San Roque, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur. She is forty-nine years old. Thelma is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Thelma runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many others. Thelma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Thelma is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase products such as shampoo, milk, candies, medicine, junk food, soft drinks, cigarettes and sardines. 

In 2010, Thelma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell such as shampoo, milk, candies, medicine, junk food, soft drinks, cigarettes and sardines.

loans.name: Nesfora

texts.en:
Nesfora, a 44-year-old married mother of five grown children, is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental where she has owned and operated a business cooking and selling a variety of good foods in the local community for over five years. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nesfora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 6,832 PHP to purchase cooking food ingredients such as seasonings and etc., and plans to use the additional revenue arising from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking food ingredients such as seasonings and etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 54 years old and married with eight children. With one child still in school, Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a business buying and selling flowers  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more flowers to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for six years. In the future Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more flowers to sell
